Description: Careers at Rally Health, part of the Optum and UnitedHealth Group family of businesses. Our mission at Rally® is to empower individuals to take control of their health through personalized, data-driven health care information and recommendations that lead to better outcomes. We leverage our digital platform and leading-edge technology to make health care data accessible wherever and whenever people need it, all while ensuring safety and reliability. Here, you’ll help people find the right doctors, give them a clear breakdown of costs, incentivize them to stay focused on their overall health with daily goals, and help them earn rewards such as discounts on a wide range of goods as well as bonuses for reaching fitness objectives. As part of our Rally® team, you’ll have the opportunity to drive change with an innovative healthcare technology company that is dedicated to creating a culture of healthy living. Help us bring real change to healthcare and you’ll experience what it’s like to do your life's best work.(sm) Join Rally Health as a Software Engineer, Data Platform where you will architect and develop infrastructure for our Data Team. As part of the Data Team, you will report to a Data Manager and work with teams across the company. We recognize that people come from diverse backgrounds and skills and welcome all to apply.You will have the flexibility to telecommute* as you take on some tough challenges.Primary ResponsibilitiesDesign, develop, and deploy infrastructure on which data gets collected, aggregated moved, cleansed and transformedOperationalize data insights - from research into fault-tolerant, production-scale deploymentsApply perseverance and imagination, both in writing new software and also deploying existing tools like Airflow, Hadoop, Spark, Jenkins, Docker, Kubernetes and MesosPartner with data scientists and product team to understand their needs and create a platform that empowers themWork with Product and Project Managers to understand the features, do technical assessment, design, code test and deliverYou’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.Required QualificationsBS in Computer Science, Engineering or a related technical role or equivalent experience3+ years of prior software development experienceCoding experience shipping complex software to productionCommand of Scala, Python or Java, or interest in learning ScalaExperience with Kafka, Spark, Hive, HDFS, AirFlow, SQLCommand of data structures, algorithms, performance and scalabilityUnderstanding of fault-tolerant systems, network programming, multithreaded programming and securityExperience with distributed systems and application design in a SOA environmentKnowledge of high-scale performance and optimization tools and techniquesExperience with AWS (configuring, deploying, managing) services and distributed applicationsCareers with Optum. Here's the idea. We built an entire organization around one giant objective; make health care work better for everyone. So when it comes to how we use the world's large accumulation of health-related information, or guide health and lifestyle choices or manage pharmacy benefits for millions, our first goal is to leap beyond the status quo and uncover new ways to serve. Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, brings together some of the greatest minds and most advanced ideas on where health care has to go in order to reach its fullest potential. For you, that means working on high performance teams against sophisticated challenges that matter. Optum, incredible ideas in one incredible company and a singular opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)Colorado Residents Only: The salary range for Colorado residents is $64,800 to $116,000. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, etc. In addition to your salary, UnitedHealth Group offers benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). No matter where or when you begin a career with UnitedHealth Group, you’ll find a far-reaching choice of benefits and incentivesAll Telecommuters will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter PolicyFor more information on our Internal Job Posting Policy, click here.Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.UnitedHealth Group is a drug-free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.Job Keywords: Principal Software Engineer, Data Platform, Chicago, IL, Minneapolis, MN, San Francisco, CA, Washington, DC, Telecommute, Telecommuting, Telecommuter, Work From Home, Remote

Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that is improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation is not about another gadget; it is about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There is no room for error. If you are looking for a better place to use your passion and your desire to drive change, this is the place to be. It's an opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)  At Optum, the mission is clear: Help people live healthier lives and help make the health system work better for everyone.  LHI is one of 4 businesses under OptumServe. OptumServe provides health care services and proven expertise to help federal government agencies modernize the U.S. health system and improve the health and well - being of Americans.  By joining OptumServe you are part of the family of companies that make UnitedHealth Group a leader across most major segments in the U.S. health care system.  LHI was founded in 1999 and acquired by Optum in 2011, LHI specializes in creating and managing health care programs through on - location services, patient - specific in - clinic appointments, telehealth assessments, or any combination based on customer need. LHI's customizable solutions serve the diverse needs of commercial customers, as well as federal and state agencies, including the U.S. Departments of Defense, Veterans Affairs, and Health and Human Services.  As an Associate Software Engineer you will be tasked with developing and maintaining windows, web and web services-based business software applications, systems, components and database objects using Microsoft .NET technologies based on requirements and specifications to support LHI's business operations.  You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.  Primary Responsibilities  Develop software programs and components using VB.net, C#, Angular, TypeScript, Web API, T-SQL and other software development tools and technologies per assigned tasks Debug, test, and troubleshoot written software programs and components Study training materials on .NET, Angular development, programming standards, application architecture, business processes, and functional areas of LHI's business applications Adapt to new programming languages, methodologies, platforms and frameworks to support the needs of LHI’s software projects Adhere to Agile software development methodology  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  1+ years of experience with one to two software programming/scripting languages; experience can include coursework, projects and internships 1+ years of experience with data structures, algorithms and SQL queries; experience can include coursework, projects and internships Solid understanding of Software Development Life Cycle Advanced understanding of Object-Oriented Programming concepts Advanced understanding of relational database concepts and of n-tier application architecture Understanding of Front-end web frameworks United States Citizenship Ability to obtain favorable adjudication following submission of Department of Defense eQuip Form SF86  Preferred Qualifications  BS/BA degree in Computer Science/Information Technology/Computer Engineering/Math/MIS or equivalent combination of education, experience and/or applicable military experience Relevant Technical certifications Agile Scrum certification Software development experience using .NET framework and VB.net/C# Software development experience using T-SQL, LINQ Software development experience using Angular framework, jQuery, TypeScript, Node.js, ASP.NET Web API Experience with Test Driven Development Experience with TFS, Git or similar source control tools Shows an interest in learning more advanced aspects of the functional skills Looks for opportunities to collaborate and start to build networks and relationships before they are needed Demonstrates confidence that tasks will be completed and deliverables will be provided in the midst of competing demands and pressure-filled situations Shows a willingness to take on challenges to increase capabilities and make a larger contribution  As a requirement of UnitedHealth Group's contract with the Department of Defense, this position requires U.S. citizenship and proof of favorable adjudication following submission of Department of Defense eQuip Form SF86, (the National Agency Check Legal and Credit or NACLC). Successful completion of the NACLC process is a requirement for continued employment in this role. NACLC processing will be initiated by our TRICARE Security Officer post-offer and can take 3-6 months for a final decision communication from the Department of Defense. Candidates will be allowed to begin employment with UnitedHealth Group in this role based on an interim clearance, and final results will be communicated as they are received. Failure to obtain final NACLC approval will result in termination from this role.  Optum, a part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, continues to evolve and make a bigger impact through its extensive expertise in combining technology, data and people to create novel health care solutions and services across the globe. OptumServe is following suit by creating and delivering care that meets the health needs of active duty service members, veterans and their families. We're partnering with federal and state government agencies to meet the readiness and health needs of active duty military members and veterans by providing preventive health screenings and assessments to ensure that troops are ready to answer the call of duty. For those who want to intensify their impact in a career that brings together challenge, learning and growth, OptumServe is the right place to do your life’s best work.(sm)  Colorado Residents Only: The salary range for Colorado residents is $53,300 to $95,100. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, etc. In addition to your salary, UnitedHealth Group offers benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). No matter where or when you begin a career with UnitedHealth Group, you’ll find a far-reaching choice of benefits and incentives.  All Telecommuters will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy  Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.  UnitedHealth Group is a drug-free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.  Job Keywords: Software Engineer, Software Developer, Associate Engineer, Software Programs and Components, VB.NET, C#, Angular, Typescript, Web API, T-SQL, .NET, Angular Development, Programming Standards, Application Architecture, Telecommute, Remote, Work From Home

Join us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)  You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.     Primary Responsibilities:  Develop RESTful APIs, microservices and application integrations by leveraging Kafka streaming tech stack Work with public cloud migrations and solutions Analyze all requirements and maintain all architecture business systems and documents Embrace solutions focused on modernization, enablement, and engineering tooling Create quick working proof of concepts to validate and formalize solutions and design Own the overall technical design and direction of the developed product Bring innovative ideas to help continuously improve the Optum product portfolio including the design, build, deploy, test and runtime within cloud ecosystems Participate in debugging and performance tuning in a high-performance cloud platform A great attitude and the passion and persistence to solve complex problems Analyze metrics and measure effectiveness of programs and return of investment goals  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.     Qualifications - External  Required Qualifications:  Undergraduate degree or equivalent experience 4+ years of experience building and shipping production web enabled software in a scaled distributed environment 3+ years of Java experience (preferably java 8+) 3+ years of experience implementing RESTful microservices 3+ years working with git version control 3+ years of experience with Automated Unit Testing and Integration Testing Hands on development using container virtualization utilizing Docker and CICD using Jenkins Hands on development experience using UI framework Knowledge of Continuous Integration and Deployment Strategies If you need to enter a work site for any reason, you will be required to screen for symptoms using the ProtectWell mobile app, Interactive Voice Response (i.e., entering your symptoms via phone system) or similar UnitedHealth Group-approved symptom screener. When in a UnitedHealth Group building, employees are required to wear a mask in common areas. In addition, employees must comply with any state and local masking orders  Technology Careers with Optum. Information and technology have amazing power to transform the health care industry and improve people's lives. This is where it's happening. This is where you'll help solve the problems that have never been solved. We're freeing information so it can be used safely and securely wherever it's needed. We're creating the very best ideas that can most easily be put into action to help our clients improve the quality of care and lower costs for millions. This is where the best and the brightest work together to make positive change a reality. This is the place to do your life's best work.(sm)  Colorado Residents Only: The salary range for Colorado residents is $79,700 to $142,600. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, etc. As of the date of this posting, In addition to your salary, UHG offers the following benefits for this position, subject to applicable eligibility requirements: Health, dental, and vision plans; wellness program; flexible spending accounts; paid parking or public transportation costs; 401(k) retirement plan; employee stock purchase plan; life insurance, short-term disability insurance, and long-term disability insurance; business travel accident insurance; Employee Assistance Program; PTO; and employee-paid critical illness and accident insurance.   *All Telecommuters will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy.     Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.  UnitedHealth Group is a drug-free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.     Job Keywords: Senior Software Engineer, telecommute, telecommuter, remote, work from home, Eden Prairie, MN, Minnesota, Java, RESTful, Docker, Jenkins, Git, microservices

UnitedHealthcare is a company that's on the rise. We're expanding in multiple directions, across borders and, most of all, in the way we think. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about transforming the health care industry. Ready to make a difference? Make yourself at home with us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)Begin your career at UnitedHealth Group and you’ll get an opportunity to do something extraordinary with your first job out of school: make a real difference. We have modest goals: Help millions of people live healthier lives. Change the landscape of health care forever. Leave the world a better place than we found it. Such aspirations attract a certain type of person. Crazy talented. Brilliant. Compassionate. Driven. To these select few, we offer the global reach, resources and can-do culture of a Fortune 5 company. You’ll find a world of career options fueled by your performance and limited only by imagination. Start here.Here’s the idea. We built focused businesses, inside UnitedHealth Group, organized around one giant objective; make health care work better for everyone. Through our two business platforms, UnitedHealthcare and Optum, we work to improve the health care system and advance the health and well-being of individuals and communities so that they can enjoy better, fuller lives. For you, that means working on high performance teams against sophisticated challenges. It’s a culture of optimism that’s not like any place you’ve ever worked. Many incredible ideas in one incredible company.We have an exciting opportunity to join the team as an Associate Software Engineer. You will be placed in technical positions with frequent exposure to senior leaders, businesses and technologies. You will have the ability to make meaningful contributions to the company and help people live healthier lives.This role includes but are not limited to analysis, design, coding, engineering, testing, debugging, standards, methods, tools analysis, documentation, research and development, maintenance, new development, operations and delivery. With every role in the company, each position has a requirement for building quality into every output. This also includes evaluating new tools, new techniques, strategies; Automation of common tasks; build of common utilities to drive organizational efficiency with a passion around technology and solutions and influence of thought and leadership on future capabilities and opportunities to apply technology in new and innovative ways.Software engineering is the application of engineering to the design, development, implementation, testing and maintenance of software in a systematic method. The roles in this function will cover all primary development activity across all technology functions that ensure we deliver code with high quality for our applications, products and services and to understand customer needs and to develop product roadmaps.If you are located in Pacific Standard Time (PST) time zone, you will have the flexibility to telecommute* as you take on some tough challenges.Primary ResponsibilitiesPerform all phases of software development lifecycle including requirement analysis, design, development and testing (unit testing, automation, deployment, and support)Provide support in critical production support issue resolution as needed in DevOps teamsSupport the team for application availability, reliability and stabilityWork with team to achieve timely resolution of all production issues meeting or exceeding Service Level AgreementsEstablish, refine and integrate development and test environment tools and software as neededParticipate in an Agile / Scrum methodology to deliver high-quality software and Attend Agile ceremoniesPush for technology solutions that create a better work environment / experience for developersWork with the dev team and product management to create next-gen featuresYou’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.Required QualificationsBachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or related disciplineExperience in development of Health Care Systems or Managed Care SystemsProficient in .NET programming (C++, C#, ASP.NET), MVC, Entity FrameworkProficient at writing SQL queries, stored Job Title: IT Software Engineer - Greenwood Village, CO
Description: Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that's improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There's no room for error. Join us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)  Do you want to play with the latest technologies with a fast-paced company? Do you have the hunger to tackle a myriad of complex challenges and the desire to learn something new every day?  At Optum Digital, the IT team works with teammates from all over the country. We support Windows and Apple computers, multiple 3rd party applications and help maintain and test networks, servers, and conference room equipment. An IT support engineer collaborates with the facilities staff and security to carry critical projects and business functions.  Primary Responsibilities  Check the ticket queue to ensure that new and outstanding requests are appropriately assigned and prioritized Liaise directly with and support the Security, Compliance, and Networking teams Assist end-users with troubleshooting of network and WiFi related issues Assist staff with the installation, configuration, and ongoing usability of desktop and laptop computers, peripheral equipment, and software Diagnose and resolve technical hardware and software issues involving internet connectivity, email clients, and VoIP Work with support contacts to resolve technical problems with the computing equipment and software Ensure computers interconnect seamlessly with diverse systems, including associated validation systems, file servers, email servers, computer conferencing systems, authentication servers, firewalls, SaaS systems, and application servers Develop documentation and identify inconsistencies/issues with our existing processes Identify and own initiatives and projects for improving the IT standards within the department and across the company Maintain a high standard of quality for conference room audiovisual equipment Provide onsite support to individuals at the office when needed Assist with answering IT helpdesk line (IT Emergency call queue) Document complex administrative functions through the use of company-provided tools Provide IT onboarding to our new hires Maintain and keep track of IT inventory  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  3+ years of relevant technical experience supporting users in a mixed Mac and Windows environment Demonstrated technical knowledge with Windows and Apple Operating Systems Experience with firewalls, routers, and general network fundamentals Some Telephonic Administration knowledge must be on either 8x8, RingCentral, Five9, Revation, Genesys, or a similar VoIP platform Above-average knowledge in Microsoft Office Suites (Outlook, Word, Excel, OneNote, PowerPoint, OneDrive for Business) Familiarity with Google Workspace (Gmail, Docs, Sheets, Slides, GDrive) Flexible on working hours and may work mornings, evenings, and weekends when needed Full COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement of this role. UnitedHealth Group will adhere to all federal, state and local regulations as well as all client requirements and will obtain necessary proof of vaccination prior to employment to ensure compliance  Preferred Qualifications  Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or Information Technology Ability to multitask and work in a fast-paced technical environment Experience with Salesforce systems CompTIA’s A+, JAMF 200, and Network+ certification preferred; MCSE: Desktop Infrastructure Experience with at least some of the following: Atlassian products (Jira & Confluence), Slack, Meraki Apps, firewalls, AV hardware (Polycom, Chromeboxes, and Dolby Voice), JAMF, Desktop Central, Python script, AWS, Azure Experience with vulnerabilities management Creating software deployment packaging Understanding of cloud technologies and migrating on-prem to the cloud  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status.  Technology Careers with Optum. Information and technology have amazing power to transform the health care industry and improve people's lives. This is where it's happening. This is where you'll help solve the problems that have never been solved. We're freeing information so it can be used safely and securely wherever it's needed. We're creating the very best ideas that can most easily be put into action to help our clients improve the quality of care and lower costs for millions. This is where the best and the brightest work together to make positive change a reality. This is the place to do your life's best work.(sm)  Colorado Residents Only: The salary range for Colorado residents is $64,800 to $116,000. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, etc. In addition to your salary, UnitedHealth Group offers benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). No matter where or when you begin a career with UnitedHealth Group, you’ll find a far-reaching choice of benefits and incentives.  Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.  UnitedHealth Group is a drug-free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.  Job Keywords: IT Software Engineer, Greenwood Village, CO, Colorado

Job Title: Sr. Software Engineer- Seattle or Telecommute
Description: Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that’s improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation isn’t about another gadget, it’s about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliable. There’s no room for error. Join us and start doing your life’s best work. (sm)  Join a team dedicated to simplifying healthcare, enabling consumers and lowering costs thru innovative technology and services. Optum’s enterprise software products and services help health insurers grow and retain members while by providing cutting edge web enabled tools, web services and cloud technology that reduce paper and manual steps in the healthcare sales and underwriting process.  As Sr. Software Engineer and Technology Consultant, you will work as an Optum Engineer and developer to create cutting edge applications that support complex healthcare transactions. You will work closely with internal Optum product and engineering teams in validating priority and feature requests for major product releases and how these align to customer needs. Project work will include working directly with client business and technology staff to document and develop enterprise scalable solutions. Required Qualifications  Undergraduate degree or equivalent experience 3+ years of current experience with languages such as Java, C# or JavaScript/TypeScript as an engineer 2+ years of software engineering and processes experience: design patterns, algorithms, data structures, schemas and queries, system design, unit testing, code reviews, agile and dev-ops, as well as industry patterns for application architecture and integration 2+ years of Experience working with teams that leveraged three or more of the following: continuous integration / continuous delivery tools, REST API development, serverless architecture, containerization, IaC, public / private cloud, web applications, web services, application observability and/or messaging/ stream architecture 2+ years of IT full-stack engineering experience 2+ years of writing unit or integration tests 1+ years of Production experience with cloud technologies Full COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement of this role. UnitedHealth Group will adhere to all federal, state and local regulations as well as all client requirements and will obtain necessary proof of vaccination prior to employment to ensure compliance.  Preferred Qualifications  Instrumenting apps with Prometheus/Grafana, and creating effective alarms and dashboards Log indexing tools (e.g. ELK stack, Datadog, Splunk, Sumologic) SRE principles (error budgets, alarming practices, etc) Healthcare domain background Development experience in .NET CORE, Docker, Cloud, Kubernetes, Angular 2+, Message Queues Experience with technologies such as: HTML/Javascript, TestCafe, NodeJS, Git, JEST or SOA  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status. Careers at Rally Health, part of the Optum and UnitedHealth Group family of businesses. Our mission at Rally® is to empower individuals to take control of their health through personalized, data-driven health care information and recommendations that lead to better outcomes. We leverage our digital platform and leading-edge technology to make health care data accessible wherever and whenever people need it, all while ensuring safety and reliability. Here, you’ll help people find the right doctors, give them a clear breakdown of costs, incentivize them to stay focused on their overall health with daily goals, and help them earn rewards such as discounts on a wide range of goods as well as bonuses for reaching fitness objectives. As part of our Rally® team, you’ll have the opportunity to drive change with an innovative healthcare technology company that is dedicated to creating a culture of healthy living. Help us bring real change to healthcare and you’ll experience what it’s like to do your life's best work.(sm)  Join Rally Health as a Senior Front End Engineer. The Core Accounts team owns the front door to all Rally products. The team works on projects and code that impact the entire company, and lets users securely access all of their healthcare needs . You will help create lightweight, scalable features. Working with a diverse team, you will help develop responsive web apps that look and work great across multiple devices. We recognize that people come from diverse backgrounds and skills and welcome all to apply.  You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within United States as you take on some tough challenges.  Primary Responsibilities  Create usable and standard accessibility compliant web applications Use modern JS libraries and frameworks like React Write reusable code using Sass & TypeScript, initiate refactoring Frequently test your code with modern JS testing frameworks and tools Ensure the code is compatible with major modern browsers Apply coding patterns and best practices Use RESTful APIs and asynchronous JS Produce and deploy secure code Provide meaningful contribution to code review  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  BS in Computer Science, Engineering or a related technical role or the equivalent experience 4+ years experience with hands-on front-end frameworks 4+ years of experience with JavaScript / HTML / CSS 4+ years of experience with Single Page or Progressive Web Applications Design experience using architecture patterns of large, high-scale applications Understanding of performance and scale tradeoffs Experience working with CICD pipelines  Preferred Qualifications  2+ years of experience with TypeScript 2+ years of experience with React 2+ years of experience with Redux or state management library  Careers with Optum. Here's the idea. We built an entire organization around one giant objective; make health care work better for everyone. So when it comes to how we use the world's large accumulation of health-related information, or guide health and lifestyle choices or manage pharmacy benefits for millions, our first goal is to leap beyond the status quo and uncover new ways to serve. Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, brings together some of the greatest minds and most advanced ideas on where health care has to go in order to reach its fullest potential. For you, that means working on high performance teams against sophisticated challenges that matter. Optum, incredible ideas in one incredible company and a singular opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)  Colorado Residents Only: The salary range for Colorado residents is $79,700 to $142,600. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, etc. In addition to your salary, UnitedHealth Group offers benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). No matter where or when you begin a career with UnitedHealth Group, you’ll find a far-reaching choice of benefits and incentives  All Telecommuters will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy  Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: OptumCare is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employers and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. Job Title: Senior Software Engineer -Telecommute in MN, NJ, CO, CA, TX
Description: Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that's improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There's no room for error. Join us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)  We are looking for high-aptitude individuals who are passionate about technology and have a strong desire to learn and grow. The ideal candidate for this role is motivated, collaborative, energized and has a creative thought process. They are a team player possessing strong analytical as well as technical skills and are able to communicate the logic behind technical decisions. They must be comfortable working in an agile environment and have the ability to take the wheel when necessary.  As a Full Stack Developer, you will be a key member of the team helping to drive full (and correct) adoption of modern software engineering & delivery practices ('Real' Agile, TDD, ATDD, Stateless Design, Microservices, Containerization, CICD, Cloud, etc.). You will also be responsible for interfacing and influencing with the business lines as well as others across IT.  If you are located in Texas, New Jersey, California, Colorado, or Minnesota, you will have the flexibility to telecommute* as you take on some tough challenges.  Primary Responsibilities  Development in Java, Spring Boot, Microservices, API while providing expertise in the full software development lifecycle, from concept and design to testing, designing, developing, and delivering high-volume, low-latency applications for mission-critical systems Write well-designed, testable, efficient code Ensure designs are in compliance with specifications and deliver superior engineering outcomes Participate in technical solution and design discussions Perform proofs of concept and comprehensive solutions throughout the development lifecycle Utilize open-source tools, automation, and cloud services to implement enterprise DevOps solutions Add new features while improving efficiency, reliability, and scalability to address client needs  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  Experience developing enterprise applications using J2EE/JEE technologies Expertise in creating and consuming REST-based APIs and Web-based applications Experience with front-end design and development (Bootstrap, HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript libraries, JQuery, Ajax, Tiles, Angular) Experience with Test Driven Development (TDD) Environments and committed to automated testing a plus (JUnit, Cucumber, Selenium)  Preferred Qualifications  BS in Computer Science or other STEM fields Demonstrated hands-on experience with Cloud solutions Experience working in Agile environments and understanding of Agile Scrum methodology Ability to learn and apply new technologies quickly Solid written and verbal communication skills Excitement and eagerness to learn new technologies Passion for IT development and desire to gain in-depth knowledge Interest in web programming and object-oriented design  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status. Job Title: Senior Software Engineer - Basking Ridge, NJ or Telecommute
Description: Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that is improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation is not about another gadget; it is about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There is no room for error. If you are looking for a better place to use your passion and your desire to drive change, this is the place to be. It's an opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)  The health solutions marketplace is hungry for new ideas, innovative products and software that drives elevated performance for the business and the customer. Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, is feeding incredible solutions to that marketplace every day by bringing out the best in our software engineering teams. We serve customers across the health system. Not only do we have more of them every day, we also have more technology, greater data resources and far broader expertise than any competitor anywhere. We’re out to change the way our businesses and consumers engage with technology. If you’re in, you’ll be challenged like never before. It’s time to join this history making.  As a Senior Java Software Engineer you will be part of the team that is improving provider experience within applications in Optum and transforming it to a modernized platform. If you ever wanted to be part of major application redesign, this is the position for you. From solution design, to development, performance tuning, acceptance test and implementation you will be and hands on agent of change.  The complexity of this role can be challenging. We deal with huge amounts of data across our entire enterprise. Everything you work on will have implications that impact others. We’ll provide the most up-to-date technology, but you’ll need to provide creativity, critical thinking and clarity on an everyday basis.  You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within United States as you take on some tough challenges.  Primary Responsibilities  Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and continuously improve software Translate product concepts into project commitments that deliver incremental value to our customers frequently and with high quality Participate in Agile / Scrum methodology to deliver high-quality software releases Performing all phases of software engineering including requirements analysis, application design, code, test, deploy, and support Review code and provide feedback relative to best practices and improving performance Troubleshoot production support issues post-deployment and come up with solutions as required Be innovative in solution design and development to meet the needs of the business Working very closely with Architecture group and driving technical solutions Expected to adapt in dynamic and collaborative work environment and make independent decision Collaborate to meet project timelines  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  4+ years of coding experience with one or more of the follow languages: Java, Go, Python or JavaScript with a willingness and ability to learn new ones Experience working with at least one of the following: continuous integration / continuous delivery tools, REST API development, serverless architecture, containerization, IaC, public / private cloud, application observability and/or messaging / stream architecture Experience working within an Agile / Scrum Methodology Solid understanding of engineering fundamentals: unit testing, code reviews, Agile and DevOps  Preferred Qualifications  Development experience in Java and related tools / software Experience working in the healthcare industry Business rule engine experience Experience working in Unix / Linux environments Understanding of distributed architecture design principles Ability to communicate effectively to both technical and non-technical audiences Local to Basking Ridge, NJ  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status. Leading edge technology in an industry that's improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There's no room for error. Join us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)  OptumServe’s mission is to help federal agencies tackle some of the biggest challenges in health care by partnering with the Departments of Health and Human Services, Defense, Veterans Affairs and other organizations to modernize the U.S. health system and improve the health and well-being of citizens across the country. The OptumServe Technology Services’ business unit focuses on health information technology and how to further federal customers’ missions by continually looking for ways to increase efficiency and thereby, lower costs.   OptumServe Technology Services is looking for a Lead Software Engineer to provide design and development support, as well as technical analysis and research as part of a broader strategy to grow technical competencies and support federal customer needs. The Senior Software Engineer will be responsible for developing and implementing cloud-based technologies including tools and services, as well as proofs of concept and other research and development needs.   It is expected that the Lead Software Engineer will have the ability and willingness to quickly learn new tools, conduct necessary research on various tools and technologies, and make recommendations for which tools best meet federal customer use cases. In addition, the Lead Software Engineer will provide hands-on development support for developing various software and applications such as data processing programs, data ingestion and transfer scripting, automation programming, and so forth.  You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within United States as you take on some tough challenges.     Primary Responsibilities:   Assesses requirements, use cases and customer needs to make recommendations on technical tools and services as part of solutions and pilots  Serves as a key resource in developing key applications and programs in support of broader strategy and customer needs  Solves complex problems as they arise in vetting new technology and develops innovative solutions as applicable  Focuses on quality of work and continuous improvement for developing code and setting up tools and applications in the cloud  Provides clear explanations and recommendations to other on complex issues including working with vendors as applicable on debugging, troubleshooting or research  Adheres to deadlines and delivers on tasks assigned ensuring transparency with challenges, and proactively identifies mitigations and solutions to ensure tasks are complete on-time  Reviews work performance by others and provides recommendations for improvement  Collaborates with organizational leadership to understand strategy and needs to ensure recommendations and results align with expectations  Collects input from other team members as well as internal and external stakeholders to fold into implementation or develop new ideas for delivering results   You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.     Qualifications - External  Required Qualifications:   5+ years software, data and/or related engineering experience  Experience working in multiple cloud environments, especially AWS and familiarity with cloud-native tools and services  Experience with Python  Experience working with cloud - native big data platforms such as Snowflake data warehouse as a service Experience with DevSecOps tools and building CI/CD pipelines  Understanding of cutting - edge technologies      Preferred Qualifications:   Certification in cloud or related technology Experience working with CMS projects and other federal customers especially in a cloud-hosted system  Experience in multiple programming languages such as PySpark, Java, Scala Experience working with cloud-native programming, analytics and modeling tools such as Databricks     Careers with Optum. Here's the idea. We built an entire organization around one giant objective; make health care work better for everyone. So when it comes to how we use the world's large accumulation of health-related information, or guide health and lifestyle choices or manage pharmacy benefits for millions, our first goal is to leap beyond the status quo and uncover new ways to serve. Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, brings together some of the greatest minds and most advanced ideas on where health care has to go in order to reach its fullest potential. For you, that means working on high performance teams against sophisticated challenges that matter. Description: Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that's improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There's no room for error. Join us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)  The health solutions marketplace is hungry for new ideas, innovative products and software that drives elevated performance for the business and the customer. Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, is feeding incredible solutions to that marketplace every day by bringing out the best in our software engineering teams. We serve customers across the health system. Not only do we have more of them every day, we also have more technology, greater data resources and far broader expertise than any competitor anywhere. We’re out to change the way our businesses and consumers engage with technology. If you’re in, you’ll be challenged like never before. It’s time to join this history making.  As a Senior Software Engineer you will be part of the team that is improving provider experience within applications in Optum and transforming it to a modernized platform. If you ever wanted to be part of major application redesign, this is the position for you. From solution design, to development, performance tuning, acceptance test and implementation you will be and hands on agent of change.  The complexity of this role can be challenging. We deal with huge amounts of data across our entire enterprise. Everything you work on will have implications that impact others. We’ll provide the most up-to-date technology, but you’ll need to provide creativity, critical thinking and clarity on an everyday basis.  Primary Responsibilities  Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and continuously improve software Translate product concepts into project commitments that deliver incremental value to our customers frequently and with high quality Participate in Agile/Scrum methodology to deliver high-quality software releases Performing all phases of software engineering including requirements analysis, application design, code, test, deploy, and support Review code and provide feedback relative to best practices and improving performance Troubleshoot production support issues post-deployment and come up with solutions as required Be innovative in solution design and development to meet the needs of the business Working very closely with Architecture group and driving technical solutions Expected to adapt in dynamic and collaborative work environment and make independent decision Collaborate to meet project timelines  You'll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in. When in a UnitedHealth Group building, employees are required to wear a mask in common areas. In addition, employees must comply with any state and local masking orders  Preferred Qualifications Development experience in Java and related tools/software Experience working in the healthcare industry Business rule engine experience Experience working in Unix/Linux environments Experience with the following: Streaming technology i.e. Kafka Cloud - Open Shift Database - NoSQL, DB2 Microservice architecture Web Development - React, Angular Understanding of distributed architecture design principles  Technology Careers with Optum. Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that's improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There's no room for error. Join us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)  The health solutions marketplace is hungry for new ideas, innovative products and software that drives elevated performance for the business and the customer. Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, is feeding incredible solutions to that marketplace every day by bringing out the best in our software engineering teams. We serve customers across the health system. Not only do we have more of them every day, we also have more technology, greater data resources and far broader expertise than any competitor anywhere. We’re out to change the way our businesses and consumers engage with technology. If you’re in, you’ll be challenged like never before. It’s time to join this history making.  Optum Store (https://store.optum.com) is part of Optum’s new Direct-to-Consumer group which sits at the intersection of health care and retail, curating product offerings through a virtual marketplace that provides consumers with more affordable access to care. To build those products, we are looking for a strong engineer who embodies our team values of Always be shipping, Outcome Obsession, Constant Vigilance (against threats and downtime), Simplification (of our technology landscape), and Software as a Team Sport. In this role, you will interact with multiple stakeholders and deal with significant complexity and ambiguity.  As a principal software engineer your role will be to evangelize, influence and implement the technology strategy for Optum Store delivery teams. You will focus on the biggest needs across the organization and develop reusable components, patterns, and tooling to address them. You will Influence org behaviors, through code reviews, tech talks, and hands on design sessions. You will partner with delivery teams outside the direct-to-consumer org to uphold and negotiate common standards. In addition to your technical responsibilities, you will partner with business delivery leadership to conceptualize solutions that meet their complex needs. Your outcomes will be a primary contributor to achieving Optum Store’s long-term strategic goals.  Primary Responsibilities  Design, develop, test, deploy, monitor, maintain, and continuously improve software Translate product concepts into project commitments that deliver incremental value to our customers frequently and with high quality Focus on the biggest needs across the organization and develop reusable components, patterns and tooling to address them. Actively mentor the engineering team through code reviews, tech talks, and hands on design sessions. Adapt to and remain effective in a changing environment Evangelize and uphold our engineering values of Always be shipping, Outcome Obsession, Constant Vigilance (against threats and downtime), Simplification (of our technology landscape), and Software as a Team Sport  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  10+ years of coding experience with one or more of the follow languages JavaScript, Java, .NET Core, or Python with a willingness and ability to learn new ones Excellent understanding of engineering fundamentals: testing automation, code reviews, telemetry, iterative delivery and DevOps Experience working with five or more of the following: continuous integration & continuous delivery tools, REST API development, serverless architecture, containerization, IaC, public / private cloud, application observability and/or messaging / stream architecture Experience with polyglot storage architectures including relational, columnar, key-value, graph or equivalent Experience delivering applications using componentized and distributed architectures Demonstrated ability to communicate effectively to both technical and non-technical, globally distributed audiences Solid foundations in formal architecture, design patterns and best practices  Preferred Qualifications  Experience working in the healthcare, pharmacy, or eCommerce industries Experience working in public cloud environments GCP, Azure, AWS Experience delivering reusable components, patterns, and tools Track record of mentoring and growing team talent  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status. This is where you'll help solve the problems that have never been solved. We're freeing information so it can be used safely and securely wherever it's needed. We're creating the very best ideas that can most easily be put into action to help our clients improve the quality of care and lower costs for millions. This is where the best and the brightest work together to make positive change a reality. This is the place to do your life's best work.(sm)  All Telecommuters will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy. Job Title: Senior Software Engineer, Engagement - Telecommute in Multiple Locations
Description: Careers at Rally Health, part of the Optum and UnitedHealth Group family of businesses. Our mission at Rally® is to empower individuals to take control of their health through personalized, data-driven health care information and recommendations that lead to better outcomes. We leverage our digital platform and leading-edge technology to make health care data accessible wherever and whenever people need it, all while ensuring safety and reliability. Here, you’ll help people find the right doctors, give them a clear breakdown of costs, incentivize them to stay focused on their overall health with daily goals, and help them earn rewards such as discounts on a wide range of goods as well as bonuses for reaching fitness objectives. As part of our Rally® team, you’ll have the opportunity to drive change with an innovative healthcare technology company that is dedicated to creating a culture of healthy living. Help us bring real change to healthcare and you’ll experience what it’s like to do your life's best work.(sm)  The Engagement team offers seamless navigation and guidance across Rally helping users connect with the services they need to maintain and improve their health and make the best decisions. It enables employers by supporting their entire population's benefits and programs. The solutions include on-boarding, dashboards and resources, emails, SMS and content, the Rally app, third-party programs, and campaigns. As a Senior Software Engineer you will report to the Engineering Manager of the team. We recognize that people come from diverse backgrounds and skills and welcome all to apply.  Primary Responsibilities  Build scalable systems, libraries, and frameworks Contribute to frontend code using React and Angular frameworks Work with your team to create test plans and ensure quality Help automate our certification process Monitor production systems and provide on-call support  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  5+ years of real industry experience Background in Java or another compiled language Interest in learning Scala, or exposure to other functional programming languages Unit testing experience Commercial experience with distributed, high-performance systems Experience with cloud-based services and hosting Experience integrating with third party APIs, and the ability to understand them in multiple formats Experience developing APIs and web microservices Experience with version control systems, e.g. Git Exposure to Javascript/Typescript-based frameworks like Angular/ReactNative  Preferred Qualification  Experience with AWS EC2 Experience with Scala BS in Computer Science, Engineering or a related technical role or the equivalent experience  Careers with Optum. Job Title: Senior Principal Software Engineer - Telecommute in Seattle, WA; Eden Prairie, MN; New York City, NY
Description: UnitedHealth Group is a company that's on the rise. We're expanding in multiple directions, across borders and, most of all, in the way we think. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about transforming the health care industry. Ready to make a difference? Make yourself at home with us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)  Software engineering is the application of engineering to the design, development, implementation, testing and maintenance of software in a systematic method. The roles in this function will cover all primary development activity across all technology functions that ensure we deliver code with high quality for our applications, products and services and to understand customer needs and to develop product roadmaps.  These roles include, but are not limited to analysis, design, coding, engineering, testing, debugging, standards, methods, tools analysis, documentation, research and development, maintenance, new development, operations and delivery. With every role in the company, each position has a requirement for building quality into every output. This also includes evaluating new tools, new techniques, strategies; Automation of common tasks; build of common utilities to drive organizational efficiency with a passion around technology and solutions and influence of thought and leadership on future capabilities and opportunities to apply technology in new and innovative ways.  If you are located in Seattle, WA, Eden Prairie, MN, or New York, NY, you will have the flexibility to telecommute* as you take on some tough challenges.  Primary Responsibilities  Lead, inspire and set the vision for the OptumLabs’ architecture and technical roadmap You will be responsible for transformative changes to our architecture and drive OptumLabs’ technical strategy You will evaluate and make decisions around the use of new or existing technologies and tools, influence other Principals, Directors, and their technical teams to build the right systems that can scale to the needs of the business Design, develop and deliver strategically significant or demanding software that changes how we engineer solutions Build exemplary architecture solutions in terms of efficiency, stability, extensibility, and the ability to evolve over time Their coding practices are exemplary in terms of code organization, clarity, simplicity, error handling, and documentation Able to decompose significantly complex engineering problems into straightforward solutions Can take the lead on projects that may require the work of several teams to implement Able to take responsibility for the overall architecture of a major product or medium-sized organization, aligning the teams that own that software towards a coherent system strategy Ability to decompose a software architecture into components that can be owned and developed by different engineering teams Able to communicate component divisions in a way that allows individual teams to work mostly independently Current on advanced technical issues, technologies, and trends Industry thought leader Practice SME Develops solutions that transform the industry  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field Undergraduate degree in applicable area of expertise or equivalent experience 10+ years of software engineering experience, with a proven track record of leading large-scale projects Proven track record of leading the delivery of large-scale, high-quality systems  Preferred Qualifications  Advanced degree in computer science, or related field 3+ years of experience as leader for technical, customer facing roles with demonstrated experiences hiring and developing key talent Demonstrated experience working cross-group with Director and VP-level technical leaders Highly skilled and experienced at creating internal alignment across roles (Engineering, Product, Marketing, Finance, etc.) for strategic projects Demonstrated ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical audiences at the C-level Hands-on experience with development of ML-based products Exceptional interpersonal and relationship management skills Solid problem-solving skills: the ability to analyze problems and develop actionable and appropriate tactical plans quickly Exceptional communication skills Excellent problem-solving skills Highly organized individual  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status. Such aspirations tend to attract a certain type of person. Crazy talented. Compassionate. Driven. To these select few, we offer the global reach, resources and can-do culture of a Fortune 5 company. Job Title: Senior I O Engineering Specialist - Remote
Description: Optum is a company that's on the rise. We're expanding in multiple directions, across borders and, most of all, in the way we think. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about transforming the health care industry. Ready to make a difference? Make yourself at home with us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)  As part of our OptumRx team, in this role you will play a significant part in supporting the IBMi infrastructure for RxClaims. This position will perform level 1 monitoring of all IBMi environments. The team is responsible for 24x7x365 monitoring all IBMi lpars, along with processing all backups. This position will monitor the IBMi RxClaim health, Sterling Integrator file delivery, Robot batch jobs on IBMi, Tidal jobs and all IBMi servers and storage.  You'll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* as you take on some tough challenges.  Primary Responsibilities  The monitor position has 24/7/365 coverage for the following applications: All IBMi lpars, Robot scheduler and console, Tidal scheduler, and Sterling Integrator. The monitor team answers messages where the correct response can be determined, and triages errors to the correct team, depending on the contents or ‘location’ of the message. Responsible for processes, training, continuous improvement, system automation. System health monitoring of: Claim adjudication jobs, ASP alerts, CPU alerts, Claims queue monitoring, Storage monitoring, Connect Direct subsystem, Contact different teams if requested by on-call For application upgrade events, place job queues on HOLD for MOD and Patch instances, Responsible for performing and monitoring all backups on the IBMi Platform. Robot Job Monitoring: Research and react to robot job messages, Monitor jobs that are running outside of normal parameters, Reset inbound automation, MAC file processing completion, Robot job queue health, Submit – Hold – Release robot jobs, Payment balancing, Collaborate with Client Programs team, Eligibility team, Accumulator team, Account Management, to understand robot job failures and messages, Knowledge of job types and their importance, Alert necessary personnel for Reference File issues, Complete audit process for failed Robot jobs, Inbound robot job monitoring. Sterling Integrator monitoring: Monitor Database usage, In Error Business Process Usage, Stagnant Message alerts, IRIS file delivery is run through Sterling Integrator, EDI 835 Payment files, Scriptmed, EskerFax, Sterling Integrator file delivery errors [first and second level research] Tidal job monitoring: Monitor all servers, Submit – Hold – Release jobs, Mark jobs as complete, Engage Tidal Admins when jobs fail, Alert business partners of failed jobs, Billing and Payment services jobs, Tidal completes a number of automatic monitoring processes.  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in. Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that's improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There's no room for error. Join us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)  LHI is one of 4 businesses under OptumServe. OptumServe provides health care services and proven expertise to help federal government agencies modernize the U.S. health system and improve the health and well - being of Americans.  By joining OptumServe you are part of the family of companies that make UnitedHealth Group a leader across most major segments in the U.S. health care system.  LHI was founded in 1999 and acquired by Optum in 2011, LHI specializes in creating and managing health care programs through on - location services, patient - specific in - clinic appointments, telehealth assessments, or any combination based on customer need. LHI's customizable solutions serve the diverse needs of commercial customers, as well as federal and state agencies, including the U.S. Departments of Defense, Veterans Affairs, and Health and Human Services.  As a Software Engineering Manager, you will be tasked with leading a team responsible for developing and maintaining windows, web and web services-based business software applications, systems, components and database objects using Microsoft .NET technologies based on requirements and specifications to support LHI's business operations.  You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.  Primary Responsibilities  Coordinate, supervise and is accountable for the daily activities of business support, technical or production team or unit Impact of work is most often at the team level  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  BS/BA degree in Computer Science/Information Technology/Computer Engineering/Math/MIS or related field 5+ years of experience with Software Development Life Cycle 2+ years of software development supervisory experience 4+ years of either software development experience using .NET, Angular frameworks, or 4+ years of experience in Test automation or both 2+ years of experience in Agile development methodologies preferably Agile Scrum Able to match all communication to the receiver–in content, tone and best-method delivery and provide timely, appropriate, accurate and organized information to help others understand Able to monitor and guide team capabilities and deliverables, Provide clarity to team processes, roles, skills and deliverables Able to successfully implement organizational and team changes, new technologies and processes efficiently Able to anticipate conflict before it occurs, Foster continuous discussion and openness to help people constructively manage conflict Able to identifies innovative approaches and explain how the team’s processes align with industry best practices Enable active participation in learning activities to build skills and creates opportunities for practice of new techniques and methods United States Citizenship Ability to obtain favorable adjudication following submission of Department of Defense eQuip Form SF86 If you need to enter a work site for any reason, you will be required to screen for symptoms using the ProtectWell mobile app, Interactive Voice Response (i.e., entering your symptoms via phone system) or a similar UnitedHealth Group-approved symptom screener. When in a UnitedHealth Group building, employees are required to wear a mask in common areas, In addition, employees must comply with any state and local masking orders.  Preferred Qualifications  Agile Scrum certification Relevant Technical certifications  As a requirement of UnitedHealth Group's contract with the Department of Defense, this position requires U.S. citizenship and proof of favorable adjudication following submission of Department of Defense eQuip Form SF86, (the National Agency Check Legal and Credit or NACLC). Successful completion of the NACLC process is a requirement for continued employment in this role. NACLC processing will be initiated by our TRICARE Security Officer post-offer, and can take 3-6 months for a final decision communication from the Department of Defense. Candidates will be allowed to begin employment with UnitedHealth Group in this role based on an interim clearance, and final results will be communicated as they are received. Failure to obtain final NACLC approval will result in termination from this role.  Careers with Optum. Here's the idea. We built an entire organization around one giant objective; make health care work better for everyone. So when it comes to how we use the world's large accumulation of health-related information, or guide health and lifestyle choices or manage pharmacy benefits for millions, our first goal is to leap beyond the status quo and uncover new ways to serve. Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, brings together some of the greatest minds and most advanced ideas on where health care has to go in order to reach its fullest potential. For you, that means working on high performance teams against sophisticated challenges that matter. Optum, incredible ideas in one incredible company and a singular opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)  Colorado Residents Only: The salary range for Colorado residents is $79,700 to $142,600. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, etc. As of the date of this posting, In addition to your salary, UHG offers the following benefits for this position, subject to applicable eligibility requirements: Health, dental, and vision plans; wellness program; flexible spending accounts; paid parking or public transportation costs; 401(k) retirement plan; employee stock purchase plan; life insurance, short-term disability insurance, and long-term disability insurance; business travel accident insurance; Employee Assistance Program; PTO; and employee-paid critical illness and accident insurance.  All Telecommuters will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy.  Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.  UnitedHealth Group is a drug-free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment. Primary Responsibilities  Communicating overall architecture vision, technical strategies, and trade-offs across various levels in the organization to gain buy-in. Will provide recommendations and technical guidance to improve performance, reliability, and reusability within the constraints of budget, resource and business dependencies. Engages across teams in a capacity that ranges from assisting on in-flight initiatives, up to technical briefings and demonstrations of new technologies across the organization Contributes to and advances architecture strategy, provides clarity on tools, patterns and directions to accelerate delivery Documents and communicates architectural vision, technical strategies, enterprise solutions and trade-offs to gain buy in Produces design models with high degree of complexity and connects multiple domains and technologies Provides oversight of other's conceptual designs to ensure alignment with enterprise architecture direction and business goals Serves as an escalation point for complex issues, problems and solutions Draws correlations from non-standard data sets and uses broader inferences to drive business value Stays current with evolving technologies and recommends engineering best practices Seeks out information to learn about systems that support or rely upon solution to Required Qualifications  Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience 6+ years of experience in a senior-level Applications Developer and/or architecture role, of which 3+ years are in a supervisory role 4+ years of solution/application architecture & design experience involving heterogeneous enterprise scale systems & software Experience with designing and implementing RESTful Web Services with Microservices design principle using Spring Boot or a similar framework Experience with No SQL data stores (e.g. Elasticsearch, Cassandra, MongoDB, etc.), table definitions/index, Avro, JSON, Kafka Streaming, event driven architecture, microservice architecture Experience with RDBMS, entity modeling and SQL query (MySQL and/or MS SQL Server) Experience with canonical data models designed to support reusable event-based processing Experience in Solution Architecture, Technical Architecture, Design Patterns, Data Ingestion Experience in Agile methodologies, grooming Features and Stories, able to work with Product Owners, Developers, and Enterprise architects and drive architecture solutions across the team Experience with public cloud environments (AWS or Azure) Knowledge of industry standard patterns, practices, best practices in using technologies including Microservices and containers, Cloud, message streaming, REST and web services APIs  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status.
