Job Title: Sr UX Engineer - Eden Prairie, MN or Telecommute
Description: Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that is improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation is not about another gadget; it is about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There is no room for error. If you are looking for a better place to use your passion and your desire to drive change, this is the place to be. It's an opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)  Optum's User Experience Design Studio is looking for an energetic and creative Senior User Experience Designer who is passionate about creating great health care experiences.  We're seeking a savvy designer who wants to work on important and complex challenges. You'll collaborate with a cross-functional project team to design dashboards, portals, apps, or websites and partner with UX researchers, designers, and developers to create great experiences for our users.  Using user research, analysis, and UX methodologies, you'll translate user needs, patterns, information architecture, process flows, and other design inputs into easy-to-use and aesthetically beautiful solutions.  You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.  Primary Responsibilities  Perform design duties for one or more projects to meet UX, technical, and business needs Use wireframes, flow diagrams, sketches, storyboards, mockups, and/or high-fidelity prototypes to communicate the current or future user experience Participate in gathering research insights and concept testing to inform design decisions Advocate for user-centered design including research, design, and accessibility Leverage and contribute to existing design systems, pattern libraries, and UI guidelines Critique in-progress design work, evaluating the usability and effectiveness of solutions  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  5+ years of UX design experience Experience creating wireframes and prototypes to communicate design concepts Experience with various UX design and collaboration tools (e.g., Sketch, Axure, Figma, InVision, Miro, Illustrator, Photoshop) Experience participating in user research and concept testing with users Demonstrated understanding of mature user-centered design and research practices Portfolio of relevant user experience project deliverables  Preferred Qualifications  Degree in Design, Human-Computer Interaction (HCI), Psychology, Information Architecture, Communications, Computer Science, or a related discipline Experience designing enterprise software, B2B applications or large employee-facing systems Experience with medical or healthcare industries Experience working within Agile methodologies Experience in practical application of accessibility standards and guidelines Experience designing for mobile and/or responsive web Knowledge of UX- related analytics, metrics, and measurement techniques Demonstrated skills in group facilitation and conducting research (user interviews, heuristic evaluations, task analysis, usability test moderation, card sorting, etc.) Knowledge of foundational web technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript) Leadership and/or involvement in the UX community (e.g., UXPA, AIGA, IxDA, meet-ups, clubs, conferences) Visual design or illustration skills Knowledge of video, motion graphics, or photography Full COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement of this role. UnitedHealth Group will adhere to all federal, state and local regulations as well as all client requirements and will obtain necessary proof of vaccination prior to employment to ensure compliance  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status. Job Title: Post-Acute Care Management Medical Director - Telecommute in the US
Description: naviHealth, part of Optum and the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, combines the talents of our dedicated staff and leading-edge technology to deliver compassionate care to seniors nationwide. With millions of lives touched, we are innovating the way health care is delivered from hospital to home so seniors can lead more fulfilling lives. A career with us means making an impact in the lives of those we serve, including vulnerable populations who benefit from care that is more efficient, more effective and more human. Our environment empowers our team members to elevate our interactions with each other and the experiences we deliver to our patients, giving them more days at home. Join our team, it’s your chance to improve the lives of millions while doing your life’s best work.(sm)  Why naviHealth?  At naviHealth, our mission is to work with extraordinarily talented people who are committed to making a positive and powerful impact on society by transforming health care. naviHealth is the result of almost two decades of dedicated visionary leaders and innovative organizations challenging the status quo for care transition solutions. We do health care differently and we are changing health care one patient at a time. naviHealth is looking to hire a senior-level software engineer with experience building mission-critical service-oriented applications. This role is a key-contributor to the organization and future technologies. Successful candidates will possess proven experience developing and delivering quality software solutions. Moreover, have a genuine passion and energy to grow within an aggressive and fun environment, using the latest technologies in alignment with the company’s technical vision and strategy.  The Medical Director will partner with cross-functional teams and senior leaders to ensure that naviHealth leads the industry in innovative health management strategies and is considered an expert in the field of post-acute care. The role is a physician leader with a proven track record of innovation, achievement of measurable goals, and exceptional clinical competencies. They take a proactive approach to the marketplace and are responsible for continuously reshaping naviHealth’s corporate-wide strategies.  You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.  Primary Responsibilities  Provide daily utilization oversight and external communication with network physicians and hospitals Responsible for daily UM reviews – authorizations and denial reviews Conduct peer to peer conversations for the clinical case reviews, as needed Conduct provider telephonic review and discussion and share tools, information, and guidelines as they relate to cost-effective healthcare delivery and quality of care Communicate effectively with network and non-network providers to ensure the successful administering of naviHealth’s services Respond to clinical inquiries and serve as a non-promotional medical contact point for various healthcare providers Represent naviHealth on appropriate external levels identifying, engaging and establishing/maintaining relationships with other thought leaders Collaborate with Client Services Team to ensure a coordinated approach to delivery system providers Contribute to the development of action plans and programs to implement strategic initiatives and tactics to address areas of concern and monitor progress toward goals Interact, communicate, and collaborate with network and community physicians, hospital leaders and other vendors regarding care and services for enrollees Provide leadership and guidance to maximize cost management through close coordination with all network and provider contracting Regularly meet with naviHealth’s leadership to review care coordination issues, develop collaborative intervention plans, and share ideas about network management issues Provide input on local needs for Analytics Team and Client Services Team to better enhance naviHealth’s products and services Ensure appropriate management/resolution of local queries regarding patient case management either by responding directly or routing these inquiries to the appropriate SME Participate on the Medical Advisory Board Responsible for providing intermittent, scheduled weekend and evening coverage Perform other duties and responsibilities as required, assigned, or requested  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  Board certification as an MD, DO, MBBS with a current unrestricted license to practice and maintain necessary credentials to retain the position Current, unrestricted medical license and the ability to obtain licensure in multiple states 3+ years of post-residency patient care, preferrably in inpatient or post-acute setting  Preferred Qualifications  Understanding of population-based medicine, preferrably with knowledge of CMS criteria for post-acute care Licensure in multiple states Willing to obtain additional state licenses, with naviHealth’s support Excellent organizational, analytical, verbal and written communication skills Ability to work within a team environment while completing multiple tasks simultaneously Ability to complete assignments with reasonable oversight, direction, and supervision Highly motivated, flexible and adaptable to working in a fast-paced, dynamic environment Solid interpersonal skills with ability to communicate and build positive relationships with colleagues Able to positively interact with other clinicians, management, and all levels of medical and non-medical professionals Highest level of ethics and integrity Demonstrated competence in use of electronic health records as well as associated technology and applications Full COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement of this role. UnitedHealth Group will adhere to all federal, state and local regulations as well as all client requirements and will obtain necessary proof of vaccination prior to employment to ensure compliance  Work Conditions And Physical Requirements  Using phone and computer in a full day of authorization reviews, peer to peer discussions, interaction with colleagues, team members, and management Ability to establish a home office workspace Ability to manipulate laptop computer (or similar hardware) Ability to view screen and enter data into a laptop computer (or similar hardware) within a standard period of time Ability to communicate including use of cellular phone or comparable communication device Ability to remain stationary for extended time periods (1 - 2 hours)  About NaviHealth  Being a pioneer in post-acute management and care transitions with 19 years of experience, naviHealth is uniquely positioned to manage patients, improve clinical and financial outcomes, and share risk with payors and providers. We provide clinical service support alongside proprietary technology and advisory solutions that empower health systems, health plans and post-acute providers to navigate care episodes across the continuum, with the goal of reducing waste and improving patient outcomes.  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status.  Careers at UnitedHealth Group. We have modest goals: Improve the lives of others. Change the landscape of health care forever. Leave the world a better place than we found it. Such aspirations tend to attract a certain type of person. Crazy talented. Compassionate. Driven. To these select few, we offer the global reach, resources and can-do culture of a Fortune 10 company. We provide an environment where you're empowered to be your best. We encourage you to take risks. And we offer a world of rewards and benefits for performance. We believe the most important is the opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)  All Telecommuters will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy.  Colorado Residents Only: The salary range for Colorado residents is $176,700 to $291,600. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, etc. In addition to your salary, UnitedHealth Group offers benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). No matter where or when you begin a career with UnitedHealth Group, you’ll find a far-reaching choice of benefits and incentives.  For more information on our Internal Job Posting Policy, click here.  Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.  UnitedHealth Group is a drug - free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment. Job Title: Medical Director, Post-Acute Care Management - US Telecommute
Description: naviHealth, part of Optum and the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, combines the talents of our dedicated staff and leading-edge technology to deliver compassionate care to seniors nationwide. With millions of lives touched, we are innovating the way health care is delivered from hospital to home so seniors can lead more fulfilling lives. A career with us means making an impact in the lives of those we serve, including vulnerable populations who benefit from care that is more efficient, more effective and more human. Our environment empowers our team members to elevate our interactions with each other and the experiences we deliver to our patients, giving them more days at home. Join our team, it’s your chance to improve the lives of millions while doing your life’s best work.(sm)  Why naviHealth?  At naviHealth, our mission is to work with extraordinarily talented people who are committed to making a positive and powerful impact on society by transforming health care. naviHealth is the result of almost two decades of dedicated visionary leaders and innovative organizations challenging the status quo for care transition solutions. We do health care differently and we are changing health care one patient at a time. naviHealth is looking to hire a senior-level software engineer with experience building mission-critical service-oriented applications. This role is a key-contributor to the organization and future technologies. Successful candidates will possess proven experience developing and delivering quality software solutions. Moreover, have a genuine passion and energy to grow within an aggressive and fun environment, using the latest technologies in alignment with the company’s technical vision and strategy.  The Medical Director will partner with cross-functional teams and senior leaders to ensure that naviHealth leads the industry in innovative health management strategies and is considered an expert in the field of post-acute care. The role is a physician leader with a proven track record of innovation, achievement of measurable goals, and exceptional clinical competencies. They take a proactive approach to the marketplace and are responsible for continuously reshaping naviHealth’s corporate-wide strategies.  You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.  Primary Responsibilities  Provide daily utilization oversight and external communication with network physicians and hospitals Responsible for daily UM reviews – authorizations and denial reviews Conduct peer to peer conversations for the clinical case reviews, as needed Conduct provider telephonic review and discussion and share tools, information, and guidelines as they relate to cost-effective healthcare delivery and quality of care Communicate effectively with network and non-network providers to ensure the successful administering of naviHealth’s services Respond to clinical inquiries and serve as a non-promotional medical contact point for various healthcare providers Represent naviHealth on appropriate external levels identifying, engaging and establishing/maintaining relationships with other thought leaders Collaborate with Client Services Team to ensure a coordinated approach to delivery system providers Contribute to the development of action plans and programs to implement strategic initiatives and tactics to address areas of concern and monitor progress toward goals Interact, communicate, and collaborate with network and community physicians, hospital leaders and other vendors regarding care and services for enrollees Provide leadership and guidance to maximize cost management through close coordination with all network and provider contracting Regularly meet with naviHealth’s leadership to review care coordination issues, develop collaborative intervention plans, and share ideas about network management issues Provide input on local needs for Analytics Team and Client Services Team to better enhance naviHealth’s products and services Ensure appropriate management/resolution of local queries regarding patient case management either by responding directly or routing these inquiries to the appropriate SME Participate on the Medical Advisory Board Responsible for providing intermittent, scheduled weekend and evening coverage Perform other duties and responsibilities as required, assigned, or requested  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in. Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that is improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation is not about another gadget; it is about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There is no room for error. If you are looking for a better place to use your passion and your desire to drive change, this is the place to be. It's an opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)  What if predicting infectious disease spread was as common and accepted as weather forecasting? What if we can predict who will develop diseases and conditions before they occur? How can we apply data science to equalize healthcare for everyone?  These are the types of questions that we continually ask ourselves. Our aim is to apply data science to really tough problems in order to save lives. Our world class team of scientists, clinicians, statisticians, engineers with partners in academia and industry are leaning into these and other challenges. We are looking for data scientists to join us on our journey. Do you want to work on things that have direct, tangible impact on peoples’ health? We invite you to join our team and find out how meaningful work can be.  To know more about Optum Technology, select this video. Job Title: Data Scientist, Office for Provider Advancement - Telecommute
Description: Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that's improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There's no room for error. Join us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)  Some Examples Include  The role of Data Scientist II, is a key role, responsible for the collection, analysis, presentation and publication of data, metrics and key performance indicators. In support of the quadruple aim and Optum Care’s mission, the Office for Provider Advancement (OPA) is seeking a Data Scientist that will work integrally with the pillar leads and other business units to deliver on key outcomes, driving patient and provider experience and experience.  Support collection, statistical analysis, presentation and publication of research studies Help pull operational access standards from care delivery organization (CDO) sources for patient experience Evaluate and analyze the data for manuscripts pertaining to burnout and teammate, provider and patient experience Partner with Human Capital and UHG on provider survey analysis  Dependent upon interest, experience, and need, the Scientist may also have growth/development opportunities such as oversight of additional staff, quality monitoring or contributing to education and training. Reporting to the Senior National Medical Director, Chief of the OPA, this position sits in the Office for Provider Advancement (OPA) within Optum Care’s Clinical Performance. OPA focuses on making Optum Care the best place to work for the physicians and providers of the entire care team, ensuring they have what they need to deliver the best care possible to our patients. OPA’s work is determined through clinical governance and focuses on clinical outcomes research, physician/provider and patient experience, physician development and partnership, and an equitable, responsible culture. This position includes a variety of functions related to the general management and general business operations within the OPA.  You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.  Job Description Under the direction of the Chief of the Office for Provider Advancement (OPA), contribute to all phases of an analytics/health outcomes research project, including formulation, research, development, implementation, testing, and maintenance Work integrally with OPA pillar leads and other business units to delivery on key business goals, outcomes and milestones: Support collection, statistical analyses, presentation and publication of research studies Collaborate with health care analytics on pulling data sources and performing interim analyses on disparate projects fulfilling several clinical priorities Evaluate and analyze the data for manuscripts pertaining to burnout and teammate, provider and patient experience Partner with Human Capital and UnitedHealth Group on provider survey analyses Use sophisticated computer software, such as databases and statistical packages, to analyze and solve problems. Use statistical software to simulate current and future events and evaluate alternative courses of action Present findings to peers and data science/research leadership Maintain an awareness of trends in the field and research and suggest new methodologies  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  BS/BA and 3+ years of professional experience Experience applying descriptive, predictive, and prescriptive statistics to real-world problems Experience in general programming language, e.g., Python Experience querying relational databases using SQL Experience in statistical computing and graphics using RStudio  Preferred Qualifications MS with 2+ years of professional experience Degree in Statistics, Operations Research, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or related quantitative field Experience with healthcare economics/science/product development Understanding of one or more of the following: Statistics: Generalized linear models, time series models, and forecasting techniques Predictive Modeling: linear regression (ordinary least squares), logistic regression, ridge regression, time series, decision trees, neural networks, and episode treatment groups Operations Research: Linear and mixed integer optimization and discrete event simulation Machine Learning: Common supervised and unsupervised ML models, including decision trees, nearest neighbor models, and neural nets; and a standard ML library, e.g., scikit-learn, TensorFlow Experience creating compelling data visualizations A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques Solid problem-solving skills  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status. As the largest health and wellness business in the US, we help 58 million people navigate the health care system, finance their health care needs and achieve their health and well-being goals. Fortunately, we have a team of the best and brightest minds on the planet to make it happen. Together we're creating the most innovative ideas and comprehensive strategies to help heal the health care system and create a brighter future for us all. Join us and learn why there is no better place to do your life's best work.(sm)  OptumCare is committed to creating an environment where physicians focus on what they do best: care for their patients. To do so, OptumCare provides administrative and business support services to both owned and affiliated medical practices which are part of OptumCare. Each medical practice part and their physician employees have complete authority with regards to all medical decision-making and patient care. OptumCare’s support services do not interfere with or control the practice of medicine by the medical practices or any of their physicians. Energize your career with one of Healthcare’s fastest growing companies.  You dream of a great career with a great company – where you can make an impact and help people. We dream of giving you the opportunity to do just this. And with the incredible growth of our business, it is a dream that definitely can come true. Already one of the world’s leading Healthcare companies, UnitedHealth Group is restlessly pursuing new ways to operate our service centers, improve our service levels and help people lead healthier lives. We live for the opportunity to make a difference and right now, we are living it up.  This opportunity is with one of our most exciting business areas: Optum – a growing part of our family of companies that make UnitedHealth Group a Fortune 5 leader.  Optum Analytics solutions create a longitudinal view of both individual patients and patient populations. We gather, normalize, and analyze data from disparate sources that, uniquely, span the continuum of care--including EHRs, Practice Management Systems and claims. Our EHR data alone accounts for over 80M patient lives across the U.S.  You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.  Primary Responsibilities  We are looking for a data scientist who is eager to tackle the challenges of extracting insights from vast amounts of EHR data originating from multiple sources You will work with a diverse set of Optum researchers, clinicians, internal and external clients to define the projects and see them through to completion that cover a range of clinical focus You would be participating in the development of our end-to-end NLP pipeline, building descriptive and predictive analytics and producing research validations Specifically, as a member of our collaborative team you will be working with structured and unstructured data to explore the data, develop models, and performing research analytics You will have the opportunity to work with open-source distributed data processing frameworks, such as Apache Spark and build scalable machine learning applications and deploy them in production The right candidate will have strong prioritization skills, ability to manage ad hoc requests in parallel with ongoing projects  If you have the experience, curiosity and entrepreneurial spirit to tackle these challenges, we want to talk to you.  You'll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  Bachelor’s degree in Science, Technology, Engineering, Math, or Linguistics or equivalent degree area 3+ years of experience as a hands-on data scientist, non-managerial role and executing on data science, analytics, or programming projects (academic projects may be considered to equal the required 1+ year of experience. Projects need to be clearly outlined in the resume) 3+ years of experience in machine learning, predictive modeling, or natural language processing 3+ years of experience in Python Experience with leveraging best practices conducting advanced analytics projects  Preferred Qualifications  Experience with Pandas, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, Spark NLP, Pandas, or spaCy Experience with open-source distributed data processing frameworks, such as Spark Experience presenting technical results to broad audiences with effective visualizations Experience in Biostatistics or related field Experience with SQL or relational databases Familiarity with EHR data and standards  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status. Please note: This position is office based in Minnetonka, MN. There is flexibility to work from home.  Primary Responsibilities  Manage, delegate, and deliver all analytic initiatives and requests prioritized by key business partner Design, measure, and analyze campaign tests and provide strategic recommendations to stakeholders Develop and implement effective/strategic solutions through exploration, analysis, and modeling of data Develop predictive models as needed to support campaign optimization Analyze, review, forecast, trend, and model big and complex data  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in. Job Title: Senior Data Scientist - Minnetonka, MN or Telecommute
Description: This isn't packaged goods. It's a bigger challenge than that. Here you're making a difference in people's lives, starting with your own. Join us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)  The Senior Data Scientist will produce innovative solutions driven by exploratory data analysis from unstructured, diverse datasets typically measured in gigabytes or larger. Applies knowledge of statistics, machine learning, programming, data modeling, simulation, and advanced mathematics to recognize patterns, identify opportunities, pose business questions, and make valuable discoveries leading to prototype development and product improvement. Uses a flexible, analytical approach to design, develop, and evaluate predictive and prescriptive models and advanced algorithms that lead to optimal value extraction from the data. Works with analytics and statistical software such as SQL, R, Python, Hadoop and others to perform analysis and interpret data. This function is not intended for employees performing the following work: less complex analysis on small data sets; rules-based algorithmic or descriptive analytics; development of big data infrastructure.  You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges  Primary Responsibilities  Support Member Marketing Perform marketing analytics & modeling work to support and drive insights for campaigns by leveraging ML / AI data science techniques Understand the client's needs and articulating a solution to drive outcomes Build relationships with clients to support campaign efforts Comfortable working with a wide range of stakeholders and functional teams Passion for discovering solutions hidden in large data sets and working with stakeholders to improve business outcomes  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  Master’s degree in Math, Statistics, Data Science 3+ years of experience using statistical computer languages (R, Python, SQL, SAS, etc.) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets, work experience outside of graduate coursework is preferred. Experience using a variety of data analysis methods/data mining, using a variety of data tools, building and implementing predictive models, using / creating algorithms and creating / running simulations Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, decision tree learning, artificial neural networks, etc.) and their real-world advantages / drawbacks Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests and proper usage, etc.) and experience with applications Deep understanding of data science and ability to deliver models, communicate results and juggle multiple priorities Experience learning and mastering new technologies and techniques Experience working independently and creatively solving problems where statistical modeling techniques can be applied Proven ability to drive business results with their data-based insight  Preferred Qualifications  Onsite in Minnetonka, MN  Careers with UnitedHealthcare. Job Title: Sr. Data Scientist / Healthcare Informaticist - Telecommute
Description: If you're the kind of thinker and leader who wants to bring your contribution to a new level every day, bring yourself over to Optum. You'll discover an opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)  You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S., preferably in Washington, DC, as you take on some tough challenges.  Primary Responsibilities  Develop advanced analytics and enable new methodologies & enrichments using one of the largest repositories of healthcare data in the nation Designing and developing data solutions to support custom analyses and business requests; helping clients and Optum business stakeholders interpret results; performing exploratory analysis for product R&D; and collaborating with fellow data scientists to perform quality checks on the analysis output and data for accuracy, completeness, and consistency  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in mathematics, statistics, biostatistics, engineering, or related field or a degree in health studies with an emphasis in analytic methods 2+ years of work experience with SQL 2+ years of experience or willingness to learn and utilize all of the following: Perl R Basic Linux Experience and skill in manipulating, analyzing, describing, and enriching data assets Understanding of the healthcare domain and execute numerous projects at the same time Experience and ability to identify and document data anomalies and to collaborate with cross-functional teams for effective resolution Experience utilizing solid organization skills, detail oriented, with careful attention to work processes Experience and ability to work creatively and flexibly, both independently and as part of a team  Preferred Qualifications  Domain experience: Healthcare-focused analytics Data experience: experience with administrative claims and/or clinical data accessed via a large data warehouse environment Analytic experience: statistics, biostatistics, predictive and prescriptive modeling Enjoys a fast-paced environment and the opportunity to rapidly learn new content and skills Analytical, intellectually curious and a problem solver Full COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement of this role. UnitedHealth Group will adhere to all federal, state and local regulations as well as all client requirements and will obtain necessary proof of vaccination prior to employment to ensure compliance  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status. Job Title: Senior Machine Learning Data Scientist - Telecommute
Description: Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that's improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There's no room for error. Join us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)  The Commercial data Science team within Optum Insight (OI) Payer Analytics is expanding. We are looking for experienced Data Scientists to join this growing team. This individual will be responsible on the development and delivery of large and complex predictive modeling projects for healthcare Payment Integrity processes. Senior Data Scientist-Post Pay develops innovative and effective approaches to solve client's analytics problems and communicates results and methodologies. Sr. Data Scientist also provides directions and guidelines to Data Scientists to discover business insights, identifies opportunities, and provides solutions and recommendations to solve business problems through the use of statistical, algorithmic, data mining, and visualization techniques. In addition to advanced analytic skills, Sr. Data Scientist is also proficient at integrating and preparing large, varied datasets, architecting specialized database, and computing environments, and communicating results.  You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within United States as you take on some tough challenges.  Primary Responsibilities  Apply advanced statistical and predictive modeling techniques to build, maintain, and improve on multiple predictive detection engines in Optum Insight payer analytics Lead discovery processes with Data Scientists and partner with Payment Integrity Operation management to identify the business requirements and the expected outcome Create and provide sound statistical analyses and frame business scenarios that are meaningful and which impact on critical business processes and/or decisions Collaborates with the data steward to gather information to be used for analytics and predictive model building purpose and to ensure the data meets the qualification and assurance requirements of the analyses Design sampling methodology, prepare data, including data cleaning, univariate analysis, missing value imputation, etc., identify appropriate analytic and statistical methodology, develop predictive models and document process and results Communicate analytics results and predictive models to business partners and clients Provide on-going tracking and monitoring of performance of statistical models and recommend ongoing improvements to methods and algorithms that lead to findings, including new information Recommends ongoing improvements to methods and algorithms that lead to findings, including new information  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  BS, Master's or Ph.D. degree in computer science, applied mathematics, (bio) statistics, applied statistics, economics, or similar quantitative fields of study 3+ years of hands-on experience in data analysis and predictive analytics with machine learning/statistical modeling techniques. 5+ years of experience of hands-on modeling skills and strong analytic programming skills using R or Python 5+ years of experience manipulating large datasets and using databases Experience working with analytical concepts and analytical solutions that can help customers; solutions around healthcare claims cost reduction preferred Experience learning and working with new concepts and technologies - all the way down to the theorems - and to come out with original solutions to mathematical issues Telecommute is available for this role  Preferred Qualifications  Experience with health care claims data Experience with Post Payment Integrity processes Experience with SQL, Python, Hadoop (MapReduce, PIG, Hive, Spark), R, H2O, or equivalent UI design experience for automated and-or end-user-interactive visualizations, displays or reports based on the models’ outcomes (for example using Tableau) Experience with Version Control (for example Git Version Control system) Working knowledge and understanding of medical coding, including ICD, CPT, DRG, etc.  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status. UnitedHealth Group is a company that’s on the rise. We’re expanding in multiple directions, across borders and, most of all, in the way we think. Here, innovation isn’t about another gadget, it’s about transforming the health care industry to improve the lives and health of others. Ready to make a difference? Make yourself at home with us and start doing your life’s best work.(sm)  OptumLabs serves as UnitedHealth Group’s research and development hub. Our vision is to create the most effective, affordable, equitable, and engaging health care solutions that improve patient health outcomes and experience, enhance provider experience, bolster health equity, and make health care more affordable. Our teams leverage big data insights, artificial intelligence, machine learning, and disruptive product development while capitalizing on engineering, clinical, and scientific innovations to build innovative health solutions.  OptumLabs has partnered with Optum Genomics to drive data strategy for genomics research and product use cases. The Optum Genomics team is committed to sourcing high-quality genomics data to inform a more complete view of health and to facilitate the evidence needed to get impactful genomics products into the clinic quickly and responsibly. It is imperative that this data be linked to clinical and claims data at scale and enriched with normalized and contextualized genomic features. Having access to this linked and enriched data allows researchers to understand and generate clinical utility evidence for genomic testing that is driven by real-world clinical outcomes. This evidence will open the door for more extensive use of genomics for precision medicine to improve patient care.  Our team will be responsible for developing a robust linked data asset and operationalizing this data for use in a variety of product and research use cases. We seek a Principal Data Scientist to be a deep healthcare data and analytic SME to support this work. This role requires a deep understanding of analytic application in healthcare business and clinical domains. You will have a special focus on extracting genomic features from existing lab data and developing BI reporting surrounding genomics test prevalence in the market.  You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.  Primary Responsibilities  Partner with Optum Genomics, OptumInsight, and OptumTech to execute the vision and agenda for new data acquisition and integration of genomics assets into the OptumLabs environment Develop and advance strategies for landing and operationalizing data assets focused on genomics research and product use cases including data linking and feature extraction Develop and execute high-quality data integration and delivery for genomics data, claims, clinical, and other data assets within operational control Meet client expectations and deadlines Define and develop approaches to extract genomic features from raw lab result comments through NLP Proof of Concepts internally or with third party vendors Define requirements and manage roadmap to improve usability of existing Optum data assets by exposing key data fields and implementing models that extract genomic features from existing data Partner with the Preferred Lab Network and internal OptumTech teams to prioritize and improve the data pipelines from the lab vendors through to the end users of the data Partner with Optum Genomics on product development of a prevalence and quality assessment product for laboratory developed tests leveraging internal OptumLabs data assets  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  5+ years of experience managing data or analytic platforms with client delivery accountability 5+ years of experience developing and defining enrichments to create data products that are research ready (i.e., data linking, feature extraction, NLP, standardizations, etc.) 5+ years of experience with deep healthcare data knowledge and understanding, and experience across multiple assets (e.g. administrative claims, hospital billing/discharge, EMR, inventory/supplies for healthcare, etc.) 5+ years of experience leading teams and/or projects from ideation to delivery 3+ years of experience working with genomics data in a research or BI context Experience with downstream application of data and analytics (AI/ML experience preferred) in healthcare business and clinical setting  Preferred Qualifications  Experience with Azure cloud ecosystem Experience with large data warehouse or big data projects Experience of privacy and security requirements for healthcare data Experience working in an ambiguous, complex environment and assisting in creating order, clear roadmaps, and a path forward Experience working in highly matrixed organizations; natural collaborator Experience with healthcare data and data models and be able to mentor/teach and communicate the value and rationale of different data needs, enrichments, and data model approaches Full COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement of this role. UnitedHealth Group will adhere to all federal, state and local regulations as well as all client requirements and will obtain necessary proof of vaccination prior to employment to ensure compliance  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status.  Careers at UnitedHealth Group. We have modest goals: Improve the lives of others. Change the landscape of health care forever. Leave the world a better place than we found it. Such aspirations tend to attract a certain type of person. Crazy talented. Compassionate. Driven. To these select few, we offer the global reach, resources and can-do culture of a Fortune 5 company. We provide an environment where you're empowered to be your best. We encourage you to take risks. And we offer a world of rewards and benefits for performance. We believe the most important is the opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)  Colorado, Connecticut or Nevada Residents Only: The salary range for Colorado/Connecticut/Nevada residents is $94,500 to $171,700. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, etc. In addition to your salary, UnitedHealth Group offers benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). No matter where or when you begin a career with UnitedHealth Group, you'll find a far-reaching choice of benefits and incentives.  All Telecommuters will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy.  Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.  UnitedHealth Group is a drug-free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.  Job Keywords: Genomics, Research, BI, Azure cloud ecosystem, data warehouse, big data projects, privacy, security, data linking, feature extraction, NLP, standardizations, managing data or analytic platforms, Telecommute, Telecommuter, Telecommuting, Work at Home, Work from Home, Remote

Job Title: Principal Data Scientist - Eden Prairie, MN or Telecommute
Description: Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that's improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There's no room for error. Join us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)  You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within United States as you take on some tough challenges.  Primary Responsibilities  The Principal Data Scientist will play an analytical leading role on researching, designing, implementing, and deploying full-stack scalable machine learning solutions to support house call member engagements Develop intelligent solutions to drive increase in HouseCalls penetration rate by using structured and unstructured data like voice and text Effectively communicate complex technical results to business partners Work with a great deal of autonomy to find solutions to complex problems Consolidate internal and external data to establish member journey line across different programs Establish machine learning / deep learning models to increase member outbound reach experience and NPS scores, implement the solutions into applications or operation Drive inbound scheduling through text mining in scripting and NLP  Positions in this function produce innovative solutions driven by exploratory data analysis from unstructured, diverse datasets typically measured in gigabytes or larger. Applies knowledge of statistics, machine learning, programming, data modeling, simulation, and advanced mathematics to recognize patterns, identify opportunities, pose business questions, and make valuable discoveries leading to prototype development and product improvement. Uses a flexible, analytical approach to design, develop, and evaluate predictive and prescriptive models and advanced algorithms that lead to optimal value extraction from the data. Works with analytics and statistical software such as SQL, R, Python, Hadoop, and others to perform analysis and interpret data. This function is not intended for employees performing the following work: less complex analysis on small data sets; rules-based algorithmic or descriptive analytics; development of big data infrastructure.  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  Bachelor’s degree in Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Sciences, Information Management, Actuarial Science, or a related technical field 5+ years of experience in data analytics and machine learning modeling 5+ years of experience in correlating business processes and front-end applications to back-end databases and systems 5+ years of experience working with large databases to create meaningful, usable data structures to extract information out of application transactional data 5+ years of experience leading technical and non-technical resources in the area of Information Management, Data Strategy, Business Intelligence development, data mining and predictive analytics with machine learning / statistical modeling techniques 5+ years of experience in Python 3+ years of experience in Speech Recognition modeling and/or NLP Proven ability to communicate highly technical issues / results to a diverse audience both verbally and in written Experience working for a large enterprise with fragmented data sources, lack of documentation, unstructured requirements, and ambiguity Experience working with business stakeholders and senior leaders in understanding data analytics and information needs, and executing on transformation of high-level, abstract data needs into meaningful data management solutions, information, and analysis Experience understanding and managing business data and information, and the ability to correlate business processes to data Experience converting raw data into processed, actionable, insightful information If you need to enter a work site for any reason, you will be required to screen for symptoms using the ProtectWell mobile app, Interactive Voice Response (i.e., entering your symptoms via phone system) or similar UnitedHealth Group-approved symptom screener. Job Title: Senior Principal Data Scientist, Data Strategy-Telecommute
Description: UnitedHealth Group is a company that's on the rise. We're expanding in multiple directions, across borders and, most of all, in the way we think. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about transforming the health care industry. Ready to make a difference? Make yourself at home with us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)  OptumLabs serves as UnitedHealth Group’s research and development hub. Our vision is to create the most effective, affordable, equitable, and engaging health care solutions that improve patient health outcomes and experience, enhance provider experience, bolster health equity, and make health care more affordable. Our teams leverage big data insights, artificial intelligence, machine learning, and disruptive product development while capitalizing on engineering, clinical, and scientific innovations to build innovative health solutions.  OptumLabs seeks a Principal Data Scientist to be a deep healthcare data and analytic SME working to consolidate data pipelines, enrichments, and data models across analytic data warehouses. You will have very deep understanding of analytic application in healthcare business and clinical domains and leverage that expertise in driving consolidation and rationalization of analytic warehouses. You will partner with our business teams, privacy & compliance, engineering teams, analytics and other end-users of our data products. You will have accountability for consolidation of analytic warehouses and data products. You will be a data and analytics SME more so than a technologist.  You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.  Primary Responsibilities  Partner with our delivery leaders to understand the existing platforms and chart a plan for systematic consolidation of analytics warehouses, data products, and associated enrichment and transformation processes Rationalize data needs of analytic teams and consolidation of enrichments, transformations, data models, etc. Inform our point of view on how these should change, as we migrate to the public cloud from on-prem SQL environments You will be a hands-on analyst/developer Develop roadmaps, manage backlogs, lead POC’s, etc. to improve data processes, create efficiencies and deliver value Partner with engineering partners to reduce/eliminate the need for manual intervention in routine ETL/ELT data operations and drive to end-to-end automation Your focus will be on the analytic and data rationalization and less so on the technical/engineering optimization Be a data Subject Matter Expert (SME) across our enterprise data products and become our platform SME Manage, mentor, and lead analysts, data scientists, data delivery teams, and engineers, who are part of our extended team  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  7+ years of experience managing data or analytic platforms with client delivery accountability 7+ years of experience leading consolidation of data products and analytics warehouses 7+ years of experience with healthcare data knowledge and understanding across multiple assets (e.g. administrative claims, hospital billing/discharge, EMR, inventory/supplies for healthcare, etc.) Experience with delivering data as products with client or commercial accountability Experience with downstream application of data and analytics in healthcare business and clinical setting  Preferred Qualifications  Big data and public cloud migration experience Experience working in an ambiguous, complex environment and assisting in creating order, clear roadmaps, and a path forward Experience working in highly matrixed organizations; natural collaborator Healthcare data and data models experience Ability to mentor/teach and communicate the value and rationale of different data needs, enrichments, and data model approaches AI/ML experience Full COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement of this role. UnitedHealth Group will adhere to all federal, state and local regulations as well as all client requirements and will obtain necessary proof of vaccination prior to employment to ensure compliance  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status. Description: Description - External  Do you have compassion and a passion to help others? Transforming healthcare and millions of lives as a result starts with the values you embrace and the passion you bring to achieve your life’s best work.(sm)  Candidates will be a part of a team where they will design, development, implement, test and maintain software as a full stack developer following Waterfall and Agile development methodologies. They will also be required to collaborate with Business and IT teams to discuss issues, make recommendations and solve complex problems.  You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within United States as you take on some tough challenges.  Primary Responsibilities:  Develop full stack applications following a Waterfall and Agile development methodologies in a team environment Excellent analytical, problem solving and troubleshooting abilities Ability to proficiently resolve technical issues through debugging, research, and investigation Reviews, analyzes, and modifies programming systems including coding, testing, debugging and documenting design changes Conduct code review to ensure the work delivered by the team is of high quality standards Tests and validates coding to ensure accuracy, compliance, efficiency, and scalability Uses technical knowledge, experience and root cause analysis to resolve development and production support issues Willingness to learn new technologies and software development practices Contribute to the continuous improvement of the software development team and processes  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Qualifications - External  Required Qualifications:  Undergraduate degree or equivalent work experience 3+ years of experience with C#, .Net Core 3.x 3+ years of experience with Angular (7+ higher) 3+ years of experience with Microsoft SQL 2016 development  Preferred Qualifications:  Experience working in a healthcare background Experience developing in SSIS creating and troubleshooting stored procedures Experience with ETL Experience with Azure DevOps, GitHub, TFS Experience with Confluence Experience developing in Microservices Experience developing in SSIS creating and troubleshooting stored procedures Experience with application architecture design Experience with Agile development methodologies and ceremonies Proven ability to effectively work independently or with a team as a software developer Proven ability to effectively articulate and communicate concerns, issues or inquires in a timely manner  Careers with WellMed. Our focus is simple. We're innovators in preventative health care, striving to change the face of health care for seniors. We're impacting 550,000+ lives, primarily Medicare eligible seniors in Texas and Florida, through primary and multi-specialty clinics, and contracted medical management services. We've joined Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of companies, and our mission is to help the sick become well and to help patients understand and control their health in a lifelong effort at wellness. Our providers and staff are selected for their dedication and focus on preventative, proactive care. For you, that means one incredible team and a singular opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)  WellMed was founded in 1990 with a vision of being a physician-led company that could change the face of healthcare delivery for seniors. Through the WellMed Care Model, we specialize in helping our patients stay healthy by providing the care they need from doctors who care about them. We partner with multiple Medicare Advantage health plans in Texas and Florida and look forward to continuing growth. Careers at Solutran, part of the Optum and UnitedHealth Group family of businesses. We create direct spending solutions driven by our extensive financial tech experience to help those we serve be healthier, happier and more productive. Our platform helps members manage their health plans, supplemental benefits and rewards all in one place. You’ll have the opportunity to make it easier for consumers to manage their own health by making healthier products more affordable and their purchases streamlined. If you are a driven individual that thrives in fast-paced environments, values diversity and wants meaningful work that impacts the lives of many, then this is the team for you. Being part of an organization that makes healthier living easier for others leads to your life's best work.(sm)Solutran is a leading FinTech company committed to creating game-changing, customer-friendly solutions. We serve health-seeking populations by partnering with the nation’s largest health plans, government programs, such as WIC and SNAP, as well as with employers and retailers. We’ve established a reputation for delivering modern, advanced customer experiences through best-in-class solutions used by millions.Solutran has grown over four times in size in the last couple of years. As a result, in January we became part of the Optum Financial family (a part of UnitedHealth Group). The Solutran team and our platform are now at the center of the most significant healthcare payments innovation in modern history. The journey is just beginning. We expect this growth to accelerate and invite you to grow with us!There are a lot of opportunities out there, but we can’t imagine being in a more solid, future proof and challenging intersection than that of healthcare and payments. Two of the most exciting growth verticals. Not to mention our solutions bring help to those who need it most.This position will have a primary focus on architecting and building internal and external 3-Tier web applications using ASP.NET MVC (C#), Angular, PL/SQL, Perl, and web services. Job Title: Software Engineer - Technical Operations - Minneapolis, MN
Description: You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.  Welcome to one of the toughest and most fulfilling ways to help people, including yourself. We offer the latest tools, most intensive training program in the industry and nearly limitless opportunities for advancement. Join us and start doing your life's best work.SM  We're changing the landscape of health care with people like you, who really know how to get down to business.  When you join us at UnitedHealth Group as a Senior Claims Business Process Consultant, you will use your sharp business skills to assist in creating, controlling, and improving business processes. You will solve complex problems as you serve as a resource to others on your elite team. You will create process design, project implementation, diagnose process improvement opportunities and develop solutions. You will also provide quality reporting, analysis, audits, and develop plans and programs to support continuous quality improvement. You'll be in the driver's seat on vital projects that have strategic importance to our mission of helping people live healthier lives. You'll be doing your life's best work.SM  We offer 2 to 4 weeks of paid training. The hours during training will be 8:00am to 5:00pm, Monday - Friday. Training will be conducted virtually from your home.  This position is full-time (40 hours/week) Monday - Friday. Employees are required to work our normal business hours of 8:00am – 5:00pm. It may be necessary, given the business need, to work occasional overtime or weekends.  All Telecommuters will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy.  Primary Responsibilities  Maintain the department’s Compliance Effectiveness Program by running and maintaining systematic sweeps to identify and report on defects and opportunities for everyone within the department. Develop new data pulls and reporting as needed to help support the Compliance Effectiveness Program Create other value-added and actionable analytic solutions that Appeals and Grievances (A&G) leaders can use to drive operational performance Collaborate with various A&G leaders to deliver and interpret credible and actionable data to drive improved business performance Partner with Workforce Effectiveness Team to develop short- and long-range workforce and Capacity Planning strategies Provide data to support appeal reduction and overturn projects: Develop deep dive analytics on upstream and downstream impact of appeals Make recommendations based on supported data that will assist the operation regarding appeal drivers as well as risks / opportunities Anticipate customer needs and proactively develop solutions to meet them Serve as a key resource on complex and / or critical issues and provide explanations and information to others Perform complex conceptual analyses  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience Experience with statistical data analysis techniques such as modeling, trending, patterns, random sampling, and ratios to identify outliers Intermediate level proficiency in SQL Intermediate level proficiency in Python Intermediate level proficiency in PowerShell Intermediate level proficiency in SSIS  Telecommuting Requirements  Required to have a dedicated work area established that is separated from other living areas and provides information privacy Ability to keep all company sensitive documents secure (if applicable) Must live in a location that can receive a UnitedHealth Group approved high-speed internet connection or leverage an existing high-speed internet service  Preferred Qualifications  Solid analytical experience in any of the related fields: financial analysis, pharmacy ops, healthcare / managed care / claims, operations Experience with standard data analytical outputs such as Paretos, Waterfalls, Control Charts, Trending Charts, Cycle - time, etc. Broad knowledge of STARs measures Knowledge of Appeals and Grievances Intermediate level proficiency in SAS Enterprise Guide Intermediate level proficiency in Tableau Intermediate level proficiency in Oracle Intermediate level proficiency in SSRS Intermediate level proficiency in Microsoft Azure Graph API/SharePoint Online  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status.  Military & Veterans find your next mission: We know your background and experience is different and we like that. UnitedHealth Group values the skills, experience and dedication that serving in the military demands. In fact, many of the values defined in the service mirror what the UnitedHealth Group culture holds true: Integrity, Compassion, Relationships, Innovation and Performance. Whether you are looking to transition from active duty to a civilian career, or are an experienced veteran or spouse, we want to help guide your career journey. Learn more at https://uhg.hr/transitioning-military  Learn how Teresa, a Senior Quality Analyst, works with military veterans and ensures they receive the best benefits and experience possible. https://uhg.hr/vet  Careers with UnitedHealthcare. Let's talk about opportunity. Start with a Fortune 5 organization that's serving more than 85 million people already and building the industry's singular reputation for bold ideas and impeccable execution. Now, add your energy, your passion for excellence, your near - obsession with driving change for the better. Get the picture? UnitedHealthcare is serving employers and individuals, states and communities, Military families and Veterans wherever they're found across the globe. We bring them the resources of an industry leader and a commitment to improve their lives that's second to none. This is no small opportunity. It's where you can do your life’s best work.SM  Colorado, Connecticut or Nevada Residents Only: The salary range for Colorado residents is $64,800 to $116,000 The salary range for Connecticut / Nevada residents is $71,400 to $127,400. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, etc. In addition to your salary, UnitedHealth Group offers benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). No matter where or when you begin a career with UnitedHealth Group, you’ll find a far-reaching choice of benefits and incentives  Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.  UnitedHealth Group is a drug - free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.  Keywords: UHG, UHC, Claims, Consultant, Project Management, SQL, Python, Powershell, SSIS, Statistics, Analytics, Reporting, work at home, work from home, WAH, WFH, remote, telecommute, hiring immediately, #RPO

Job Title: Senior NLP Engineer - San Diego, CA or telecommuter
Description: Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that is improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation is not about another gadget; it is about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There is no room for error. If you are looking for a better place to use your passion and your desire to drive change, this is the place to be. It's an opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)  The Sr NLP Developer is a key contributor in the design and development of state-of-the-art NLP for medical applications. The Sr NLP Developer works closely with other NLP developers, engineers and subject matter experts on current company technologies and forward looking projects.  Primary Responsibilities  Enhancement and maintenance of existing company NLP technologies and extension of those systems to new clinical domains and applications Augmentation of various clinical knowledge resources (lexicons, nomenclatures, hierarchies, ontologies and rule systems) underlying the core NLP and AI modules Evaluation of the performance of those components on clinical documentation at scale in production environments Generation and interpretation of domain/solution analytics, and, in collaboration with engineering, enhancement of the underlying NLP modules and functionality  The successful candidate will have a background in linguistics and/or natural language processing, demonstrable strength with at least one scripting or programming language, an interest in the medical domain, and a proven aptitude for technology.  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  Degree in Linguistics, Computer Science, or other Computational discipline 2+ years of related professional work experience - significant academic NLP development experience will be considered for exceptional applicants with advanced degree Knowledge and experience with natural language processing or formal linguistics: morphology, syntax and semantics Experience with at least one of the following: Java, C#, Python Experience with SQL Knowledge of algorithms and techniques within a computational domain with emphasis on text processing  Preferred Qualifications  Graduate degree Experience with ontologies Experience within the medical domain Familiar with SCRUM  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status. We're creating the very best ideas that can most easily be put into action to help our clients improve the quality of care and lower costs for millions. This is where the best and the brightest work together to make positive change a reality. This is the place to do your life's best work.(sm)  Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.  UnitedHealth Group is a drug-free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment. This role will design and deliver realistic adversarial cyberattacks that will not only test the effectiveness of the security program, but will improve the company’s ability to detect and respond to these types of attacks.  You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within United States as you take on some tough challenges.  Primary Responsibilities  Participate in the planning, design and implementation of team operations and plans Perform full scope adversarial simulation/red team assessments Work with the Blue Team in order to develop new and improved ways to defend the organization Prepare detailed reports containing attack paths, vulnerability information, and mitigation options Present findings to various stakeholders, including the most senior leadership of the company Provide support during ongoing assessments by writing tools and setting up infrastructure Creating automation for specific tasks and operations Research, investigate and evaluate emerging technologies, industry trends and best practice, and vendor solutions in order to be able to recommend and assess various security products Excellent written and verbal communication skills Experience working in complex, diverse and global (international) environments Adversarial mindset and critical thinking skills  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  Undergraduate degree or equivalent experience 4+ years total experience in information security or IT discipline 2+ years of hands-on experience conducting penetration testing and/or red team operations Experience implementing cyber adversary TTPs  Preferred Qualifications  OSCP, OSCE, GIAC certifications Experience in other IT functions - system administration, development, SOC, forensics, hunt, networking, help desk, etc. Experience with using, administering, and troubleshooting major operating systems (Windows, Linux/UNIX) Experience in testing and assessing cloud environments Experience with blue team tools and methods Experience with various testing tools such as Cobalt Strike, nmap, Burp Suite, etc. Experience with scripting, editing existing code, and general programming concepts using one or more of the following: PowerShell, JavaScript, Python, bash, C/C++, C#, or Java Knowledge of security testing standards or frameworks, such as OWASP or the MITRE ATT&CK Framework Working knowledge of Active Directory  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status. You will meet directly with clients to assess and interpret their reporting needs. You will identify and design reporting solutions based on their requirements. You will use various data query and visualization tools (Alteryx, Tableau, SQL etc.) to access multiple data sources and design insightful products for our business partners. You will work with various teams, each with unique backgrounds and perspectives, to develop solutions. You will obtain expertise in multiple health care workflows and data types.  You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.
