Optum is seeking a strong information security professional to join our Red Team. This role will design and deliver realistic adversarial cyberattacks that will not only test the effectiveness of the security stack, but will improve the company’s ability to detect and respond to these types of attacks.     Responsibilities:  Participate in the planning, design and implementation of team operations and plans. Perform full scope adversarial simulation/red team assessments. Work with the Blue Team in order to develop new and improved ways to defend the organization. Prepare detailed reports containing attack paths, vulnerability information, and mitigation options. Present findings to various stakeholders, including the most senior leadership of the company Provide support during ongoing assessments by writing tools and setting up infrastructure. Creating automation for specific tasks and operations. Research, investigate and evaluate emerging technologies, industry trends and best practice, and vendor solutions in order to be able to recommend and assess various security products. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Experience working in complex, diverse and global (international) environments Adversarial mindset and critical thinking skills.     Requirements  5 or more years of hands-on experience conducting penetration testing and/or red team operations 10 or more years total experience in information security or IT discipline Experience with various testing tools such as Cobalt Strike, nmap, Burp Suite, etc. Relevant information security certification(s) such as OSCP, OSCE, GPEN, GXPN etc. Experience with scripting, editing existing code, and general programming concepts using one or more of the following: PowerShell, JavaScript, Perl, Python, Ruby, bash, C/C++, C#, or Java. Experience Implementing cyber adversarial TTPs Full COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement of this role. UnitedHealth Group will adhere to all federal, state and local regulations as well as all client requirements and will obtain necessary proof of vaccination prior to employment to ensure compliance.     Assets  Experience in other IT functions - system administration, development, SOC, forensics, hunt, networking, help desk, etc Experience with using, administering, and troubleshooting major operating systems (Windows, Linux/UNIX) Knowledge of security testing standards or frameworks, such as OWASP or the MITRE ATT&CK Framework. Experience in testing and assessing cloud environments. Knowledge of Active Directory. Experience with blue team tools and methods. OSCP, OSCE, GIAC certifications     Technology Careers with Optum. The position will require technical hands-on architect level implementation as well long-range strategic direction setting of the platform. The role will be point person to provide technical guidance to team member, help solve any issues and work with technology and business leadership to provide relevant updates. The position will also require full accountability management of infrastructure updates (public cloud) for the product along with technical mentoring a team of full time and contractual resources. If you have a passion of solving business problems using big data and interest in emerging data technologies for marketing than this is the position for you.  You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges. Required Qualifications  6+ years of experience within the technology field as engineer 3+ years of experience with 1 major public or private cloud technologies for data lake / Datawarehouse solutions such as Snowflake 3+ years of experience implementing infrastructure monitoring, application monitoring and general high availability systems 2+ years of experience with Databricks, PySpark, Kafka, ADLS, Snowflake/Data Warehouse Expertise with IT operational automation and configuration management tools and practices, processes and tools (Jenkin, Git, CICD, JPAC, Terraform, Ansible, Jenkins, etc.) Experience establishing best practices, patterns and templates for enterprise software development organizations Demonstrated ability to communicate complex technical concepts to senior leaders  Preferred Qualifications  UnitedHealth Group/UHC/Optum experience Undergraduate degree in software engineering, computer science or related field Expertise with common high-availability and disaster recovery patterns Large scale cloud infrastructure engineering experience Familiarity with Marketing / Digital campaigns management Experience migrating applications from on-premises hosted to AWS or Azure with data lake/data warehouse implementations Coordination, negotiation, and persuasion skills Well-honed communication skills, evidenced by successful senior level interactions and presentation experiences Full COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement of this role. Job Title: IAM- Identity Governance & Administration (IGA) Engineer- Telecommute
Description: An Identity and Access Management (IAM) Principal Information Security Engineer is responsible for serving as Lead Engineer and Subject Matter Expert (SME) for access provisioning, governance, and administrative needs across the core organization and its acquired entities. This role will advise and consult organizational Business/IT teams and leadership on Identity Governance and Administration (IGA) strategy, solutions and best practices based on corporate standards and IAM industry trends. The selected candidate will work on leading and expanding the adoption of corporate standard IGA solutions including on-prem and cloud IGA products such as SailPoint’s IdentityIQ and IdentityNOW. The candidate will promote a centralized access management architecture across complex organizations within UHG as well as present automation of provisioning and governance for current and newly integrated applications, servers, databases, etc. Oversee internal or external systems security (i.e., cloud services). Ensure that business partners and employees have the right access to the right systems at the right times for the right reasons.  Major Responsibilities  Act in a strategic capacity as the most senior technical expert for all Identity Governance and Administration (IGA) technologies, tools and processes across the organization for both on-prem and cloud-based solutions Design and configure access management solutions based on industry best practices Develop and direct IAM teams in investigation and resolution of complex privacy, security, and access management problems Provide input to the IAM capability roadmap and strategy Align with Privileged Access and Identity Management (PAM/PIM) activities Serve as a Team Lead and a Subject Matter Expert (SME) for application security access provisioning solutions Work with Business as well as IT teams to gather information necessary to determine the appropriate method for access provisioning and influence the adoption of our centralized access management provisioning and governing solutions across the organization and Business Partners/Acquired Entities (A/Es) Serve as a leader/ mentor within the Enterprise Access Management group Review work of others Develop innovative approaches Sought out as an expert in the field  Qualifications  5 or more years of Identity & Access Management (IAM) & Identity Governance & Administration (IGA) experience 5 or more years of Identity & Access Management (IAM) experience with access administration and governing tools such as SailPoint’s IdentityIQ (IIQ), IdentityNOW, or equivalent tool experience 2 or more years of team lead or management experience 1 or more years of IGA product delivery or implementation experience If you need to enter a work site for any reason, you will be required to screen for symptoms using the ProtectWell mobile app, Interactive Voice Response (i.e., entering your symptoms via phone system) or a similar UnitedHealth Group-approved symptom screener. Employees must comply with any state and local masking orders. In addition, when in a UnitedHealth Group building, employees are expected to wear a mask in areas where physical distancing cannot be attained.  Asset  Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science OR Associate’s Degree and 2 years of equivalent experience OR High School Diploma and 5 years of equivalent experience Prior experience with cloud service providers such as Azure and AWS Project Management experience Healthcare Industry experience CISSP, CISM, or CISA certification Relational database experience  Technology Careers with Optum. Internships at UnitedHealth Group. If you want an intern experience that will dramatically shape your career, consider a company that’s dramatically shaping our entire health care system. UnitedHealth Group internship opportunities will provide a hands-on view of a rapidly evolving, incredibly challenging marketplace of ideas, products and services. You’ll work side by side with some of the smartest people in the business on assignments that matter. So here we are. You have a lot to learn. We have a lot to do. It’s the perfect storm. And even better? Join us and you may end up staying for a career in which you can do your life’s best work.(sm)  The Investigator Intern will assist with identification, investigation and prevention of healthcare fraud, waste and abuse. Additionally, they will utilize claims data, applicable guidelines and other sources of information to identify aberrant billing practices and patterns. They may also contribute with conducting investigations which may include field work to perform interviews and obtain records and/or other relevant documentation.  This full-time internship position will be available Summer 2022** UnitedHealth Group is not able to offer visa sponsorship now or in the future for this position**  Responsibilities May Include, But Are Not Limited To  Collect, collate, analyze and interpret data relating to fraud, waste and abuse referrals. Investigate low to medium complex cases of fraud, waste and abuse. Maintain accurate, current and thorough case information in the Special Investigations Unit’s (SIU’s) case tracking system. Develop and deploy the most effective and efficient investigative strategy for each investigation. Detect fraudulent activity by members, providers, employees and other parties against the Company. Collect and secure documentation or evidence and prepare summaries of the findings. Ensure compliance of applicable federal/state regulations or contractual obligations. Report suspected fraud, waste and abuse to appropriate federal or state government regulators. Comply with goals, policies, procedures and strategic plans as delegated by SIU leadership. Collaborate with state/federal partners, at the discretion of SIU leadership, to include attendance at work-groups or regulatory meetings. Participate in settlement negotiations and/or produce investigative materials in support of the later.  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  Currently pursuing a bachelor’s degree from an accredited college / university during the duration of the internship. Internships are not intended for graduating seniors Intermediate level of proficiency in Microsoft Excel and Word Must be eligible to work in the U.S. without company sponsorship, now or in the future, for employment-based work authorization (F-1 students with practical training and candidates requiring H-1Bs, TNs, etc. will not be considered) Full COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement of this role. UnitedHealth Group will adhere to all federal, state and local regulations as well as all client requirements and will obtain necessary proof of vaccination prior to employment to ensure compliance.  Preferred Qualifications Minimum 3.00 cumulative GPA Basic knowledge and experience in any of the following: Statistical Analysis Software (SAS) R Python Tableau Toad Structured Query Language (SQL) Visual Basic for Applications (VBA) Alteryx Basic knowledge and experience in any of the following: Statistical Analysis Regression Analysis Linear Analysis Market-basket Analysis Basic knowledge in pharmacy claims processing Operational experience with a pharmacy and/or pharmacy benefits manager (PBM) Any of the following certifications: Certified Professional Coder (CPC) Medical Laboratory Technician (MLT) License and/or Certified Pharmacy Technician (CPhT)  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status. Job Title: Senior Consultant of Optum Insight Market Analysis - Telecommute
Description: Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that's improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There's no room for error. Join us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)  You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.  The Senior Consultant of Optum Insight Market Analysis will focus on delivering actionable market insights, including market sizing, segmentation, research, and analysis to key executives within target business areas, sales, marketing, and client management. The Senior Consultant will also conduct primary and secondary research initiatives transforming data into purposeful insights that are understandable, accurate, relevant and actionable. All of this will be primarily done through in-depth analysis of the Payor and Provider markets, although you will also be asked to help with analyses of the government and life sciences markets as well.  Primary Responsibilities  Lead market sizing and segmentation for the Optum Insight business unit Perform financial and quantitative analysis on financial and enrollment data sets, identifying insights and recommendations for strategic actions Develop a research plan to support market sizing, segmentation, and other quantitative analysis, assuring delivery of research on time and within budget and recommend changes in the organization of the marketing intelligence group to ensure the effective fulfillment of objectives and provide the flexibility to move swiftly in relation to marketing research problems and opportunities Manage supporting research initiatives by implementing the entire research process, defining the research scope and budget, selecting the appropriate research methodologies, managing research vendor relations, interpreting and analyzing data and information, as well as synthesizing disparate data, developing reports, communicating and presenting research finding and implications to members of the organization Manage and implement internal systems, templates, and tools to maximize the efficient delivery of market intelligence Support other strategy development, business planning and executive management activities Present research findings and implications to all levels within the organization The position will receive guidance from the Senior Director, Employer and PBM Market Strategy and Insights Monitor industry developments and announcements to create internal alerts and produce dashboards utilizing a wide variety of research sources and databases Conduct and analyze market and product research and competitive intelligence  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  Bachelor’s degree 5+ years of financial and quantitative analysis 3+ years of experience in the healthcare space 2+ years of experience with data visualization tools (Tableau, PowerBI, etc.) Solid experience with Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, Word, and market research tools Demonstrable experience with primary and secondary research methodologies Demonstrated ability to manage and prioritize multiple deliverables at once Experience building partnerships and trust with individuals at all levels of the organization Full COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement of this role. UnitedHealth Group will adhere to all federal, state and local regulations as well as all client requirements and will obtain necessary proof of vaccination prior to employment to ensure compliance  Preferred Qualifications  MBA, MHA, MPH degree 3+ years of experience in the Payor or Provider industry 3+ years of experience with SQL, R, SAS, etc. A self-starter and able to work independently, work with a sense of urgency and be comfortable with constant change, approach work in an enthusiastic, positive, and collaborative manner Proven organizational skills with ability to be flexible and work with ambiguity Excellent verbal, written communication skills and be highly organized  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status.  Careers with Optum. Here's the idea. We built an entire organization around one giant objective; make health care work better for everyone. So when it comes to how we use the world's large accumulation of health-related information, or guide health and lifestyle choices or manage pharmacy benefits for millions, our first goal is to leap beyond the status quo and uncover new ways to serve. Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, brings together some of the greatest minds and most advanced ideas on where health care has to go in order to reach its fullest potential. For you, that means working on high performance teams against sophisticated challenges that matter. Optum, incredible ideas in one incredible company and a singular opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)  All Telecommuters will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy.  Colorado, Connecticut or Nevada Residents Only: The Salary range for Colorado residents is $79,700 to $142,600. The Salary range for Connecticut/Nevada residents is $87.900 to $156,900. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, etc. In addition to your salary, UnitedHealth Group offers benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). No matter where or when you begin a career with UnitedHealth Group, you’ll find a far-reaching choice of benefits and incentives  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status.  Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.  UnitedHealth Group is a drug - free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment. Careers at Rally Health, part of the Optum and UnitedHealth Group family of businesses. Our mission at Rally® is to empower individuals to take control of their health through personalized, data-driven health care information and recommendations that lead to better outcomes. We leverage our digital platform and leading-edge technology to make health care data accessible wherever and whenever people need it, all while ensuring safety and reliability. Here, you’ll help people find the right doctors, give them a clear breakdown of costs, incentivize them to stay focused on their overall health with daily goals, and help them earn rewards such as discounts on a wide range of goods as well as bonuses for reaching fitness objectives. As part of our Rally® team, you’ll have the opportunity to drive change with an innovative healthcare technology company that is dedicated to creating a culture of healthy living. Help us bring real change to healthcare and you’ll experience what it’s like to do your life's best work.(sm)Join Rally Health as a Data Engineer where you will partner with product managers and data consumers to meet our internal analytics and client data needs. You will use our modern data platform - which uses infrastructure and tools like Kafka, MongoDB, Postgres, Spark, Databricks, Airflow, Amazon S3, and Amazon Redshift - to meet your goals. You will oversee the entire lifecycle of data pipeline development from data discovery and design to quality and maintenance. As part of the larger Data Engineering team, you will report to an Engineering Manager. We recognize that people come from diverse backgrounds and skills and welcome all to apply.You will have the flexibility to telecommute* as you take on some tough challenges.Primary ResponsibilitiesPlay an important role in the discovery, design, development, and validation of big data pipelinesBuild scalable Spark pipelines for large-scale healthcare dataBuild datasets and data products that support population health management and positive recommendations that allow individuals to improve their health and manage their costsOptimize data pipelines to handle growing data volumesCollaborate on designs for data pipelines and data tooling that meet performance and data quality standardsParticipate in business analysis and data discovery to gather data requirementsYou’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.Required QualificationsBS in Computer Science, Engineering or a related technical role or equivalent experience2+ years of experience in distributed systems, data engineering, software engineering or similar fieldsSolid coding skills in a language such as Scala, Java or PythonExperience writing SQL queriesPreferred QualificationsExperience with Airflow or another workflow orchestration framework Experience with data visualization or BI tools Exposure to data modeling methodologies such as Kimball and Inman Exposure to Big Data technologies UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status.Careers with Optum. Required Qualifications  BS in Computer Science, Engineering or a related technical role or equivalent experience and 5+ years or MS and 3+ years of experience in distributed systems, data engineering, software engineering or similar fields Solid coding skills in a language such as Scala, Java or Python Experience in Big Data technologies Experience writing SQL queries  Preferred Qualifications  Experience with Airflow or another workflow orchestration framework Experience with data visualization or BI tools Exposure to data modeling methodologies such as Kimball and Inman  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There's no room for error. Join us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)  This Health Care Economics Consultant role will work within the Behavioral Health team to pull data based on criteria developed by Ideation leads and business analysts. In addition, you will analyze and determine opportunity of concepts as well as prepare data summaries and presentations for client approval. This position will report to the Director of Behavioral Health and COB, Optum Payment Integrity.  You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.  Primary Responsibilities  Researching and developing potential claim overpayment hypotheses Responsible for utilizing data mining tools (i.e. SQL, Access, Excel) in order to analyze data to support of their hypothesis When opportunity is confirmed, the analyst will present the findings for solution approval in a clear and concise manner utilizing data reports and summaries to support their concept An understanding of healthcare payment methodologies and policies as well as coding is necessary  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  3+ years of experience in healthcare (billing, coding, auditing claims) 3+ years of data analysis experience 3+ years of experience with Data System expertise in SAS/SQL Intermediate experience with MS Excel, specifically VLOOKUP, Pivot Tables, being able to join data and pull from various tables, etc Knowledge of Medicare, Medicaid and/or Commercial health plan and payment methodology  Preferred Qualifications  Bachelor’s degree in health care or medical field Coding Certification through AAPC or AHIMA 3+ years of experience with claims processing or adjudication systems (Such as UNET, COSMOS, Facets, Diamond, etc. or provider billing/coding knowledge on Professional and Facility claims) Maintains working knowledge of Medicare rules and regulations and knowledge of procedure and diagnosis codes (CPT, ICD10 coding, HCPCS, APC and DRGs) Knowledge of UHC systems as well as desk top applications Ability to identify payment errors regardless of the claim system by reviewing data and possessing claims coding experience Ability to breakdown a complex problem into individual root causes Knowledge of statistical methods used in the evaluation of healthcare claims data Auditing or trending for outliers experience Solid project management approach with excellent critical thinking and problem solving skills Exceptional communication and negotiation skills Self-starter with the ability to support multiple concurrent projects and meet delivery timelines  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status. Job Title: Research Data Analyst and Operations - Telecommute Considered
Description: UnitedHealth Group’s Center for Health Care Research (CHCR), based in Minneapolis and Washington, D.C., seeks an outstanding and experienced research operations and data analyst to serve on a high-performing, close-knit team of innovative health care researchers and analysts working within a mission-driven, results-oriented, restless, and highly successful Enterprise.  The Center’s research supports UHG’s commitment to the development of a next-generation health system in a socially conscious manner and the implementation of actionable, practical, and timely policy and market solutions that can achieve universal coverage, affordability, better experiences for patients and physicians, and improved health outcomes.  The successful candidate will be detail-oriented and demonstrate strong analytic skills, strategic thinking; ability to communicate with technical and non-technical audiences; broad knowledge of health care data, policy, and markets; passion for health care transformation; and excellent judgment. The successful candidate will help manage the development and execution of a robust research agenda; analyze large administrative, claims, and clinical datasets; and support high-profile partnerships with prominent researchers at leading universities.  The Analyst will be responsible for data exploration and statistical analysis and assist researchers with study implementation and execution. The Analyst is responsible for creating analytic datasets and conducting descriptive and multivariable statistical analyses with appropriate quality checks and documentation. The Analyst will collaborate with a diverse array of data scientists, economists, and other research entities across the Enterprise, and serve as a consultant for external academic partners.  Monitor/Support Research Project Lifecycle, Timelines, and Resources  Manage proposal review and approval process Work with legal and data partners to identify and execute necessary contracts for project initiation, maintenance, and completion Manage vendor relationships and coordinate with legal and data partners to obtain required contract approvals, as needed Monitor project scope and objectives to identify and resolve risks/issues and report progress to applicable stakeholders throughout the project life cycle, as needed (e.g., revised scope definition, scope creep) Develop, document, and implement appropriate communications tools/techniques to ensure understanding and buy-in from applicable stakeholders (e.g., project status, metrics, outcomes, executive summaries, key milestones) Ensure project scope, requirements and approvals comply with topic and data governance policies Establish, develop, and maintain effective relationships with business partners and stakeholders (e.g., project team members, team leads, internal customers, functional SMEs, business partners, leadership)  Conduct Data Analysis and Verification for Internal Research Studies  Collaborate with internal research team on study design Conduct queries, extract data and create analytic files using SQL Produce descriptive and multivariable analyses using statistical software (e.g., SAS; STATA) Maintain detailed documentation of data specifications and analytics Review results of analyses to assess the validity of findings (e.g., identify outliers or unusual trends) Support researchers in interpreting trends and analyses to draw relevant conclusions Create tables and figures and provide key text and documentation for issue briefs, study reports, data visualization, and peer-reviewed manuscripts  Support Data Analysis and Verification for External Research Partners  Provide deep understanding of Enterprise data assets for academic partners Conduct feasibility studies, data exploration, ad hoc analysis, and verification to support research studies Triage data, software, and technical inquiries appropriately Collaborate on dissemination activities including conference presentations and peer-reviewed manuscripts  Manage Research-Related Data Assets and Processes  Understand high-level attributes of different data assets and recognize the pros and cons of proposed analysis using respective data Coordinate with data partners to manage data assets, including regular data refreshes, and ancillary data sources as needed, and access to the data environment Participate in maintenance of project reference materials Contribute to development of standardized processes for data quality  Required Qualifications  Bachelor or Master’s degree in Biostatistics, Mathematics, Economics, Health Informatics, Health Policy, Business, Epidemiology, Data Sciences, or other quantitative field 3+ years of experience with SQL and understanding of complex database structures 3+ years of experience using statistical software packages (e.g., SAS, STATA or similar) for descriptive and multivariable analyses 2+ years of experience with administrative health care claims data analytics Intermediate level of proficiency in Microsoft Excel, Access and PowerPoint 2+ years of experience with documenting processes and practices, while effectively prioritizing multiple tasks, priorities, projects, and deadlines  Preferred Qualifications  Experience in Microsoft Azure Experience with Visual Basic for Applications Previous project management experience Ability to communicate effectively, both oral and written, with senior executives Experience with other applications, such as Python, R, or Tableau Knowledge of data privacy and HIPAA standards Experience working with Medicare standard analytical files Full COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement of this role. UnitedHealth Group will adhere to all federal, state and local regulations as well as all client requirements and will obtain necessary proof of vaccination prior to employment to ensure compliance  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status.  Careers at UnitedHealth Group. We have modest goals: Improve the lives of others. Change the landscape of health care forever. Leave the world a better place than we found it. Such aspirations tend to attract a certain type of person. Crazy talented. Compassionate. Driven. To these select few, we offer the global reach, resources and can-do culture of a Fortune 5 company. We provide an environment where you're empowered to be your best. We encourage you to take risks. And we offer a world of rewards and benefits for performance. We believe the most important is the opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)  Colorado Residents Only: The salary range for Colorado residents is $79,700 to $142,600. UnitedHealth Group is a company that’s on the rise. We’re expanding in multiple directions, across borders and, most of all, in the way we think. Here, innovation isn’t about another gadget, it’s about transforming the health care industry to improve the lives and health of others. Ready to make a difference? Make yourself at home with us and start doing your life’s best work.(sm)  OptumLabs serves as UnitedHealth Group’s research and development hub. Our vision is to create the most effective, affordable, equitable, and engaging health care solutions that improve patient health outcomes and experience, enhance provider experience, bolster health equity, and make health care more affordable. Our teams leverage big data insights, artificial intelligence, machine learning, and disruptive product development while capitalizing on engineering, clinical, and scientific innovations to build innovative health solutions.  Here, we have successfully leveraged healthcare data to bring together a more complete view of health and provide more personalized insights to inform healthcare decisions, to drive better options for healthcare that help individuals live a healthy life. In service to this mission, the Optum Genomics team is committed to sourcing high-quality genomics data to inform a more complete view of health and to facilitate the evidence needed to get impactful genomics products into the clinic quickly and responsibly.  OptumLabs has partnered with Optum Genomics to drive data strategy for genomics research and product use cases. Beyond sourcing high-quality genomics data, it is imperative that this data be linked to clinical and claims data at scale and enriched with normalized and contextualized genomic features. Having access to this linked and enriched data allows researchers to understand and generate clinical utility evidence for genomic testing that is driven by real-world clinical outcomes. This evidence will open the door for more extensive use of genomics for precision medicine to improve patient care. Our team will be responsible for developing a robust linked data asset and operationalizing this data for use in a variety of product and research use cases.  In this role, you will support the Optum Genomics data strategy and operational data management activities. You will also support for data strategy and data management activities with a special focus on data linking strategies between Optum and external data partners.  You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within United States as you take on some tough challenges.  Primary Responsibilities  Partner with Optum Genomics, OptumInsight, and OptumTech to understand existing platforms, tools, and processes to define and execute a plan for data linking between third party data assets and internal data sets as we break into the Genomics market Become a data subject matter expert across our enterprise data product portfolio and understand the appropriate use cases for varying data assets with regard to the genomics business model Work with business stakeholders and external clients to gather requirements and specifications, complete artifacts, including solution design support Document, discuss and resolve business, data and reporting issues within the team, across functional teams, and with business stakeholders Write and interpret Business Requirements and translate into Functional Specifications Validate requirements with stakeholders and the project team; provide suggestions and recommendations Lead internal review sessions with all levels, including senior leadership Coordinate with third party data partners to land and link third party data assets with internal data assets Develop custom cohorts for internal genomics research use cases Ensure client data and Optum data is loaded to third party data platform and appropriately linked together Collaborate with project stakeholders and technical teams regarding enhancements, changes, issues and defects that may impact development, data, workflow and/or functionality Perform data analysis, using in-depth knowledge of relational databases and healthcare data Present written and verbal data analysis findings, to both the project team and business stakeholders Effectively communicate with many levels of the organization, business stakeholders/SME, project managers, developers, system architects, quality assurance, operations, etc Ability to deliver quality work, delivered on a tight schedule, and across multiple concurrent assignments Work with Azure (Synapse or snowflakes) and analytics platforms (Apache spark, Data bricks)  You must love healthcare data and data quality and be able to mentor/teach and communicate the value and rationale of different data needs, enrichments, and data use cases.  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience 3+ years of experience as a Business Analyst 3+ years of experience in the healthcare industry analyzing multiple data asset types (e.g. administrative claims, hospital billing/discharge, EMR, inventory/supplies for healthcare, etc.) 3+ years of data analysis (profiling) using SQL and source-to-target mapping (including complex business rules) of healthcare clinical and/or administrative data domains 2+ years of experience conducting data analysis with a lens for data overlaps and data content understanding to ensure the right data is being used for the right use cases  Preferred Qualifications  2+ years of experience in an Azure Cloud ecosystem 1+ years of experience loading data into data warehouse, running SQL against data, and developing stored procedures for to automate data processes Experience working with genomics data Demonstrated experience interacting with all levels of technical and business leadership Experience with Agile / Scrum and other SDLC methodologies Experience working in an ambiguous, complex environment and assisting in creating order, clear roadmaps, and a path forward Experience working in a highly matrixed organization; natural collaborator Excellent communication skills (written and verbal)  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status. Job Title: Associate Network Pricing Analyst - Telecommute in the Tampa Bay Area, FL
Description: Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that's improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There's no room for error. Join us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)  The Network Pricing Analyst Implements, supports and validates Provider Network (Physicians, Clinics, Pharmacies, etc.) and Client pricing constructs. The Pricing Analyst role facilitates implementations and data changes/database updates on behalf of Finance and multiple other internal groups such as Provider Relations, Tmesys Network, Account Management, Business Operations, Accounts Receivable and Billing. Core functions include monitoring of subscriber data feeds, related loads to assure systematic risks are identified and corrected, and audit and analysis of automated provider and client related pricing architecture and algorithms. The position requires knowledge related to new and migrated client implementations, as well as pricing related factors such as pricing sequences, lessor of logic, specialty networks, upcharges, and carve out based on Product, Provider, or State Jurisdiction and knowledge of related order entry and processing systems.  If you are located in the Tampa Bay area, FL you will have the flexibility to telecommute* as you take on some tough challenges.  Primary Responsibilities  Assess and interpret customer needs and requirements Identify solutions to non-standard requests and problems Solve moderately complex problems and/or conduct moderately complex analyses Implements work items in strict adherence to the Data Management change control and Quality Assurances processes Work with minimal guidance; seek guidance on only the most complex tasks Translate concepts into practice Provide explanations and information to others on difficult issues  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  High school diploma or equivalent work experience Intermediate proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook, Access) Ability to communicate complex information verbally and in writing to technical and non-technical customers, internal personnel and executives Full COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement of this role. UnitedHealth Group will adhere to all federal, state and local regulations as well as all client requirements and will obtain necessary proof of vaccination prior to employment to ensure compliance.  Preferred Qualifications  1+ years of experience working in a health care, managed care and/or health insurance environment in a Finance and/or compliance role 1+ years of experience with relational databases (SQL) 1+ years of experience with provider payment methodologies and healthcare products  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status. As a member of one of our pharmacy teams, you're empowered to be your best and do whatever it takes to help each customer. You'll find unrivaled support and training as well as a wealth of growth and development opportunities driven by your performance and limited only by your imagination. Join us. There's no better place to help people live healthier lives while doing your life's best work.(sm)  All Telecommuters will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy.  Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. Job Title: Sr. Recovery Resolutions Analyst - Certified Medical Coder - Remote
Description: Careers at Rally Health, part of the Optum and UnitedHealth Group family of businesses. Our mission at Rally® is to empower individuals to take control of their health through personalized, data-driven health care information and recommendations that lead to better outcomes. We leverage our digital platform and leading-edge technology to make health care data accessible wherever and whenever people need it, all while ensuring safety and reliability. Here, you’ll help people find the right doctors, give them a clear breakdown of costs, incentivize them to stay focused on their overall health with daily goals, and help them earn rewards such as discounts on a wide range of goods as well as bonuses for reaching fitness objectives. As part of our Rally® team, you’ll have the opportunity to drive change with an innovative healthcare technology company that is dedicated to creating a culture of healthy living. Help us bring real change to healthcare and you’ll experience what it’s like to do your life's best work.(sm)Join Rally Health as a Data Engineer where you will partner with product managers and data consumers to meet our internal analytics and client data needs. You will use our modern data platform - which uses infrastructure and tools like Kafka, MongoDB, Postgres, Spark, Databricks, Airflow, Amazon S3, and Amazon Redshift - to meet your goals. You will oversee the entire lifecycle of data pipeline development from data discovery and design to quality and maintenance. As part of the larger Data Engineering team, you will report to an Engineering Manager. We recognize that people come from diverse backgrounds and skills and welcome all to apply.You will have the flexibility to telecommute* as you take on some tough challenges.Primary ResponsibilitiesPlay an important role in the discovery, design, development, and validation of big data pipelinesBuild scalable Spark pipelines for large-scale healthcare dataBuild datasets and data products that support population health management and positive recommendations that allow individuals to improve their health and manage their costsOptimize data pipelines to handle growing data volumesCollaborate on designs for data pipelines and data tooling that meet performance and data quality standardsParticipate in business analysis and data discovery to gather data requirementsYou’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.Required QualificationsBS in Computer Science, Engineering or a related technical role or equivalent experience2+ years of experience in distributed systems, data engineering, software engineering or similar fieldsSolid coding skills in a language such as Scala, Java or PythonExperience writing SQL queriesPreferred QualificationsExperience with Airflow or another workflow orchestration framework Experience with data visualization or BI tools Exposure to data modeling methodologies such as Kimball and Inman Exposure to Big Data technologies UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status.Careers with Optum. So when it comes to how we use the world's large accumulation of health-related information, or guide health and lifestyle choices or manage pharmacy benefits for millions, our first goal is to leap beyond the status quo and uncover new ways to serve. Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, brings together some of the greatest minds and most advanced ideas on where health care has to go in order to reach its fullest potential. For you, that means working on high performance teams against sophisticated challenges that matter. Job Title: UHC Data Analytics Intern - Duluth, MN
Description: Careers at Solutran, part of the Optum and UnitedHealth Group family of businesses. We create direct spending solutions driven by our extensive financial tech experience to help those we serve be healthier, happier and more productive. Our platform helps members manage their health plans, supplemental benefits and rewards all in one place. You’ll have the opportunity to make it easier for consumers to manage their own health by making healthier products more affordable and their purchases streamlined. If you are a driven individual that thrives in fast-paced environments, values diversity and wants meaningful work that impacts the lives of many, then this is the team for you. Being part of an organization that makes healthier living easier for others leads to your life's best work.(sm)Solutran is a leading FinTech company committed to creating game-changing, customer-friendly solutions. We serve health-seeking populations by partnering with the nation’s largest health plans, government programs, such as WIC and SNAP, as well as with employers and retailers. We’ve established a reputation for delivering modern, advanced customer experiences through best-in-class solutions used by millions.Solutran has grown over four times in size in the last couple of years. As a result, in January we became part of the Optum Financial family (a part of UnitedHealth Group). The Solutran team and our platform are now at the center of the most significant healthcare payments innovation in modern history. The journey is just beginning. We expect this growth to accelerate and invite you to grow with us!Solutran is seeking a well-organized, talented individual with solid self-initiative and multi-tasking skills to provide support as a Business Analyst to our organization. Our employees perform well in a culture grounded in high performance and collaboration and thrive in a fast-paced environment.Our Business Analysts serve as liaisons among product management, operations, client services, and product development to translate business needs into product requirements. They elicit, understand, analyze, and translate requirements into technical documentation. The individual will communicate the requirements to the project delivery team and facilitates activities through the software development lifecycle. This is an opportunity for you to have a direct impact on improving client and member experience by supporting our unique products.Primary Responsibilities Manage assigned product(s), processes, and Primary Responsibilities  Evaluate business objectives and translate into a technical solution delivery model for moderate sized initiatives Within the requirements and technical solutioning process, work as a liaison between operational stakeholders, Project Managent, User Experience personnel, and technical professionals (Developers, Net Admins, etc…) Provide estimates on level of technical effort required Breakdown the technical effort of work and type of technical resources needed Participate and at times facilitate technical solution activities Document and communicate translation of business requirements into technical specifications Perform tasks within the SDLC, such as: writing user stories, document use cases, writing requirements, and conducting user acceptance testing Provide application demonstrations to both internal and external audiences Provide technical subject matter expert (SME) support of products and application services Mentor and train other Business Analysts on applications and processes  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in. Successful completion of the NACLC process is a requirement for continued employment in this role. NACLC processing will be initiated by our TRICARE Security Officer post-offer, and can take 3-6 months for a final decision communication from the Department of Defense. Candidates will be allowed to begin employment with UnitedHealth Group in this role based on an interim clearance, and final results will be communicated as they are received. Job Title: Coding Quality Analyst - Telecommute in Indiana
Description: Telecommute With Restrictions  This position will primarily work remotely, but candidates must be located within central Indiana (Indianapolis market preferred) as occasional travel to American Health Network, Part of Optum medical practices is required.  OptumCare is a rapidly growing national, integrated health care organization that helps physicians and other providers deliver the right care at the right time in the right setting. We design and manage delivery systems in markets where we can achieve the Quadruple Aim — a better patient experience, higher quality care, lower costs, and a better experience for providers. With our expertise and resources, we are on the front lines transforming the health care delivery system to help improve the overall health of patients and communities.  This physician led, patient centric, and data driven business creates value by delivering and facilitating care across the full continuum through high performing networks comprised of owned, managed and contracted physicians, advanced practitioners and other providers. Our system impact extends across physicians, specialty care, urgent care, home health, post-acute transitions, complex care in skilled nursing facilities and palliative care.  Job Summary  This position is responsible for prospective and retrospective review of the Electronic Health Record (EHR) to assist providers in more specific and complete documentation and coding. Through interaction with the physicians and other clinicians, this role facilitates improvement in the quality, completeness, and accuracy of the medical record documentation to support severity of illness, medical necessity, risk adjustment factor and level of services rendered.  Primary Responsibilities  Conducts concurrent reviews of selected patient records to address clarity, completeness, consistency, and precision of clinical documentation Demonstrates understanding of clinical documentation requirements to ensure that the severity of illness, risk of mortality, and services provided are accurately reflected in the record Serves as a resource on appropriate clinical documentation to support the coded conditions and risk adjustment factors Communicates documentation discrepancies and coding definitions to the physicians both written and verbally as needed to clarify clinical documentation in accordance to query standards and/or policies Conduct 1:1 educational sessions with physicians and other healthcare team members related to specific documentation and coding requirements Collaborates and educates he multi-disciplinary team, including physicians, nurse practitioners, physician assistants, executive directors, practice managers, coding/billing staff and others regarding clinical documentation and coding best practices Utilizes the electronic health record effectively Effectively leverages resources to create exceptional outcomes, embraces change, and constructively resolves barriers and constraints Participates in quality and performance improvement activities Attends meetings and participates on committees as requested Reviews current literature and attends training sessions and seminars to keep informed of new developments in the field and to maintain certification Performs other related duties and responsibilities as directed  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  Certified Professional Coder (CPC) or Certified Coding Specialist–Physician (CCS-P) At least 2+ years of coding experience in physician-based settings (physician offices or group practices) or in the payer environment Full COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement of this role. UnitedHealth Group will adhere to all federal, state and local regulations as well as all client requirements and will obtain necessary proof of vaccination prior to employment to ensure compliance  Preferred Qualifications  Certified Risk Adjustment Coder (CRC) Knowledge of anatomy, pathophysiology, and medical terminology necessary to correctly code diagnoses Expertise in reviewing and assigning accurate medical codes for diagnoses performed by physicians and other qualified healthcare providers in the office setting Sound knowledge of medical coding guidelines and regulations Expert in ICD-10 diagnosis coding A keen understanding of the impact of diagnosis coding on risk adjustment payment models Apply proper diagnosis code assignment under various risk adjustment models including HCC, CDPS, ACA-HHS and private payer models Understand the use of data mining from data captured through risk adjustment coding Understand predictive modeling from data captured through risk adjustment coding Ability to identify and communicate documentation deficiencies to providers to improve documentation for accurate risk adjustment coding Expert knowledge in health information documentation, data integrity, and quality  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status.  All Telecommuters will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy.  Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.  UnitedHealth Group is a drug - free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment. Job Title: Epidemiology Research Analyst - Boston, MA or Telecommute considered
Description: Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that's improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There's no room for error. Join us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)  Optum Epidemiology is at the forefront of epidemiologic methodology and practice, designing and conducting research to generate evidence about medical products and population health. Driven by research objectives, Optum scientists utilize unparalleled data assets to develop real-world understanding of the safety and efficacy of drugs, devices, biologics and health care delivery.  Optum Epidemiology has wide-ranging experience developing evidence from observational data sources, including insurance claims, electronic and paper medical records, patient and provider surveys, and death registries. Researchers are adept at creating novel linkages that transcend traditional data limitations and enable a broad view of patient care and health.  As an Epidemiology Research Analyst, you will use your SAS® programming skills, knowledge of healthcare claims/clinical data and ability to understand research methods/data analysis to support pharmacoepidemiology research studies. You will work with big data - healthcare claims, clinical (EHR), and ancillary data - extracting data and writing code to identify and describe study cohorts and perform analyses to generate results for reports and manuscripts. You will be capable of working independently while communicating effectively within multiple project teams in a matrix environment. You will assess study timelines/analytic plans, working closely with epidemiologists to ensure results are accurate and on-time. You will support the group in different ways; for example, developing standard code, validating code for other analysts, providing technical expertise, and training and/or mentoring other staff.  You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.  Primary Responsibilities  Execute (or oversee execution of) the analytic plan for research studies Assess feasibility of analytic plan and timeline associated with analytic plan Create/modify SAS programs to carry out the analytic plan Provide analytic advice to project team members; investigate issues with the data and report findings back to team Serve as lead analyst on large studies that require more than one analyst to complete the work Document steps taken and proof/crosscheck results Assist in the preparation of analytic results and study methodology in the form of client reports, journal manuscripts, and abstracts/posters for professional meetings. Draft and review methods section of reports Generate/maintain SAS databases needed to conduct medical record chart abstraction Assess time needed to accomplish tasks; shift priorities/projects as needed  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role, as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  Master’s in Epidemiology, Biostatistics, Statistics, Medical Sociology (or equivalent) 5+ years of work experience in a pharmaceutical/biotech, healthcare, or research setting 5+ years of programming experience with SAS Full COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement of this role. UnitedHealth Group will adhere to all federal, state and local regulations as well as all client requirements and will obtain necessary proof of vaccination prior to employment to ensure compliance  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status. OptumRx, a UnitedHealth Group company, with over 28,000 employees globally, specializes in the delivery, clinical management and affordability of prescription medications and consumer health products. Our goal is to deliver high-quality, integrated services to promote optimal outcomes, superior savings and outstanding client and consumer experiences. We make healthier happen by creating smarter health care connections to help more than 65 million consumers nationwide realize improved care, lower costs and a better overall experience. This is a place like no other and where you’ll do your life’s best work. (sm)  OptumRx is looking for a curious, adaptable, and self-motivated analyst to be part of our Network Pricing team. This is an intermediate analytics role where you will learn the business fundamentals of drug pricing and client performance management, the underlying data flows, and the tools and systems used in this type of financial analysis. The person in this role will work with and have regular exposure to analysts and projects in our global data science and network pricing teams. In addition, strong communication skills are important as this role partners with other departments including Underwriting, Legal, Account Management, Operations, and Clinical to effectively oversee client performance management.  You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges  Primary Responsibilities  Conduct financial and network pricing modeling, analysis, and reporting Predict emerging customer needs and develop innovative solutions to meet them Participate in the development new ideas, products and/or approaches Proactively identify anomalies in drug pricing, client performance, utilization patterns, or prescription claims data Prioritize, coordinate, and manage multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment Collaborate with other department SMEs Provide explanations and information to others  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  Undergraduate degree or equivalent experience 1+ years of Analytical experience in data analysis Intermediate level of proficiency in MS Excel Solid communication skills, with the ability to collaborate and work with cross-functional teams  Preferred Qualifications  Analytical experience in data analysis, health care pricing, healthcare economics or related discipline Python, R, or SAS experience for analytical model development Intermediate SQL or other relational database solutions experience Previous healthcare or Pharmacy (PBM) experience  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status.  Careers with OptumRx. We're one of the largest and most innovative pharmacy benefits managers in the US, serving more than 12 million people nationwide. Here you'll fill far more than prescriptions. As a member of one of our pharmacy teams, you're empowered to be your best and do whatever it takes to help each customer. You'll find unrivaled support and training as well as a wealth of growth and development opportunities driven by your performance and limited only by your imagination. Join us. There's no better place to help people live healthier lives while doing your life's best work.(sm)  Colorado Residents Only: The salary/hourly range for Colorado residents is $53,300 to $95,100. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, etc. As of the date of this posting, In addition to your salary, UHG offers the following benefits for this position, subject to applicable eligibility requirements: Health, dental, and vision plans; wellness program; flexible spending accounts; paid parking or public transportation costs; 401(k) retirement plan; employee stock purchase plan; life insurance, short-term disability insurance, and long-term disability insurance; business travel accident insurance; Employee Assistance Program; PTO; and employee-paid critical illness and accident insurance. Job Title: Associate Reporting Business Analyst - Plymouth, MN
Description: You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.  Combine two of the fastest - growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that's improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about making Healthcare data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There's no room for error. Join us and start doing your life’s best work.SM  The Senior Recovery/Resolution Analyst will work with a team on researching issues to determine feasibility of reducing medical costs through prospective solutions of claim system processes and claim business rules.  This position is full-time (40 hours/week) Monday - Friday. Employees are required to have flexibility to work any of our 8-hour shift schedules during our normal business hours of 6:00am - 6:00pm. It may be necessary, given the business need, to work occasional overtime.We offer 2 weeks of paid training. The hours during training will be 8:00am to 4:30pm Monday-Friday. Training will be conducted virtually from your home.  All Telecommuters will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy.  Primary Responsibilities  Examine, assess, and document business operations and procedures to ensure data integrity, data security and process optimization Investigate, recover, and resolve all types of claims as well as recovery and resolution for health plans, commercial customers, and government entities Investigate and pursue recoveries and payables on subrogation claims and file management Initiate phone calls to members, providers, and other insurance companies to gather coordination of benefits information Process payment on claims Ensure adherence to state and federal compliance policies, reimbursement policies, and contract compliance Use pertinent data and facts to identify and solve a range of problems within area of expertise  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  High School Diploma / GED (or higher) Experience working with medical claims platforms 2+ years of experience with claims auditing and researching claims information 1+ year of experience with evaluation and management coding 1+ year of experience analyzing data and identify cost saving opportunities Knowledge of claims processing systems and guidelines/processes Intermediate skills with Microsoft Excel (create, edit, sort, filter, pivot tables) Experience in healthcare Coder Certification (CPC or CCS or equivalent) If you need to enter a work site for any reason, you will be required to screen for symptoms using the ProtectWell mobile app, Interactive Voice Response (i.e., entering your symptoms via phone system) or a similar UnitedHealth Group-approved symptom screener. When in a UnitedHealth Group building, employees are required to wear a mask in common areas. In addition, employees must comply with any state and local masking orders. Preferred Qualifications  Associate’s Degree (or higher) 1+ years project management experience Knowledge of Medicaid/Medicare Reimbursement methodologies Microsoft Access (create, edit, format, manipulate data)  Telecommuting Requirements  Required to have a dedicated work area established that is separated from other living areas and provides information privacy Ability to keep all company sensitive documents secure (if applicable) Must live in a location that can receive a UnitedHealth Group approved high-speed internet connection or leverage an existing high-speed internet service  UnitedHealth Group is an essential business. The health and safety of our team members is our highest priority, so we are taking a science driven approach to slowly welcome and transition some of our workforce back to the office with many safety protocols in place. We continue to monitor and assess before we confirm the return of each wave, paying specific attention to geography-specific trends. At this time, 90% of our non - clinical workforce transitioned to a work at home (remote) status. We have taken steps to ensure the safety of our 325,000 team members and their families, providing them with resources and support as they continue to serve the members, patients and customers who depend on us.  You can learn more about all we are doing to fight COVID-19 and support impacted communities at: https://www.unitedhealthgroup.com/newsroom/addressing-covid.html  Military & Veterans find your next mission: We know your background and experience is different and we like that. UnitedHealth Group values the skills, experience and dedication that serving in the military demands. In fact, many of the values defined in the service mirror what the UnitedHealth Group culture holds true: Integrity, Compassion, Relationships, Innovation and Performance. Whether you are looking to transition from active duty to a civilian career, or are an experienced veteran or spouse, we want to help guide your career journey. Learn more at https://uhg.hr/transitioning-military  Learn how Teresa, a Senior Quality Analyst, works with military veterans and ensures they receive the best benefits and experience possible. https://uhg.hr/vet  Careers with OptumInsight. Information and technology have amazing power to transform the Healthcare industry and improve people's lives. This is where it's happening. This is where you'll help solve the problems that have never been solved. We're freeing information so it can be used safely and securely wherever it's needed. We're creating the very best ideas that can most easily be put into action to help our clients improve the quality of care and lower costs for millions. This is where the best and the brightest work together to make positive change a reality. This is the place to do your life’s best work.SM  Colorado Residents Only: The hourly range for Colorado residents is $25.63 to $45.72. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, etc. As of the date of this posting, In addition to your salary, UHG offers the following benefits for this position, subject to applicable eligibility requirements: Health, dental, and vision plans; wellness program; flexible spending accounts; paid parking or public transportation costs; 401(k) retirement plan; employee stock purchase plan; life insurance, short-term disability insurance, and long-term disability insurance; business travel accident insurance; Employee Assistance Program; PTO; and employee-paid critical illness and accident insurance.  Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.  UnitedHealth Group is a drug - free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment  Keywords: claims, data entry, coding, medical coding, customer service representative, customer service, CSR, UnitedHealth Group, Optum, OptumRx, call center, UnitedHealthcare, health care, healthcare, office, phone support, training class, advocate, work at home, work from home, WAH, WFH, remote, telecommute, hiring immediately, #RPO

You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.  Welcome to one of the toughest and most fulfilling ways to help people, including yourself. We offer the latest tools, most intensive training program in the industry and nearly limitless opportunities for advancement. Join us and start doing your life’s best work.SM  The Senior Recovery/Resolution Analyst will work with a team on researching issues to determine feasibility of reducing medical costs through prospective solutions of claim system processes and claim business rules.  This position is full-time (40 hours/week) Monday - Friday. Employees are required to have flexibility to work any of our 8-hour shift schedules during our normal business hours of (8:00am - 5:00pm). It may be necessary, given the business need, to work occasional overtime.  All Telecommuters will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy.  Primary Responsibilities  Investigates, reviews, and provides clinical and/or coding expertise in the application of medical and reimbursement policies within the claim adjudication process through file review. This could include Medical Director/physician consultations, interpretation of state and federal mandates, applicable benefit language, medical and reimbursement policies and consideration of relevant clinical information. Performs clinical coverage review of post-service, pre-payment claims, which requires interpretation of state and federal mandates, applicable benefit language, medical & reimbursement policies, coding requirements and consideration of relevant clinical information on claims with over billing patterns. Performs clinical coding review to ensure accuracy of medical coding and utilizes clinical expertise and judgment to determine correct coding & billing. Maintains and manages daily case review assignments, with a high emphasis on quality. Provides clinical support and expertise to the other investigative and analytical areas. Participates in provider/client/network meetings, which may include provider education through written communication. Participates in training of new staff and serves as a clinical resource to other areas within the clinical investigative team.  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  High School Diploma / GED or higher Unrestricted RN (registered nurse) license Ability to work Monday through Friday, 8:00 am to 5:00 pm Central Time Experience or knowledge of DRG (facility coding) coding and/or auditing experience (coding for in-patient facility not professional or physician) Must be competent in ICD-10 and PCS  Preferred Qualifications  Bachelor’s Degree or higher RHIT (registered health information technician), RHIA (registered health information administrator), CDIP (certified documentation improvement practitioner) OR current certified coder Experience using Microsoft Excel with the ability to create / edit spreadsheets, use sort / filter function, and perform data entry Healthcare claims experience Managed care experience Investigation and / or auditing experience Knowledge of health insurance business, industry terminology, and regulatory guidelines  Telecommuting Requirements  Required to have a dedicated work area established that is separated from other living areas and provides information privacy Ability to keep all company sensitive documents secure (if applicable) Must live in a location that can receive a UnitedHealth Group approved high-speed internet connection or leverage an existing high-speed internet service  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status.
