Job Title: Sr. Employee Relations Analyst - Telecommute in Multiple Locations in CA
Description: UnitedHealth Group is a company that's on the rise. We're expanding in multiple directions, across borders and, most of all, in the way we think. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about transforming the health care industry. Ready to make a difference? Make yourself at home with us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)  The Senior Employee Relations Analyst will provide day-to-day support on a variety of employee relations issues, and is responsible for policy interpretation, information gathering, and resolution of issues consistent with UnitedHealth Group’s (UHG) model of employment policies and practices.  The position requires strong organizational skills, the ability to manage multiple priorities, strong verbal/written communication skills, analytical problem solving, and time management and negotiating skills. A Sr. ER Analyst will consult with peers, ER Case Managers, ER Managers/Directors, and Human Capital Partners for opinions and precedent, and will be responsible for accurate and timely analysis of a variety of data to meet deadlines and commitments. The Sr. ER Analyst will handle incoming calls up to 3 hours a day, while managing their caseload, and ensuring cases are documented in the case management system.  You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within within Irvine, Orange, Sacramento or San Francisco county as you take on some tough challenges  Primary Responsibilities  Consults with Human Capital Partners, Managers, and Employees to provide guidance on the employee relations model and to facilitate the resolution of issues consistent with policies and practices Handles performance, disciplinary, and termination issues for managers while following the appropriate case escalation and notification guidelines based on the subject matter Completes research from all available resources for due diligence in an effort to mitigate risk Resolves problems by clarifying issues; researching questions and exploring answers and alternative solutions, and consulting with others, as needed, prior to recommending appropriate actions Sense of urgency and competency to handle emergency “One Breath” situations according to UHG protocols Effectively and efficiently handles a call schedule of 1.5 to 2.5 hours per day from employees or managers  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  3+ years of experience in employee relations Knowledge of State and Federal employment law; working knowledge in ADA, FLSA, EEO Able to work Monday-Friday between 7am-5pm Pacific Ability to telecommute while residing within Irvine, Orange, Sacramento or San Francisco county  Preferred Qualifications  BS or BA Degree Possess strong Windows, Excel, Word, PeopleSoft skills History of consulting and able to work independently Strong verbal and written communication and documentation skills Problem solving and negotiating skills Independent, analytical decision-making based on knowledge and thorough interpretation of policy/practice Demonstrate strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple priorities Ability to work independently while working within guidelines and established protocols Accurate and timely analysis of a variety of data to meet deadlines and commitments Able to work in a large organization with a fast-paced environment Full COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement of this role. UnitedHealth Group will adhere to all federal, state and local regulations as well as all client requirements and will obtain necessary proof of vaccination prior to employment to ensure compliance  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status. Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that's improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There's no room for error. Join us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)  The OCM Data Product Manager will drive data-driven product vision and strategy, features and backlog across our clinical platform for Clinician, Member, Provider, Business Executive and Regulator personas. The person chosen for this leadership role will have a unique blend of Product knowledge, Healthcare and business depth as well as high level technology knowledge and know how to build and drive data capabilities. Overall, the Platform Data Product Manager will put data at the heart of everything they do.  Primary Responsibilities  Partner with clinical business leaders to identify data-driven products and capabilities that advance our clinical data strategy and drive value in the marketplace Partner with engineering, interoperability and data management teams to implement data-driven capability / products through the clinical platform Take a product-driven approach to focus areas such as member identification and stratification, clinical decision support, population segmentation, cognitive care plans, next best action, regulatory and clinical interventions Facilitate and drive data-driven product management councils focusing aligning and prioritizing cross-platform data-driven initiatives in a highly matrixed environment Integrate industry-leading, data-driven capabilities throughout the clinical platform through the eyes of our Provider, Member, Clinician and regulatory customers Create data-driven product roadmap that maps out the vision, strategy and plan for delivering short and longer-term business value over time Partner with Engineering and Design functions to create prototypes that demonstrate the intended platform end-user experience and key interactions Active involvement in promoting / supporting platform internally and externally through platform demonstrations, marketing materials and RFPs Experience using Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML) and other analytical models to improve the experiences and workflow of clinicians and providers  A typical day for this role includes backlog refinement, presenting new releases, customer development, and working with other areas of the business in a highly matrixed environment.  The selected candidate will work primarily with business and clinical leaders to address data needs and ensure alignment with OCM platform strategy. He or she will also drive enterprise clinical technology data strategy - including cost savings analysis through the consolidation of enterprise and clinical data sources.  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  BA/BS degree completed or related 10+ years related work experience 10+ years of work experience and unique background of Product, Platform, Technology and Data Analytics combined with Clinical Expertise 10+ years of experience as Product Manager, Consultant and/or Data Analyst 8+ years of work experience interfacing directly with business and /or clinically focused customers 7+ years building IT/healthcare roadmaps and dashboards, reports to substantiate the next best actions 5+ years of Healthcare Experience/Healthcare Domain knowledge (Clinical, Patients, Providers and consumers)  Preferred Qualifications  Ideal location is Eden Prairie, MN  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status. This is where you'll help solve the problems that have never been solved. We're freeing information so it can be used safely and securely wherever it's needed. We're creating the very best ideas that can most easily be put into action to help our clients improve the quality of care and lower costs for millions. This is where the best and the brightest work together to make positive change a reality. This is the place to do your life's best work.(sm)  Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. OptumCare uses a common sense approach, focused on avoiding jargon, finding more efficient ways to operate, and providing great, in-the-moment service. We provide that service by making sure serving our patients and providers is always the first priority. Each department works from the same central idea: “How does this affect the service we provide?” Because of the extreme commitment to service, OPTUM CARE focuses on recruiting passionate employees who will take advantage of being empowered to provide the highest level of service at each and every step.  Optum Care is a network of health care providers in local markets whose mission is to help providers deliver the most effective and compassionate care to each patient they serve. Optum Care’s primary focus is on doing the right things for patients, physicians, and the community. It uses an innovative service model focused on measuring what matters and increasing efficiency and performance while providing the highest level of customer service. This model allows OPTUM CARE to make a difference each day by delivering highly personal, customized care management to its patients.  The Business Analyst will be responsible for collecting and using data to quantify the impact of potential payment integrity solutions. Daily tasks include accessing data from multiple adjudication platforms and building models to forecast incremental value. This individual will become immersed within specific knowledge areas to be able to perform a variety of tasks such as gathering requirements, executing on action plans and project plans, identifying risks, coordinating testing ahead of launches, and partnering with training to develop key resources for staff. To be successful in this role, the Business Analyst must be willing to think of the end user, simplify key messages, stay organized to manage multiple priorities, and bring a growth mindset to the work.  You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.  Primary Responsibilities  Source and analyze data across multiple claims platforms in order to quantify savings potential Gather data and requirements to map out process flows, quick reference guides, and other tools useful for the business and end users to be successful manage payment integrity solutions Investigate escalated issues and recommend timely solutions through critical thinking and analysis Identify the business impact of system/application changes, using appropriate tools and identifying capability gaps between current state and desired state Participate in reviews of conceptual designs and provide appropriate guidance/consulting to help ensure they satisfy all documented requirements Respond quickly to and effectively manage priorities for project requests, deliverables and deadlines Be flexible and work comfortably in a dynamic setting Demonstrate excellent interpersonal skills with all levels of staff and leadership Work both independently and as part of a team to complete objectives Provide explanation and interpretation within area(s) of expertise Use pertinent data and facts to identify and solve a range of problems within area(s) of expertise Communicate effectively with all level of staff and leadership ensuring messages appropriately tailored to audience whether delivered verbally or in written format Provide excellent internal service to other teams Ensure all project requirements are clearly and comprehensively documented, understood and support traceability with reviews with stakeholders to obtain approval/sign off Translate problems/issues identified during the testing/piloting process and engage the appropriate stakeholders to help identify impact and potential solutions  You'll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in. UnitedHealthcare is a company that's on the rise. We're expanding in multiple directions, across borders and, most of all, in the way we think. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about transforming the health care industry. Ready to make a difference? Make yourself at home with us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)  The Senior Business Analyst will serve as a member of the UnitedHealthcare Clinical Services Clinical Practice Performance team. This person will be responsible for creating reports on the utilization, cost and quality of our services. This position is highly matrixed with the UHC Population Health management team and local Medicaid plans. The person must be a self-starter and strong leader with outstanding analytical skills.  This individual will develop and document business requirements and generate state-specific, mandated reports on affordability, quality measurement, provider profiling and other clinical transformation aims. This role will provide recommendations and drive performance improvement for Medicaid Health Homes reporting, UCS Telehealth program, and/or ACO programs. Scope of responsibilities includes building care management and/or care transformation reporting, understanding various enterprise data platforms, working with vendor reporting products, supporting audit requirements, and ensuring data aligns with clinical transformation operational processes. The Senior Business Analyst should be proficient in SQL, Excel, Tableau, and other data visualization tools. Additionally, this position will conduct and/or coordinate gap and root cause analysis, develop action plans, and coordinate mitigations to enhance the clinical transformation program.  You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.  Primary Responsibilities  Build and manage large-scale data sets that directly support Health Homes enrollment, regulatory, affordability, quality measures, and provider reporting Define the approach and collaborate with technical and business/market stakeholders, including clinical program directors, to define and gather business requirements Document and report quality information Perform/participate in audits and review activities to ensure quality Validate reporting requirements with stakeholders and project teams, providing suggestions and recommendations as appropriate Analyze, review, forecast, and trend complex data pertaining to advanced medical home performance metrics sourced from various enterprise systems Conduct gap analysis between current and future state and assist in the build and operationalization of future processes Analyze data and trends and perform root cause analysis to determine and establish best practices and areas of improvement Develop and document end-to-end advanced clinical reporting and/or business process flows, data flows, system impacts, procedural task, and procedural change issues Identify and/or establish appropriate testing metrics/targets to validate that business requirements are being met (i.e., performance metrics, process deliverables, traceability, business value) Conduct and support testing activities (i.e., functional, regression, and production validation) for the team's deliverables Plan and execute testing scenarios/scripts and prepare test data Ad hoc projects as assigned This position supports markets in multiple time zones: EST, CST, and PST. Flexibility is sometimes required  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience 4+ years of experience utilizing SQL to write queries for ad-hoc reporting 4+ years of experience designing reports with large data sets 3+ years of experience working in a business and / or systems analyst role 2+ years of healthcare experience Advanced or Expert level of proficiency with SQL, Tableau, and Microsoft Excel  Preferred Qualifications  Experience with analysis and design including workflow, evaluation of business process, wireframes, etc. Experience writing requirements and documenting business/system processes Experience with data analysis in Oracle or SQL Server Experience designing reports utilizing Tableau or similar reporting tools Experience in a managed care organization or working in a hospital setting Experience working with Medicaid, Health Home, and/or ACO data Experience developing project plans, timelines, milestones Knowledge and experience in healthcare systems, operations, regulatory/compliance mandates, and industry standards Experience utilizing data dictionary to build queries and/or reporting from the ground up Understanding of healthcare claim processing, coding, enrollment processing, electronic (EDI) transactions, and data analytics HEDIS reporting experience helpful Excellent communication, time management, problem solving, organizational, and presentation skills Demonstrated ability to communicate analysis, including trends and opportunities, to clients and business leadership both verbally and in writing Strong interpersonal skills, including ability to effectively interact, collaborate with, and influence key stakeholders  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status. You'll find unrivaled support and training as well as a wealth of growth and development opportunities driven by your performance and limited only by your imagination. Join us. This position is full-time (40 hours/week) Monday - Friday. Employees are required to work our normal business hours of 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM. It may be necessary, given the business need, to work occasional overtime or weekends.  We offer 1 month of training. The hours during training will be 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM, Monday - Friday. Description: Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that's improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There's no room for error. Join us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)  We don’t just aspire to help people live healthier lives, we have the know-how to help make it a reality for millions. As a Senior Business Analyst, you’ll work with an elite team of accounting and finance professionals who are writing the history of our organization and guiding our success as a global industry leader. That’s a lot of responsibility, but you will have the support and resources of a Fortune 6 industry leader behind you every step of the way.  You'll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.  Primary Responsibilities  Develop, perform and manage detailed analyses to assess opportunities to enhance and streamline financial results Communicate findings and recommendations to business partners and leadership Partner with business partners and finance leaders to evaluate and implement process improvement opportunities Work closely with the business to develop, recommend and establish strategies, plans, and processes to improve profitability and cost efficiencies Produce clear, well-formatted reports that communicate a clear, compelling message for their stakeholders Leverage technology and carry out process improvement activities  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in. Job Title: Senior Claims Business Process Analyst - Remote
Description: You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.  Energize your career with one of Healthcare’s fastest growing companies.  You dream of a great career with a great company – where you can make an impact and help people. We dream of giving you the opportunity to do just this. And with the incredible growth of our business, it’s a dream that definitely can come true. Already one of the world’s leading Healthcare companies, UnitedHealth Group is restlessly pursuing new ways to operate our service centers, improve our service levels and help people lead healthier lives. We live for the opportunity to make a difference and right now, we are living it up.  This opportunity is with one of our most exciting business areas: Optum – a growing part of our family of companies that make UnitedHealth Group a Fortune 10 leader.  Optum helps nearly 60 million Americans live their lives to the fullest by educating them about their symptoms, conditions and treatments; helping them to navigate the system, finance their healthcare needs and stay on track with their health goals. No other business touches so many lives in such a positive way. And we do it all with every action focused on our shared values of Integrity, Compassion, Relationships, Innovation & Performance.  Flexible, Friendly, Fast on your feet, that's a great start. Accurate, Accountable, Self Directed, These traits can take you places. Our claims operations are the focal point of handling information about services patients receive and they way those services get paid. It's complex, detailed work. It's fast paced challenge. It's a job that calls on you to be thoughtful, resourceful, team-driven and customer-focused. To put it mildly, there is never a dull moment. Senior Claims Business Process Analysts are responsible for all related aspects of claim system processes and claim business rules. Include claims systems utilization, capacity analyses/planning and reporting, claims-related business and systems analysis. Ensure data integrity, data security and process optimization.  Training will be conducted virtually from your home. This position is full-time (40 hours/week) Monday - Friday. Employees are required to have flexibility to work any of our 8-hour shift schedules during our normal business hours of 8:00am – 5:00pm. It may be necessary, given the business need, to work occasional overtime or weekends.  All Telecommuters will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy.  Primary Responsibilities  Responsible for providing research and root cause analysis for claim quality remediation Perform capacity planning and reporting Responsible for all aspects of quality assurance Create and edit requirements, specifications, cost benefit analysis and recommendations to proposed solutions Facilitate development of process documentation Follow standard programming guidelines and requirements as set by team Standard documentation and tracking processes Uses pertinent data and facts to identify and solve a range of problems within area of expertise  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  High School Diploma / GED (or higher) 2+ years of experience analyzing and solving customer problems in an office setting environment 3+ years in a technical or metrics based environment ; preferably claims and/or customer service Ability to understand multiple products and multiple levels of benefits within each product Moderate proficiency with computer and Windows PC applications, which includes the ability to learn new complex computer system applications  Telecommuting Requirements  Required to have a dedicated work area established that is separated from other living areas and provides information privacy Ability to keep all company sensitive documents secure (if applicable) Must live in a location that can receive a UnitedHealth Group approved high-speed internet connection or leverage an existing high-speed internet service  Preferred Qualifications  Bachelor’s degree (or higher) 2+ years of UNET claim experience 1+ years of Cirrus 1+ years of COMET experience 2+ years of Adjustment Macro development Intermediate level of Microsoft Visio SharePoint development/creation  Soft Skills  Ability to multi-task, this includes ability to understand multiple products and multiple levels of benefits within each product  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status. This is an entry level position designed for high-achieving recent college graduates looking to kick-start their careers at UnitedHealth Group. As such, Product Analysts are embedded at the center of the nation’s leading Medicare Advantage organization. By working cross-functionally throughout the year with other teams such as Underwriting, Actuarial, Finance, Marketing, Benefit Operations, and Membership Materials, analysts are exposed to multiple divisions where they must apply their critical knowledge. H1-B and green card sponsorship is not available for this position. Full COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement of this role. Job Title: Revenue Cycle Ops Business Analyst - O360 - Telecommute
Description: Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that's improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There's no room for error. Join us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)  The Revenue Cycle Business Analyst at Optum is responsible for understanding all aspects of client performance through deep analytic investigation and modelling. Working closely with the Optum Client Executive (CE) and Optum Operational Leadership, the RC Business Analyst helps guide operational practices to maximize performance against KPIs and Service Level Agreement (SLA) targets.  The Revenue Cycle Business Analyst is accountable for acute and/or ambulatory Client Executive in support of Client Leadership (C suite) and Optum Operations Leadership. In this capacity, the RC Business Analyst provides updates on operational status and progress against KPIs and SLAs and escalates issues as appropriate to client executives and Optum Operations Leadership.  The Revenue Cycle Business Analyst is assigned, (depending upon size, can be fully dedicated) to a specific client and maintains a high-level of autonomy and self-sufficiency. Communication is critically important, as such; RC Business Analysts hold regular meetings with Optum Operational Leadership and provide performance overviews, root cause analysis, trending analysis and assists with bridge plans and project tracking as needed.  The Revenue Cycle Business Analyst is an experienced analyst with deep understanding analytic techniques and data visualization. As part of the Optum commitment to communication, the RC Business Analyst provides standard and custom reports that reflect trends and overall state of client operations to the CEs and Optum Operational Leadership, to be shared with Client Leadership (C suite). RC Business Analysts work in partnership with the CEs and Optum Operational Leadership to review, interpret, summarize and share vital data with the client’s executives on a regular basis.  You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within United States as you take on some tough challenges.  Primary Responsibilities Major Duties Function as a subject matter expert with respect to data availability and standard reporting packages for assign client(s) Synthesize large amounts of data from disparate sources into cohesive analyses, and effectively communicate results Proactively, understand, monitor, and report trends in client critical business metrics including KPIs, SLA’s and other standard revenue cycle metrics and benchmarks Act as a client advocate to assess, address and resolve client concerns in collaboration with Optum operational owners in all revenue cycle areas Maintain a regular meeting cadence with appropriate Optum operational leaders, the client’s executives and Optum CEs. Duties include but are not limited to meeting schedule, attendee list (both client and Optum), preparation, execution and follow-up. Meetings include but are not limited to JOC, Steering Committee and other client specific meetings as needed Ensure routine reports are shared with Optum CEs and distributed to client executives Understand annual client business plans detailing the client’s goals and objectives and ensure delivery of Revenue Cycle products and services in alignment with goals and objectives Understand payer dynamics and collaborate with Operations, focusing upon the challenges that exist or effect efficient resolution of Accounts Receivable (e.g., Denials, Clinical Appeals) Leverage Optum resources (e.g., Operations Teams, CEs, Product, Market Solutions, Payer-Provider Collaboration Team, Optimal Practice) to meet client business challenges Accountabilities As a member of the Operations Team, participating and contributing to Revenue Cycle delivery planning and execution, management of associated financials, development and management of resource, cost and staffing models Proactively managing and communicating current operational results and transformation projects status to client operational partners, Optum CEs and client executives, as appropriate Maintain regular meetings with client operational partners, Optum CEs and client executives to review performance Monitor all revenue cycle operations through management report creating, delivery and interpretation, with communication to applicable operations leaders and client delivery teams Drive NPS improvement thorough a deep understanding of the NPS score driver for that specific client and ensuring remediation plans are in place where necessary Increase client satisfaction, streamlining workflows and/or reduce internal expense Coordinate with CEs and Optum Operations teams to prepare and execute detailed performance recovery plans for clients KPIs, SLAs and other critical operational metrics  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  8+ years of operational analytic experience (examples could include understanding improving process flows, analytics, creating KPI’s) Experience with various statistical analysis techniques, including but not limited to regression analysis and covariant analysis Experience using project management skills to effectively manage large, complex projects Experience working with multiple levels of leadership in a matrixed environment Highly self-motivated and self-directed individual with operational research and analytics experience Expertise in telling stories with data in a way that non-technical individuals can understand Travel: 0-20% travel depending on market and facility locations  Preferred Qualifications  Undergraduate Degree or equivalent experience Advanced degree (i.e., MS or MBA) Six sigma green belt certification or higher Familiarity and/or experience with six sigma methodologies Reporting systems such as Tableau, Power BI Familiarity with acute and/or ambulatory health care revenue cycle operations Ability to manage and execute complex analyses with minimal supervision/management Ability to work with peer group to manage through conflict resolution Ability to effectively operate and deliver results in a matrix operations structure Full COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement of this role. Job Title: Optum Payer Operations, MBA Business Analyst Consultant - Eden Prairie, MN
Description: Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that's improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There's no room for error. Join us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)  Our mission is to help people live healthier lives and make the health system work better for everyone. Optum helps all participants in the health care system connect and work together to advance care delivery, empower consumers and modernize infrastructure. We have the capabilities, scale, and comprehensive products to help those we serve implement innovative approaches that improve quality, lower costs and increase satisfaction  Now that you have your MBA, are you ready to take your career to the next level? Join Fortune’s #1 ranked “World’s Most Admired Companies” in the insurance and manage care sector. The Optum Payer Rotational Leadership Program is designed for high-performing, high-potential individuals seeking meaningful leadership roles.  The Work  Our Rotational Leadership Program is designed specifically for highly talented MBA candidates who have a strong desire to demonstrate their capabilities and enhance their leadership potential. You will be placed in strategic positions with frequent exposure to leaders, businesses, and technologies. You will have the ability to make meaning contributions to the company and help people live healthier lives.  Program Structure  Optum Payment Integrity and Call & Claim business consists of over 20,000 employees worldwide. Our 24-month program consists of two assignments (12 months each) in different business and geographic locations, providing you with a broad understanding of Payer Operations within the organization.  You’ll be exposed to managing Optum Payer top executional priorities which will utilize your strategic planning, critical thinking, global mindset, program, and project management skills.  Participants will also experience extensive, customized formal development programs to fulfill professional and personal potential. This role will allow you the opportunity to interact with senior leaders and build a valuable network of peers, managers, and leaders across the organization.  We offer assignments in a variety of domestic locations.  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  Undergraduate degree from an accredited institution Currently pursuing an MBA from a top tier program with a target graduation date no later than June 2022. (Or have graduated with MBA in past two years) Must be eligible to work in the U.S. without company sponsorship, now or in the future, for employment-based work authorization (F-1 students with practical training and candidates requiring H-1Bs, TNs, etc. will not be considered) Full COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement of this role. UnitedHealth Group will adhere to all federal, state and local regulations as well as all client requirements and will obtain necessary proof of vaccination prior to employment to ensure compliance.  Preferred Qualifications  3-5 years of relevant professional work experience Geographic flexibility – telecommuter considered Operations experience or operations focused educational background Demonstrated success at leading teams Ability to quickly understand complex business issues and make strategic decisions Thrive in team-based culture and fast changing environment High emotional intelligence, ability to navigate a complex matrix organization Innovative & proactive thinker Business acumen & global mindset Align to our Mission & Values, embrace Inclusion & Diversity Project or program management, healthcare, marketing and/or IT background a plus  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status. Job Title: Senior Workforce Business Analyst - Naviguard Minnetonka, MN or Telecommute
Description: Senior Workforce Business Analyst  Are you eager to make an impact on one of the most important and underserved issues in the US healthcare system? Naviguard, a fully owned UnitedHealth Group Ventures company, is on a mission to protect patients from surprise bills by building a revolutionary consumer protection business. This new business will be dedicated to helping patients understand and mitigate the unexpected financial risks they face. As an employee of this new business, you can expect to be a part of a dynamic organization that is fast-paced and driven by our vision to promote healthcare affordability and accountability nationwide.  The Senior Workforce Business Analyst will be responsible for supporting the operations team with analyzing and improving operational performance. This position requires a motivated self-starter with experience in data analysis, process improvement, and strong analytical skills. To be successful in this role, candidate will have a strong attention to detail with the ability to quickly identify, analyze and solve process/workflow problems. This position will report to the Sr Director of Operations.  Primary Responsibilities  Support operations and business planning by analyzing, reviewing, forecasting, and trending operational performance data Conduct data analysis of production-related employee performance, assess workforce management needs, and make recommendations to leadership Collaborate with Operations to identify issues that impact staffing levels Monitor and review operational reports to identify areas for improvement Perform root cause analysis and present recommendations for improvement to operations leaders Prepare weekly report out to leadership on operational performance against key performance measures Partner with reporting team on requirements in order to build and enhance reports, serving as the operations data SME Work independently to manage competing priorities and requests Complete ad hoc analysis as requested by operations leadership  Basic/Minimum Qualifications  3+ years of experience in workforce planning and/or business analysis 2+ years of experience with healthcare payer systems or operations Intermediate to advanced level of proficiency with Microsoft office suite including Word, Excel, Outlook and PowerPoint Excellent communication, time/project management, problem solving, organizational, and analytical skills.  Preferred Qualifications  Undergraduate degree Experience with data analytics for workforce management purposes Strong analytical skills and evidence of creative, proactive problem solving Excellent verbal and written communication skills Highly motivated individual with a passion for helping consumers navigate the complicated healthcare system  At Naviguard, we are dedicated to helping people better understand and mitigate the financial risks they face when planning important medical procedures, or when they have received unplanned or emergency care. As a member of our team, you will contribute to a dynamic and fast-paced start-up business, driven by a vision to promote affordability and accountability in healthcare nationwide. Does this sound like your kind of purpose and challenge?  Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: Naviguard is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.  Naviguard is a drug-free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.

Job Title: Senior Account Analyst, Continual Improvement - Telecommute
Description: UnitedHealthcare is a company that's on the rise. We're expanding in multiple directions, across borders and, most of all, in the way we think. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about transforming the health care industry. Ready to make a difference? Make yourself at home with us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)  Flexible, Friendly, Fast on your feet, that's a great start. Accurate, Accountable, Self-Directed; These traits can take you places. Our claims operations are the focal point of handling information about services patients receive and the way those services get paid. It's complex, detailed work. It's fast paced challenge. It's a job that calls on you to be thoughtful, resourceful, team-driven, and customer-focused. To put it mildly, there is never a dull moment.  As a Senior Workforce Management Business Process Analyst, you will grow and develop as you support the Operational Departments by developing, enhancing, and managing Workforce Management tools, models, and reporting. You will be challenged to analyze, review, and forecast data for operational and business planning. In this role, you will gather volume forecast inputs, analyze trends and seasonality, and create and maintain weekly, monthly, and yearly forecasts. The volume forecast will be the driver of the operational plan for each unit that you support, and you will play a key role in assisting the business in the execution of these plans. As part of this elite team, you will also be empowered to impact the health care system through analysis and interpretation of data, developing and presenting recommendations to drive performance and effective use of resources. Hours are Monday – Friday from 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM.  This position is onsite in Horsham, PA OR Milwaukee, WI OR if you live outside of the commutable area, you’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.  Primary Responsibilities  Forecast volumes and resource needs based on historical data/metrics and current trends Ensure proper staffing levels to meet contractual obligations and established metrics Collaborate with Operations to identify issues that impact staffing levels Design, develop and continuously improve forecasting models and tools across various business units Perform real-time and historical analyses of performance metrics and communicate findings of data analyses and recommendations to appropriate stakeholders Perform ad-hoc analyses (both simple and complex) to identify and make recommendations on efficiency improvements, adjustments to planning metrics, staff movement, and workload balancing Develop reports and work management tools as needed by the Leadership Team Support both internal and external reporting of metrics and performance against Service Level Agreements (SLAs) Present staffing models and other data analysis to operational and business partners on a routine basis Develop a solid understanding of staffing metrics and inputs  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience 3+ years of experience in one or more of the following areas: business/financial analysis, call center workforce planning and forecasting, or back-office workforce planning and forecasting 3+ years of work experience in a metrics-driven operations environment; preferably insurance claims, enrollments and/or customer service call center 2+ years of experience reviewing/analyzing data and deriving actionable conclusions in a metrics-driven operations environment Intermediate level of proficiency utilizing MS Word, Excel, and PowerPoint Full COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement of this role. UnitedHealth Group will adhere to all federal, state, and local regulations as well as all client requirements and will obtain necessary proof of vaccination prior to employment to ensure compliance  Preferred Qualifications  Experience with data analytics for workforce management purposes Solid analytical skills, and evidence of creative, proactive problem solving Experience with Workforce Management software including NICE, Aspect, Verint Excellent communication, time/project management, problem solving, organizational, and analytical skills  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status. Our claims operations are the focal point of handling information about services patients receive and the way those services get paid. It's complex, detailed work. It's fast paced challenge. It's a job that calls on you to be thoughtful, resourceful, team-driven, and customer-focused. To put it mildly, there is never a dull moment.As a Senior Workforce Management Business Process Analyst, you will grow and develop as you support the Operational Departments by developing, enhancing, and managing Workforce Management tools, models, and reporting. You will be challenged to analyze, review, and forecast data for operational and business planning. In this role, you will gather volume forecast inputs, analyze trends and seasonality, and create and maintain weekly, monthly, and yearly forecasts. The volume forecast will be the driver of the operational plan for each unit that you support, and you will play a key role in assisting the business in the execution of these plans. As part of this elite team, you will also be empowered to impact the health care system through analysis and interpretation of data, developing and presenting recommendations to drive performance and effective use of resources. Job Title: Senior Product Analyst, OptumRx Market Solutions Telecommute
Description: Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that is improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation is not about another gadget; it is about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There is no room for error. If you are looking for a better place to use your passion and your desire to drive change, this is the place to be. It's an opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)  This Senior Product Analyst role is part of a team that is responsible for profitable growth of assigned product(s) in the OptumRx Specialty Pharmacy and Infusion portfolio. You will be responsible for supporting the full product lifecycle management, including: strategy, competitive intelligence, development, management and end-of-life of new, existing, or acquisition products as well as delivering complex solutions products that drive value for our customers. This role is part of a product and strategy team and works alongside cross-functional partners and customers to understand business problems and to refine and prioritize the product roadmap to maximize client value. The Product Analyst possesses knowledge of product value and product delivery and may act as a point of contact for with sales, account management and operations.  You will research and leverage market insights to understand market / customer needs to identify new opportunities or make enhancements to current product offerings. You will be accountable for delivering metrics on product performance against expectations. You will communicate updates to the product portfolio that improve competitive position and optimal product performance to meet customer and market needs. You will partner with internal or external stakeholders (key customers, product partnerships, etc.) to define and drive future product direction.  You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within United States as you take on some tough challenges.  Primary Responsibilities  Translate analytical research to support product priorities, value proposition Research market within own area of expertise to understand consumer and client needs Understand how trends relate to and inform opportunities specific to their product / service area Analyze, investigate, and support sales readiness and go to market strategies Partner with stakeholders to enable successful development and delivery of commercialized solutions Understand and influence underlying operating model, capabilities, and technology systems Assess specific aspects of product performance ongoing, including market adoption, financial performance, NPS, operational performance, etc. to inform decisions about product features and viability Transform tactical aspects of the product strategy & roadmap into actionable product enhancements in partnership with Operational and Technical teams Provide inputs into business plans to justify investments and capital spend Partner with the Product Managers and operations teams to manage and align product roadmap & delivery critical path items to drive client and business value Understand the goals and tasks assigned, producing results by fulfilling and sometimes exceeding expectations Assimilate quickly to new environments and teams, exhibit flexibility, and apply a continuous learning mindset in all aspects of work  Competencies  Demonstrated ability to influence cross-functional teams without formal authority Critical thinking, written and verbal interpersonal communication skills with ability to interact with professional and non-professional staff regarding operational issues Demonstrated ability to achieve goals in a matrix environment Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively and influence others Effectively communicate at all levels of the organization  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  Bachelor’s Degree in business, marketing, finance, communications or closely related degree or equivalent experience 2+ years of experience in the healthcare industry supporting product, sales, business development or account management Product management or customer interaction experience within a large matrix organization with an emphasis on understanding client needs and priorities Intermediate Proficiency with MS Office applications  Preferred Qualifications  Experience within PBM/pharmacy, specialty pharmacy, or pharmaceutical manufacturing Experience in Health Care industry Experience with Government Programs, Medicare, and Medicaid  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status.  Careers with Optum. Here's the idea. We built an entire organization around one giant objective; make health care work better for everyone. So when it comes to how we use the world's large accumulation of health-related information, or guide health and lifestyle choices or manage pharmacy benefits for millions, our first goal is to leap beyond the status quo and uncover new ways to serve. Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, brings together some of the greatest minds and most advanced ideas on where health care has to go in order to reach its fullest potential. For you, that means working on high performance teams against sophisticated challenges that matter. Optum, incredible ideas in one incredible company and a singular opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)  Colorado Residents Only: The salary range for Colorado residents is $64,800 to $116,000. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, etc. In addition to your salary, UnitedHealth Group offers benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). No matter where or when you begin a career with UnitedHealth Group, you’ll find a far-reaching choice of benefits and incentives.  All Telecommuters will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy  Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.  UnitedHealth Group is a drug-free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.  Job Keywords: Product Analyst, Product Support, Product Management, PBM, Health Care, Government Programs, Medicare, Medicaid, OptumRx Market Solutions, Telecommute, Telecommuting, Telecommuter, Work From Home, Work At Home, Remote

Description: UnitedHealth Group is a company that's on the rise. We're expanding in multiple directions, across borders and, most of all, in the way we think. Make yourself at home with us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)  The Sr. Analyst, Supplier Management (Sourcing & Procurement Consultant) will be a dynamic member of the Enterprise Supplier Risk & Performance Management team at UnitedHealth Group, one of the largest health care companies in the world. We’re doing everything in our power to make health care work better for everyone. Join us on the Enterprise Supplier Risk & Performance Management Team to work in a dynamic role.  This role will work cross-functionally to build relationships across the Enterprise, developing a deep understanding of both the evolving supplier management practices of the organization as well as the business areas and categories supported. This role will provide the Enterprise with centralized risk and performance management services. Successful candidates will demonstrate the required qualifications below, as well as thrive in a collaborative working environment, with enthusiasm and motivation to always exceed the expectations of our customers, members, and business partners.  You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges. Influence and assist suppliers in the completion of questionnaires and risk mitigation requirements Influence, educate and drive accountability with business stakeholders and suppliers for performance and risk compliance, ensuring adherence to policies, standards, and procedures Build and maintain collaborative relationships with Category Managers, business stakeholders, business Supplier Management Offices and suppliers, driving and delivering results through agreed upon strategies  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience 1+ years of experience in compliance, operations, procurement, risk management or supplier management Intermediate or higher level of proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite Unless an approved UHG telecommuter, if located near Minnetonka, MN, you will be asked to perform this role in an office setting  Preferred Qualifications  3+ years of experience in compliance, risk management or supplier management Ariba, PeopleSoft and eGRC/RSA Archer experience Demonstrated success managing multiple priorities in a fast-paced, cross-functional environment Demonstrated ability to influence behavior through effective written and oral communications with solid presentation skills Demonstrated process focus and ability to independently navigate and resolve complex issues Organized, exceptional attention to detail and adherence to timelines Full COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement of this role. Job Title: Associate Reporting Business Analyst - Plymouth, MN
Description: Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that is improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation is not about another gadget; it is about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There is no room for error. If you are looking for a better place to use your passion and your desire to drive change, this is the place to be. It's an opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)  OptumCare is succeeding at helping people live healthier lives by taking a different approach to health care. OptumCare uses a commonsense approach, focused on avoiding jargon, finding more efficient ways to operate, and providing great, in-the-moment service. We provide that service by making sure serving our patients and providers is always the first priority. Each department works from the same central idea: “How does this affect the service we provide?” Because of the extreme commitment to service, OptumCare focuses on recruiting passionate employees who will take advantage of being empowered to provide the highest level of service at each and every step.  OptumCare is a network of health care providers in local markets whose mission is to help providers deliver the most effective and compassionate care to each patient they serve. OptumCare’s primary focus is on doing the right things for patients, physicians, and the community. It uses an innovative service model focused on measuring what matters and increasing efficiency and performance while providing the highest level of customer service. This model allows OptumCare to make a difference each day by delivering highly personal, customized care management to its patients.  This position requires a unique skill set that includes working with cross-functional leaders on complex projects by providing comprehensive analysis that leads to data-driven decisions. This individual will be responsible for collecting and using data to create and perform queries, and analysis of data; as well as the development of complex adhoc and recurring reports and dashboards. This individual will develop reports and dashboards utilizing VBA programming, MicroStrategies, and/or Tableau, which may include performance metrics at the individual, supervisor, program, and executive level. Reports are generated, stored and delivered daily, weekly and monthly. Customers include service center operations leadership and frontline staff, as well as internal and external Senior Executives. To be successful in this role, the Reporting Business Analyst must be able to interpret business requirements, provide best practice consultation, and develop reporting meeting the needs of the business. In addition, the individual must demonstrate exceptional attention to detail, self-audit for data accuracy, maintain data integrity, and delivering accurate reports/dashboards on-time.  Primary Responsibilities  Gather and interpret relevant data and information Consult with the business to define and document reporting/dashboard requirements Assist in the implementation of reports and dashboards for new or expanding business Develop systematic reporting processes and procedures to ensure timely delivery of daily, weekly, monthly, annual and ad hoc reporting Maintain data integrity by analyzing data for completeness to meet business objectives Build complex reports and dashboards using Excel VBA, MicroStrategies, and/or Tableau Performs data analysis, identifies trends, performance gaps, and process improvement opportunities Recommends opportunities and/or action plans for improved performance based on business need and observable trend Respond quickly to and effectively manage priorities for project requests, deliverables and deadlines Be flexible and work comfortably in a dynamic setting Work both independently and as part of a team to complete objectives Provide explanation and interpretation within area(s) of expertise Use pertinent data and facts to identify and solve a range of problems within area(s) of expertise Communicate effectively with all levels of staff and leadership ensuring messages appropriately tailored to audience whether delivered verbally or in written format Ensure all project requirements are clearly and comprehensively documented, understood and support traceability with reviews with stakeholders to obtain approval/sign off  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience 2+ years of Excel VBA programming experience 1+ years of demonstrated critical thinking and navigating ambiguity to deliver quality results 1+ years of managing multiple priorities and supporting complex projects 1+ years of health care industry experience with exposure to working with call center teams Proficiency with Microsoft Teams, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook  Preferred Qualifications  1+ years of MicroStrategies or Tableau programming experience Ability to influence with and without direct management/authority Demonstrated ability to support innovation and work in a changing environment Excellent verbal and written communication skills Excellent customer/consultant relationship and collaboration skills Works independently with minimal supervision Manage time effectively while meeting expectations of stakeholders and business needs  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status. OptumCare Northwest is now offering qualified candidates an opportunity to join our IT team as an AAT Business Analyst Remote in US. Our company values innovative problem solvers promote personal and professional growth and provides a supportive working environment that affords all its employees a healthy work/life balance.     The Business Analyst is responsible working with teams across diverse locations, backgrounds, and disciplines.  Position has high visibility to leadership and business partners through direct interaction and reporting. Break down complex business requirements into manageable solutions, solve complex technical problems, interface with multiple teams, and support the delivery of solutions in a successful, and timely manner.  The person must be a team player and excel in a Billion dollar starts-up like work environment with focus on development and support of new data products.     OptumCare Northwest creates the opportunity for independent private practitioners to thrive in Washington State. By supporting clinical integration and data driven quality improvement, we have created a high value delivery network, making it possible for our providers to remain focused squarely on their patients.     Status: Regular, Full-time, FLSA Exempt     Primary Responsibilities and Duties  Facilitates the capturing and prioritization of project requirements Work with customers in requirement gathering, testing, training, and support Manages project scope and the change control process as appropriate Works with key stakeholders to ensure project requests are understood Elevate issues, trends, areas for improvement and opportunities, report findings to management Conduct gap analysis and data validation, identifying possible issues in data submission Assist in implementing Quality measure reporting and analytic solutions Deliver expert customer service utilizing technical expertise Contributes to continuous improvement of processes and tools and champions new business processes with key stakeholders Document and support best practices in data product development and adhere to HIPAA, Privacy and Security guidelines Teammate is able to make the complex seem less complex, is a consensus builder and brings people and teams together.      Qualifications and Skills  Ability to learn and use new tools and technology to create and support new data products - ETLs, reports, dashboards, and visualizations Familiarity with Data Modeling and Warehousing, and data visualization Working-level knowledge of MS SQL Server, T-SQL, SSIS, SSRS, Power BI Familiarity with HEDIS measures, Medical Coding, Medicare Advantage program and risk adjustment methodology Understanding of Membership, Claim, Rx, Provider, and EMR data Excellent analytical and collaboration skills to work with internal and external teams Positive, self-motivated individual who can work on multiple tasks and complete them independently Ability to take initiative, handle complex situations, ask questions, stay calm, and find solutions Superior communication skills and ability to communicate effectively with all levels of organization     MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS  Education: Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent combination of education/experience in Information Technology and Healthcare or Health Insurance     Experience: 5 years experience in data systems programming or related field required. 2-5 years of healthcare experience preferred.     Salary based on Market and individual experience + Competitive Benefits

Job Title: Associate Director, Strategic Business Solution Design- Telecommute
Description: Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that’s improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation isn’t about another gadget, it’s about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliable. There’s no room for error. Join us and start doing your life’s best work. (sm)  Join us as a Business Solution Architect in the Strategy & Solutions team within Enterprise Clinical Services (ECS). Be at the leading edge of new initiatives, responsible to evaluate business and operational impacts and design high level solutions. Create Risk Assessments to ensure the complete end to end impact is understood and defined in the early stages of a program or project. Act as a design subject matter expert (SME) during the execution phase. The Solution Architect will work cross-functionally with teams broadly across the Enterprise.  You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.  Primary Responsibilities  Develop high level solutions to new initiative requests that capture the full end to end impact (E2E) for governance review Align new initiatives to Operational, System and Enterprise roadmaps to ensure strategic and operational optimization Gain a deep understanding of enterprise capabilities, operational teams, and product areas. Work cross-functionally to confirm full E2E impacts are captured Create Risk Assessments for new initiatives that outline business risk, operational impacts, and up and downstream partner impacts Remain focused on the member to ensure experience and quality are not compromised Act as a design SME during the project execution phase Act as a member of the ECS Crisis Management SWAT team in the event of a large system or process failure to ensure full scope of the issue is identified and a solution determined  This position requires critical system thinking to develop the best and most efficient solution(s) possible while always prioritizing member experience and quality of care. The role will be required to outline design options for new initiatives that align with the strategic roadmaps and optimize the process and experience.  You'll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  BA/BS degree 5+ years of demonstrated project management, change management, and execution skills with a solid operational focus Proficient EQ expertise with the ability to facilitate a cross functional team through process discussion and impact analysis Experience and ability to influence and drive performance both in a direct and matrixed environment Proven experience and ability to collaborate with and quickly gain credibility, influence, and partner with business leaders and stakeholders Experience with risk planning, risk identification, and response planning skills  Preferred Qualifications  Prior experience within Clinical role Prior experience with process design Experience within Operations with expertise supporting an end-to-end product and/or service Self-motivated and able to work with little direct supervision and drive results with disciplined follow-though Superior executive presence and ability to communicate effectively to the highest levels of leadership  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status.  Careers with Optum. Here's the idea. We built an entire organization around one giant objective; make health care work better for everyone. So when it comes to how we use the world's large accumulation of health-related information, or guide health and lifestyle choices or manage pharmacy benefits for millions, our first goal is to leap beyond the status quo and uncover new ways to serve. Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, brings together some of the greatest minds and most advanced ideas on where health care has to go in order to reach its fullest potential. For you, that means working on high performance teams against sophisticated challenges that matter. Optum, incredible ideas in one incredible company and a singular opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)  All Telecommuters will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy.  Colorado Residents Only: The salary range for Colorado residents is $94,500 to $171,700. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, etc. In addition to your salary, UnitedHealth Group offers benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). No matter where or when you begin a career with UnitedHealth Group, you’ll find a far-reaching choice of benefits and incentives  Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.  UnitedHealth Group is a drug-free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.  Job Keywords: Associate Director, Business Solution Architect, Business Analyst. Job Title: ** Project Consultant - Agile Specialist - Interview Days - November 3rd & 10th (Telecommute)
Description: Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that's improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There's no room for error. Join us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)  As an Advisory Services Consultant, you'll provide people, process, and technology consulting services to strengthen and improve health care operations that result in stronger financial returns and a healthier health care system. You'll use your strong business and technology acumen to work closely with clients to define, develop and implement business requirements to ensure needs are captured and critical deliveries are executed. This consulting career gives you the opportunity to share in a mission that inspires. You'll see your ideas come to life and your achievements recognized. You won’t find more interesting challenges.  You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.  Core Consulting Skills  Primary Responsibilities:  Collaborate with business and technology departments to define deliverables and develop solutions that are reusable across the organization Create written and oral communication artifacts that effectively summarize findings, support fact - based recommendations and provides appropriate detail to substantiate conclusions Conduct research studies that may include collecting, analyzing, trending, and presenting data and recommendations to management Present and evaluate design solutions objectively and facilitate conflict resolution within teams Clearly communicate design solutions, requirements, status updates and outcomes to all stakeholders and varying levels of the organization Work closely with business teams to strategize solutions that support long term business objectives Lead and mentor other Consultants  Agile Based Project Roles  Define, develop and document business requirements to ensure clients' needs are captured and delivered (e.g., users stories, features and capabilities) Participate in all Agile ceremonies (standup, sprint planning, retrospective, release planning) Execute against product roadmaps that focus on minimally viable deliverables, while contemplating the near and long-term future enhancements that increase that value over time Work closely and act as a liaison between Capability Owners / Managers, Scrum Master, RTE, Developers, Quality Assurance Analysts, Architects, Business Partners, and other Technology teams to ensure requirements and design are completely understood Identify and document business process re - engineering opportunities including current and future state process flows Perform quality assurance and user acceptance testing by writing test scripts, executing test cases, and documenting defects (e.g., test case development; active participation and oral communication through defect triaging, use of application lifecycle management tools through code promotion) Perform minor project management duties including the creation of status reports, work plans, and presentations to client leadership  Limited travel is required for this role (less than 25% on average over a year’s time but may involve Monday through Thursday travel for multiple concurrent weeks to satisfy specific client project requirements). Consultants who are not local to an Optum office facility work from a home office when not at the client site.  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  4+ years of experience with MS Word, Excel, Visio, PowerPoint 3+ years of experience in any of the following areas: Business Analysis, Systems Analysis, Project Management, Business Process Improvement, Data Analysis 3+ years of experience working in an Agile environment 3+ years of experience in all phases of Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) / System Development Life Cycle 2+ years of building / creating project deliverables with the ability to manage complex work - streams 1+ year of CA Agile / Rally / Jira experience Experience as a capability analyst or product owner Experience utilizing user experience collateral such as personas, journey maps, etc and translating into effective requirements, feature definition, user stories and product capabilities Experience working in a highly technical and matrixed fast - paced environment Based in Minneapolis area of Minnesota or ability to relocate at own expense to Minnesota or ability to travel up to 25% Full COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement of this role. UnitedHealth Group will adhere to all federal, state and local regulations as well as all client requirements and will obtain necessary proof of vaccination prior to employment to ensure compliance.  Preferred Qualifications  Bachelor's Degree or equivalent work experience Agile / Scrum Certified Experience with Scrum Master and / or Release Train engineer responsibilities Experience with wireframing and process mapping methodologies Military experience in any branch of the U.S. Armed Forces Healthcare experience Experience in Digital Health and/or Consumer Digital products or services development and/or management Experience in consumer driven and designed products and services – ideally healthcare related Experience in all phases of Agile, Scrum, and other Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) methodologies Experience in a Management Consulting / Professional Consulting organization Experience facilitating Joint Application Design (JAD) sessions Experience working with test plans and test cases Experience with the following tools / applications: SAS, SQL, Tableau, JIRA, CA Agile, Aha! Experience working in a product development / management environment Document new APIs / Services and modify existing ones after evaluating the following: user stories, business requirements, high level design documents and database models  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status.
