Job Title: Senior Healthcare Economics Analyst - Naviguard Minnetonka, MN or Telecommute
Description: Senior Healthcare Economics Analyst  As a Senior Healthcare Economics Analyst you will be in a unique position to assist a growing business proactively plan, react to new developments, and implement improvements across multiple departments. Your work will involve looking at large, complex data sets to identify key drivers of trends impacting operations, business efficiency, client satisfaction, and medical costs. You will lead efforts to investigate key business problems in several functional areas, resulting in final analyses ready for leadership teams to utilize and deploy. You will lead research into ambiguous problems and potentially seek new/external data sources. You will analyze and interpret data from various sources, identify appropriate measurement methodologies, design reports, and work with technical, operational, and payment teams to drive performance. Your analyses will be used to create viable, real – world solutions in a complex health care landscape.  Primary Responsibilities  Conduct analyses and reporting designed to inform and produce recommendations Communicate analyses to internal and external customers in writing and verbally to solve complex business problems Collaborate with leaders of strategic initiatives to drive analytic information into business actions Develop comprehensive understanding of programs being measured Predict emerging business needs and develop innovative analytical solutions to evaluate them Lead projects to completion by contributing to database creation, statistical modeling and financial reporting Provide consultative advice on use of data as subject matter expert and interpret/summarize analytical findings Develop analytic projects involving benchmarking Support Negotiation and IDR analytics for unit price justification Monitor results of negotiations and evaluate outcomes  Basic/Minimum Qualifications  Bachelor's Degree in Finance, Actuarial, Math, Statistics, Economics, or a related field 4+ years of analytical experience in financial analysis, health care pricing, health care economics or a related discipline 4+ years of experience in creating and using financial modeling tools, spreadsheets, and information acquisition tools 5+ years of advanced level proficiency in MS Excel Experience with SQL/MS Access  Preferred Qualifications  3+ years using medical claims data including hospital, ancillary, and physician. Tableau development and data visualization techniques Healthcare provider contracting analysis and/or understanding of common reimbursement methods Team-oriented and adaptable individual who can thrive in and contribute to a start-up environment Proven problem-solving skills that generate demonstrable, meaningful, positive impacts Committed self-starter with proven ability to lead projects from concept to completion Willingness to adapt to a continuously changing environment with changing priorities Demonstrated effective interpersonal, influence, collaboration and listening skills Ability to communicate ideas clearly and concisely in writing and verbally to individuals and groups Experience creating and explaining analytical models related to healthcare data to internal and external clients

Job Title: Long Range Planner- Back Office - Telecommute
Description: UnitedHealthcare is a company that's on the rise. We're expanding in multiple directions, across borders and, most of all, in the way we think. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about transforming the health care industry. Ready to make a difference? Make yourself at home with us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)  Here's the thing about challenges. They provide limitless opportunities for greatness. And what we have in mind for you is definitely big. At UnitedHealth Group, we're changing the future of health care and we have the expertise, advanced technology and global resources to make it happen. As a Senior Business Analyst, you'll work with the brightest minds in the business and find yourself digging deep to find the solutions to help people live healthier lives. You'll be responsible for analyzing, reviewing and forecasting data for operational and business planning to impact the health care system. What could be more satisfying than that? Join us!  Here, your performance, your ideas, your unique analysis will combine with a rich assortment of contributors to understand and shape the health care system. At UnitedHealth Group, you'll work with a team that has the creativity and passion to help build new health care solutions that meet emerging market needs. You'll get the opportunity to work with an elite team that goes beyond the usual analysis, they dig deeper knowing our goal is nothing short of transforming health care. Does the challenge of utilizing your analytical abilities on vital projects towards a larger strategic mission excite you?  As a Business Analyst, you'll have the opportunity to provide data analysis to support, compile and report key information for operations and business objectives. This is a position that affords you the ability to drive processes and improvement initiatives. By gathering and documenting business requirements and utilizing your sharp analytical skills to fulfill the needs of the business and/or clients, you will have an impact on healing the health care system. Some people would call you a data geek, but at UnitedHealth Group that passion turned into information is used for decisions made by leadership. This is a challenging role that creates an opportunity to grow and develop while doing your life's best work.  Schedule is Monday-Friday standard business hours. No nights, no weekends and no holidays.  You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.  Primary Responsibilities  Analyze and interpret data to identify trends, patterns and opportunities for the business Communicate analysis and interpretation to appropriate audience Positions in this function conduct and manage outcomes of various studies that include analyzing, reviewing, forecasting, trending, and presenting information for operational and business planning. They support short and long term operational/strategic business activities - by developing, enhancing and maintaining operational information and models. They also develop and implement effective/strategic business solutions through research and analysis of data and business processes. *Employees in jobs labeled with ?SCA? must support a government Service Contract Act (SCA) agreement.  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in. Now, add your energy, your passion for excellence, your near-obsession with driving change for the better. Get the picture? UnitedHealthcare is serving employers and individuals, states and communities, military families and veterans where ever they're found across the globe. We bring them the resources of an industry leader and a commitment to improve their lives that’s second to none. This is no small opportunity. It's where you can do your life's best work.(sm)  Colorado Residents Only: The salary range for Colorado residents is $64,800 to $116,000. Careers with Optum. Here's the idea. We built an entire organization around one giant objective; make health care work better for everyone. So when it comes to how we use the world's large accumulation of health-related information, or guide health and lifestyle choices or manage pharmacy benefits for millions, our first goal is to leap beyond the status quo and uncover new ways to serve. Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, brings together some of the greatest minds and most advanced ideas on where health care has to go in order to reach its fullest potential. For you, that means working on high performance teams against sophisticated challenges that matter. Optum, incredible ideas in one incredible company and a singular opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)  OptumCare is committed to creating an environment where physicians focus on what they do best: care for their patients. To do so, OptumCare provides administrative and business support services to both owned and affiliated medical practices which are part of OptumCare. Each medical practice part and their physician employees have complete authority with regards to all medical decision-making and patient care. OptumCare’s support services do not interfere with or control the practice of medicine by the medical practices or any of their physicians. Job Title: Strategic Account Manager - Work From Home
Description: If you are located within Philadelphia, PA, you will have the flexibility to telecommute* (work from home) as you take on some tough challenges.  Welcome to one of the toughest and most fulfilling ways to help people, including yourself. We offer the latest tools, most intensive training program in the industry and nearly limitless opportunities for advancement. Join us and start doing your life's best work.SM  UnitedHealthcare is a company that's on the rise. We're expanding in multiple directions, across borders and, most of all, in the way we think. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about transforming the health care industry. Ready to make a difference? Make yourself at home with us and start doing your life's best work.SM  Great sales are the result of strong purpose, conviction and pride - pride in your ability and your product. UnitedHealth Group offers a portfolio of products that are greatly improving the life of others. Bring along your passion and do your life's best work.  In providing consumer-oriented health benefit plans to millions of people, our goal is to create higher quality care, lower costs and greater access to health care. Join us and you will be empowered to achieve new levels of excellence and make a profound and personal impact as you contribute to new innovations in a vital and complex system. This position is responsible for providing critical support to the Strategic Account Executive, focusing on data analysis and trending information designed to ensure the SAE role of strategic business partner with our customers is fulfilled. The Analyst will provide analytical information, analysis and recommendations to proactively position the SAE to make fact based decisions about renewals and prepare them for client consultations.  This position will also be accountable to act as strategic backup to the SAE by consulting with customers on all non-service related requests on an as-needed basis. The customer should view this role as an extension of the SAE. Additional role responsibilities include facilitating contract issuance and follow up for signature by the customer. The Analyst will support SAE's handling mostly Fully Insured and some ASO customers. The SAE's book of business will have a mix of simpler mid-size customers and some more complex customer that may be Self-Funded/TPA. Regardless of your role at UnitedHealthcare, the support you feel all around you will enable you to do what you do with energy, integrity, and confidence. So, take the first step in what is sure to be a fast paced and highly diversified career.  All Telecommuters will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy.  Primary Responsibilities  Proactively gather and analyze data to position the SAE to consult with customers including collection and analysis of a customer's plan performance Collaborate with Solutions Engineer and SAE to prepare customer specific consultation packages Ad hoc reporting for customers Consulting with customers to determine plan requirements as needed Conducting data analysis, setting parameters, working with Underwriting, ordering reports and coordinating report distribution for the customers Preparation and coordination of renewal activities including block calls, data collection and analysis, preparation of renewal letters, stop loss vendor reporting, and Medicare D reporting Maintaining accurate information in the Customer Relationship Database (Atlas) for SAE/Field AM and Strategic Customer Business Plan Collaborate with SAE to create and maintain a book of business analysis Collaborate with Renewal Business Analysts on any Requests For Proposal and NBEA. Review of RFP responses for accuracy and coordinate all processes regarding the RFP process Create and maintain a Customer Scorecard that aggregates customer information including trends, adoption and improvement opportunities, obtain information from Field Account Manager for service components Facilitate issuance and signing of FI/ASO contracts ensuring quality of information, obtaining customer approval, acting as liaison between the customer and legal, and supporting the process for non-standard plan components Facilitate Strategic Customer Team meetings as warranted Serve as point person to the customer regarding communication of various UHG/UHC process or program changes. Support SAE in Project management 3rd party audits including claims and Medicare for the SAE Provide continuity in customer relationship through any types of book of business transitions  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  Bachelor's degree (or higher) OR equivalent experience 2+ years of industry experience Ability to travel 25% of the time Highly organized, proficient in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint (ability to create, edit, save and send spreadsheet and presentation). Presentation skills and confidence in delivering data to clients and consultants  Soft Skills  Relationship building skills are important as they are a key team member and face out to our partners  Telecommuting Requirements  Reside within Philadelphia, PA Required to have a dedicated work area established that is separated from other living areas and provides information privacy Ability to keep all company sensitive documents secure (if applicable) Must live in a location that can receive a UnitedHealth Group approved high-speed internet connection or leverage an existing high-speed internet service  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status.  Military & Veterans find your next mission: We know your background and experience is different and we like that. UnitedHealth Group values the skills, experience and dedication that serving in the military demands. In fact, many of the values defined in the service mirror what the UnitedHealth Group culture holds true: Integrity, Compassion, Relationships, Innovation and Performance. Whether you are looking to transition from active duty to a civilian career, or are an experienced veteran or spouse, we want to help guide your career journey. Learn more at https://uhg.hr/transitioning-military  Learn how Teresa, a Senior Quality Analyst, works with military veterans and ensures they receive the best benefits and experience possible. https://uhg.hr/vet  Careers at UnitedHealthcare Employer & Individual. We all want to make a difference with the work we do. Sometimes we're presented with an opportunity to make a difference on a scale we couldn't imagine. Here, you get that opportunity every day. As a member of one of our elite teams, you'll provide the ideas and solutions that help nearly 25 million customers live healthier lives. You'll help write the next chapter in the history of healthcare. And you'll find a wealth of open doors and career paths that will take you as far as you want to go. Go further. This is your life’s best work.SM  Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.  UnitedHealth Group is a drug - free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment. You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.  Combine two of the fastest - growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that's improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about making Healthcare data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There's no room for error. Join us and start doing your life’s best work.SM  The Senior Recovery/Resolution Analyst will work with a team on researching issues to determine feasibility of reducing medical costs through prospective solutions of claim system processes and claim business rules.  This position is full-time (40 hours/week) Monday - Friday. Employees are required to have flexibility to work any of our 8-hour shift schedules during our normal business hours of 6:00am - 6:00pm. It may be necessary, given the business need, to work occasional overtime.We offer 2 weeks of paid training. The hours during training will be 8:00am to 4:30pm Monday-Friday. Training will be conducted virtually from your home.  All Telecommuters will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy.  Primary Responsibilities  Examine, assess, and document business operations and procedures to ensure data integrity, data security and process optimization Investigate, recover, and resolve all types of claims as well as recovery and resolution for health plans, commercial customers, and government entities Investigate and pursue recoveries and payables on subrogation claims and file management Initiate phone calls to members, providers, and other insurance companies to gather coordination of benefits information Process payment on claims Ensure adherence to state and federal compliance policies, reimbursement policies, and contract compliance Use pertinent data and facts to identify and solve a range of problems within area of expertise  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  High School Diploma / GED (or higher) Experience working with medical claims platforms 2+ years of experience with claims auditing and researching claims information 1+ year of experience with evaluation and management coding 1+ year of experience analyzing data and identify cost saving opportunities Knowledge of claims processing systems and guidelines/processes Intermediate skills with Microsoft Excel (create, edit, sort, filter, pivot tables) Experience in healthcare Coder Certification (CPC or CCS or equivalent) If you need to enter a work site for any reason, you will be required to screen for symptoms using the ProtectWell mobile app, Interactive Voice Response (i.e., entering your symptoms via phone system) or a similar UnitedHealth Group-approved symptom screener. When in a UnitedHealth Group building, employees are required to wear a mask in common areas. In addition, employees must comply with any state and local masking orders. Preferred Qualifications  Associate’s Degree (or higher) 1+ years project management experience Knowledge of Medicaid/Medicare Reimbursement methodologies Microsoft Access (create, edit, format, manipulate data)  Telecommuting Requirements  Required to have a dedicated work area established that is separated from other living areas and provides information privacy Ability to keep all company sensitive documents secure (if applicable) Must live in a location that can receive a UnitedHealth Group approved high-speed internet connection or leverage an existing high-speed internet service  UnitedHealth Group is an essential business. The health and safety of our team members is our highest priority, so we are taking a science driven approach to slowly welcome and transition some of our workforce back to the office with many safety protocols in place. We continue to monitor and assess before we confirm the return of each wave, paying specific attention to geography-specific trends. At this time, 90% of our non - clinical workforce transitioned to a work at home (remote) status. We have taken steps to ensure the safety of our 325,000 team members and their families, providing them with resources and support as they continue to serve the members, patients and customers who depend on us.  You can learn more about all we are doing to fight COVID-19 and support impacted communities at: https://www.unitedhealthgroup.com/newsroom/addressing-covid.html  Military & Veterans find your next mission: We know your background and experience is different and we like that. UnitedHealth Group values the skills, experience and dedication that serving in the military demands. In fact, many of the values defined in the service mirror what the UnitedHealth Group culture holds true: Integrity, Compassion, Relationships, Innovation and Performance. Whether you are looking to transition from active duty to a civilian career, or are an experienced veteran or spouse, we want to help guide your career journey. Learn more at https://uhg.hr/transitioning-military  Learn how Teresa, a Senior Quality Analyst, works with military veterans and ensures they receive the best benefits and experience possible. https://uhg.hr/vet  Careers with OptumInsight. Information and technology have amazing power to transform the Healthcare industry and improve people's lives. This is where it's happening. This is where you'll help solve the problems that have never been solved. We're freeing information so it can be used safely and securely wherever it's needed. We're creating the very best ideas that can most easily be put into action to help our clients improve the quality of care and lower costs for millions. This is where the best and the brightest work together to make positive change a reality. This is the place to do your life’s best work.SM  Colorado Residents Only: The hourly range for Colorado residents is $25.63 to $45.72. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, etc. As of the date of this posting, In addition to your salary, UHG offers the following benefits for this position, subject to applicable eligibility requirements: Health, dental, and vision plans; wellness program; flexible spending accounts; paid parking or public transportation costs; 401(k) retirement plan; employee stock purchase plan; life insurance, short-term disability insurance, and long-term disability insurance; business travel accident insurance; Employee Assistance Program; PTO; and employee-paid critical illness and accident insurance. This will specifically include detailed documentation of current business rules and processes, and the identification of process and improvement opportunities to drive more usability and/or cost effective implementation approaches.They will provide analysis, assessment, and tracking of systems or business requirements for assigned business units focusing on business goals. Activities will include screen design, user story development, and use case development.They will execute the investigation, planning, communication and implementation of solutions for complex business problems primarily through the application of technology and/or project management methodologies. They will ensure a disciplined approach and methodology are applied to optimize cost, schedule, service and quality.Key responsibilities can be grouped into three categories – project management, business analysis and leadership.Familiarity with the business values driving a proposed project including health care costs, product portfolio enhancements, regulatory compliance and/or simplification of operations. Familiarity with these goals will drive an end-to-end perspective and understanding of projects.Ability to identify and turn ambiguity in current processes, into tactical and definable solutionsAbility to review existing reports, metrics and data and make recommendations for changes to improve quality of effectiveness and efficiency; including the ability to challenge existing thoughts in a positive and assertive manner.Demonstrates an understanding of the flow of data and information through multiple business areas; includes development of a technical and business knowledge of functional areasOversees the entire project life cycle and ensures the design of the system & process meet the needs of the business as defined in the requirements including documenting the process, assessing and managing risk, forecasting and managing resource needs, developing metrics, clarifying roles, managing the release/rollout of the process to ensure issues and problems are addressed and if applicable ensuring legal, compliance and HIPAA standards.Ability to manage the scope and phasing of projects in an agile environment; forecasting and estimating of effort to ensure that customer expectations on delivery timeframes are effectively balanced. Collaborates with business partners to collect business requirements / reports between areas assigned business unit. Focuses on coordination of participants, review of feasibility, performance needs, and thoroughness of documentation. Expert level ability to develop, define and document user stories and use cases; including current process flow documentation, new process design and developmentAdept at performing risk analysis, identifying risks, documenting risks and risk mitigation approaches; and recommend methods and controls, which will help mitigate the known risks, ensure that the risks are incorporated into the business requirements.Demonstrates knowledge of underlying data structures and data flow as it relates to business processes and data management principles. Demonstrates project management skills, including development of project plans, milestones and the use of the Rally (or similar agile workflow tools) for tracking projects. Join us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)Positions in this function are involved in the research, design, development and presentation of marketing and promotional materials/programs and new products intended to support the sale of products and/or services.This position supports the SME functions involved in developing and producing marketing campaign strategies leveraging social media and paid media digital tactics to promote and sell the organization's products and services. Oversees governance and tool management related to online digital experiences leveraging industry best practices, analytics, technology advancements and optimizations to support the ideal experience from the viewpoint of the customer. Ensures strategic campaign alignment with the digital strategy team. You'll also be expected to create pricing and fee schedules and conduct audits to ensure accuracy.  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  3+ years of analytical experience in financial analysis, healthcare pricing, network management, healthcare economics or related discipline 2+ years of experience with provider payment methodologies and healthcare products 2+ years of experience with financial modeling 2+ years of data mining/data analysis experience Intermediate ability to interpret and review financial modeling results to evaluate the financial impact of contract changes and develop forecasts Advanced level of proficiency in MS Excel and Access  Preferred Qualifications  Undergraduate degree in Finance, Economics or Business Administration Experience in MS Word Reporting experience with systems such as OLR, SAS or SQL  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status. UnitedHealthcare is a company that's on the rise. We're expanding in multiple directions, across borders and, most of all, in the way we think. As a Long-Range Capacity Planner, you will grow and develop as you conduct and manage outcomes of various studies. You will be challenged to analyze, review, and forecast data for operational and business planning. As part of this elite team, you will be empowered to impact the health care system through the analysis and interpretation of data, and presenting recommendations for business solutions.  You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.  Primary Responsibilities  Create Demand forecasts using statistical models and probabilities to achieve financial and service objectives Collaborate with Operations and Finance on the budgetary process Collaborate with all levels of workforce groups/leadership to understand emerging trends Drive toward forecast/financial accuracy goals and objectives Present and explain complex staffing requirements to senior leadership and gain support Deliver Vendor Partner forecast models and their oversight (locked forecasts, cost of training, credits) Drive a culture of root cause analysis, with a focus on removing variation from the system and removing defects from processes Deliver contact rates Provide Membership impact analysis Partner in the impact assessment determination process to build into demand forecasts. Deliver the executive suite of services and reports Manage cross - functional interdependencies Be a change agent and resilient to roadblocks Anticipate customer needs and proactively identified solutions Solves complex problems on own; proactively identifies new solutions to problems Plan, prioritize, organize, and complete work to meet established objectives  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  3+ years of experience in Business, Finance, and/or Workforce management 3+ years of experience in service operations center, call center or Workforce Management 2+ years of experience with Workforce Management software (such as Aspect, Workforce Management IEX, or Blue Pumpkin) Advanced understanding of analytic and presentation tools MS Excel Experience scheduling, conducting planning meetings, and managing capacity  Preferred Qualifications  Undergraduate degree 3+ years of experience working in systems administration, logistics, demand planning, or reporting 2+ years of experience leading or managing projects Understanding of call center systems telecom hardware (PBX, ACD, IVR), call software tools and / or programming requirements (CMS modifications, vector scripting) Health care industry experience Proven track record of identifying defects and process variation, and working to improve processes and reduce defects (Six Sigma, Lean methodologies)  Demonstrated Skills  Analytical skills Advanced statistical analysis skills Excellent written and verbal communication Superior planning and organizational skills that effectively allocate and manage resources across the site Solid problem-solving skills that enable quick identification and efficient resolution of issues  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status  Careers with UnitedHealthcare. Job Title: Senior Actuarial Analyst, ALDP - Minnetonka, MN
Description: We all know that there's a lot more to come in the changes sweeping through the health care industry. But if change is going to shape our world, it's comforting to know that we're shaping the change. As a Senior Actuarial Analyst, ALDP; you will be part of UnitedHealth Group's elite actuarial team committed to changing health care through outstanding service, valuable products, measurable savings, and health care plans designed to fit members' lives, year after year. You'll find an accelerated actuarial development path to support you in your continuing post-graduate education and certification.  You should be ready to face a number of demanding, diverse and complex challenges in the actuarial space. You will need a high level of creativity to solve complex actuarial problems while also developing your leadership and project management skills.  Raising our game in actuarial science will help UnitedHealth Group maintain our leadership for years to come. Join us. Learn more about how you can start doing your life's best work.(sm)  Primary Responsibilities  Prepare Medicare Advantage bids submitted to CMS annually Conduct data analysis and prepare reports for Medicare Advantage submissions Understand and interpret the key drivers of health care trends; projecting expected revenue and cost Develop pricing methodologies and assumptions Conduct and evaluate studies on pricing, utilization and health care costs Perform mathematical analyses and actuarial modeling to provide management with statistical findings and conclusions Perform quantitative analysis of actuarial, financial, utilization and costs data Analyze forecasts and trends to help leaders make decisions  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience 4+ years of Actuarial experience On the Actuarial exam track, having passed a minimum of 4 or more Actuarial exams  Based on the Federal mandate full COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement of this role. UnitedHealth Group will adhere to all federal, state and local regulations as well as all client requirements and will obtain necessary proof of vaccination prior to employment to ensure compliance.  Preferred Qualifications  Experience working in the finance-related field of the health care industry Basic or higher level of proficiency with SAS (Statistical Analysis System) and/or SQL (Structured Query Language) Associate of the Society of Actuaries or Fellow of the Society of Actuaries designation  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status.  Careers at UnitedHealthcare Medicare & Retirement. The Boomer generation is the fastest growing market segment in health care. And we are the largest business in the nation dedicated to serving their unique health and well-being needs. Up for the challenge of a lifetime? Join a team of the best and the brightest to find bold new ways to proactively improve the health and quality of life of these 9 million customers. You'll find a wealth of dynamic opportunities to grow and develop as we work together to heal and strengthen our health care system. Ready? It's time to do your life's best work.(sm)  Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.  UnitedHealth Group is a drug-free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment. Job Title: Sr. FP&A Consultant -Health Plan Revenue & Medical Expense- Orange County, CA - Local Telecommute
Description: The Senior Financial Analyst supports the Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A) team of the OptumCare Local Care Delivery Pacific West Region. This role supports financial planning, forecasting, budgeting, & analysis, with primary responsibility for Health Plan Capitation Revenue and Medical Expense. This role will have regular interaction with executives and various business units. This role involves high visibility with business leaders and therefore requires strong interpersonal and communication skills. A top-notch Financial Analyst is a valuable role for the company, producing analyses that executives can use to grow and improve the business.  Primary Responsibilities  Collaborate with various levels of management to produce annual budget and quarterly forecast that supports short and long term financial planning, with emphasis on Revenue and Medical Expense Understand complex business unit roll-ups, consolidations and eliminations Provide financial support and commentary for month end variance analysis for management review. Prepare financial reports and analysis used during month-end close Prepare internal monthly reporting packages for assigned business units, including Trended Income Statement, Revenue Analysis, G&A Analysis, and Key Performance Indicators, etc. Maintain report design and proactively identify and make changes as needed Update and modify as needed complex financial models and analytical tools Handle ad-hoc reporting and analysis and investigate issues providing explanations and interpretations Perform work in a self-directed manner and work with less structured, more complex issues Act as a resource to others  If you are located within a commutable distance to Orange county / Ontario, CA , you will have the flexibility to telecommute* as you take on some tough challenges  Required Qualifications Bachelor's Degree in Finance, Economics, Actuarial Science, Statistics, Accounting and/or similar discipline with analytical bias. Experience working with Health Plan Capitation Revenue, Risk Adjustment methodology. Experience working with Health Care Medical Expense and understanding of drivers. 3-5+ years of relevant experience in positions that require analysis Ability to manage tight deadlines, prioritize workload and achieve effective results in a fast-paced, dynamic, and often ambiguous environment; multi-tasking skills are crucial. Being self-motivated and resourceful; being able to take initiative. Proven analytical ability and attention to detail Experience with Financial Statements Strong technical skills are required: Advanced Excel skills SQL proficiency strongly preferred Experience creating Ad-hoc Reports Excellent verbal and written communication skills Full COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement of this role. UnitedHealth Group will adhere to all federal, state and local regulations as well as all client requirements and will obtain necessary proof of vaccination prior to employment to ensure compliance.  Preferred Qualifications  Exceptional analytical skills; financial models are efficient, scalable, and intuitive Demonstrated financial and/or analytical experience including familiarity with concepts of forecasting, budgeting, variance analysis, and data interpretation and analysis Experience using Anaplan a plus Experience working with Healthcare financials a plus Solid understanding of generally accepted accounting principles and financial statements Assesses and interprets customer needs and requirements Identifies solutions to non-standard requests and problems  Job Keywords: Financial Planning, financial statements, Health Plan Revenue & Medical Expense, forecasting, budgeting, FP&A, financial analysis, healthcare, managed care, analytics, ad-hoc report, SQL, Excel, Rialto, CA, NAMM, North American Medical Management, SG&A, Ontario, CA, California

Job Title: Clinical Program Consultant, Mental Health Parity - Telecommute
Description: UnitedHealthcare is a company that's on the rise. We're expanding in multiple directions, across borders and, most of all, in the way we think. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about transforming the health care industry. Ready to make a difference? Make yourself at home with us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)  You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.  Primary Responsibilities  Ensure we are meeting Mental Health Parity requirements Act as an MHP Subject Matter Expert (SME) Collect, monitor, and document changes to requirements to mitigate risks and achieve regulatory adherence Facilitate internal and external audits working with UHC Compliance and/or Market Conduct Exam teams Manage escalated Mental Health Parity inquiries from either state/federal regulators or internal business partners Ensure written standards and procedures Provide MHP training, communication, and education Support the collection of data and coordinate/create responses to MHP inquiries, audits, and exams Acts as a liaison between teams coordinate implementation activities Ensure proper reporting and response to state/federal and internal stakeholders Conduct monitoring activities to ensure compliance with MHP program infrastructure Provide support for and participate in regulatory audits Coordinate response to Market Conduct Exam and state audit MHP inquiries or objections and ensure they are consistent with UHC parity standards and processes Conduct MHP state-specific regulatory research with ability to understand and operationalize state and federal laws, as well as obtain Legal, Compliance, & Regulatory Affairs (LCRA) input as needed Participate in the development of business strategy to meet MHP requirements Ensure written MHP standards and procedures are reviewed and refined in collaboration with the internal SMEs from LCRA and key business leaders Facilitate research and response to state or internal business partners’ escalated issues, inquiries and questions related to MHP including, but not limited to: Provider reimbursement issues Network adequacy issues Payment Integrity Clinical and operational processes  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  Undergraduate degree or equivalent experience 5+ years of experience in business operations, regulatory, and/or compliance in a government, healthcare, or managed care environment Experience communicating effectively across multiple departments and with all levels of leadership Experience managing multiple projects/programs Medicaid/Commercial insurance experience Experience with technical writing skills Understanding of: clinical operations, business operations (claims, network) and navigating across departments in the enterprise Intermediate or better proficiency using SharePoint, MS Word, MS Excel and MS PowerPoint  Preferred Qualifications  Bachelor’s degree or higher 5+ years of experience working in a government, healthcare, managed care or health insurance environment 5+ years of experience with regulatory filings and working with regulators 5+ years of experience and knowledge working with state level regulators and regulatory agencies Quality management, project management, care management or utilization management experience Mental Health Parity (MHPAEA) state & federal regulatory requirements Solid legal research skills (i.e. Lexis/Nexis, NILS, Westlaw, etc.) Ability to stay organized and practice effective time management skills Ability to work effectively and congenially with employees at all levels Objective, collaborative approach; relationship builder who strives to build partnerships Full COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement of this role. UnitedHealth Group will adhere to all federal, state and local regulations as well as all client requirements and will obtain necessary proof of vaccination prior to employment to ensure compliance  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status.  Careers with UnitedHealthcare. Let's talk about opportunity. Start with a Fortune 5 organization that's serving more than 85 million people already and building the industry's singular reputation for bold ideas and impeccable execution. Now, add your energy, your passion for excellence, your near-obsession with driving change for the better. Get the picture? UnitedHealthcare is serving employers and individuals, states and communities, military families and veterans where ever they're found across the globe. We bring them the resources of an industry leader and a commitment to improve their lives that's second to none. This is no small opportunity. It's where you can do your life's best work.(sm)  Colorado, Connecticut or Nevada Residents Only: The salary range for Colorado residents is $79,700 to $142,600. The salary range for Connecticut / Nevada residents is $87,900 to $156,900. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, etc. In addition to your salary, UnitedHealth Group offers benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). No matter where or when you begin a career with UnitedHealth Group, you’ll find a far-reaching choice of benefits and incentives.  All Telecommuters will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy.  Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.  UnitedHealth Group is a drug-free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment. Job Title: Senior Financial Analyst - Las Vegas, NV - 10,000 Sign-On Bonus for External Candidates
Description: Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that's improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There's no room for error. Join us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)  OptumCare Nevada is seeking a Senior Financial Analyst that is excited about growing and succeeding with us. The position will partner directly with various teams across the organization to provide analytical and financial support. We are looking for an inquisitive team member that cares about the details, can think and act strategically and has a desire to lead and drive change. Responsibilities and opportunities will grow as you succeed in this position.  This position will provide a hybrid work environment, including both work from home and in-office work settings. It is based in Las Vegas, Nevada  Primary Responsibilities Financial Analysis: Present complex financial analyses in a simplified, concise manner, with recommendations based on the outcomes of the analyses Partner with operational and physician leadership to oversee and measure the performance of various initiatives Perform profitability and performance analysis of revenue contracts Timely calculate productivity and quality-based payments to network physician groups Income Statement Management: Collaborate with senior leaders to identify efficiencies in SG&A, workforce management, and medical affordability initiatives Calculate and analyze business profitability by product and department Support the consolidation and elimination of intercompany transactions Forecasting and Budgeting: Partner with business leaders to drive budget creation and periodic forecasting Develop cost/benefit analyses to support staffing needs for key strategies and initiatives Participate in the development of company-wide business plans and strategies Support month-end close and reporting: Manage the reporting and analysis of Revenues, Medical Costs, and SG&A for the month-end close process Assist with driving the consolidated month-end variance analysis process and report financial performance results to senior management Prepare reporting packages to be distributed to business leadership Create and manage various ad hoc analyses and financial models for senior management Produce well-formatted reports that communicate a clear, compelling message for stakeholders Critically think through complex issues and provide recommendations for improvement  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  Bachelor degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, related field, or relevant work experience 2+ years of progressive professional experience in finance and/or accounting Advanced level of proficiency with MS Excel Ability to effectively perform and support transactional-based finance and accounting transactions Full COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement of this role. UnitedHealth Group will adhere to all federal, state and local regulations as well as all client requirements and will obtain necessary proof of vaccination prior to employment to ensure compliance  Preferred Qualifications  CPA license or MBA degree Hyperion Essbase, PeopleSoft or similar accounting software experience Leadership experience with the ability to develop others and create a positive team-based work environment Advanced level of proficiency with MS Office (PowerPoint, Word, Excel’s Power Pivot/Power Query or Power BI) Executive presence with solid communication and influencing skills Ability to translate highly complex concepts in ways that can be understood by a variety of audiences Ability to solve complex problems through collaboration with operations and other resources  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status.  Careers with Optum. Here's the idea. We built an entire organization around one giant objective; make health care work better for everyone. So when it comes to how we use the world's large accumulation of health-related information, or guide health and lifestyle choices or manage pharmacy benefits for millions, our first goal is to leap beyond the status quo and uncover new ways to serve. Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, brings together some of the greatest minds and most advanced ideas on where health care has to go in order to reach its fullest potential. For you, that means working on high performance teams against sophisticated challenges that matter. Optum, incredible ideas in one incredible company and a singular opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)  Colorado, Connecticut or Nevada Residents Only: The salary range for Colorado residents is $64,800 to $116,000. The salary range for Connecticut / Nevada residents is $71,400 to $127,400. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, etc. In addition to your salary, UnitedHealth Group offers benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). No matter where or when you begin a career with UnitedHealth Group, you’ll find a far-reaching choice of benefits and incentives.  PLEASE NOTE** The Sign On Bonus is only available to external candidates. Candidates who are currently working for a UnitedHealth Group, UnitedHealthcare or a related entity in a full time, part time, or per diem basis (“Internal Candidates”) are not eligible to receive a Sign On Bonus.  Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.  UnitedHealth Group is a drug - free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment. Job Title: Proofing and Quality Assurance Analyst - Telecommute
Description: If you want to achieve more in your mission of health care, you need to be smart about the business of health care. Financial discipline and accountability count more today than ever. Which is why your performance and innovation will find a reception here like nowhere else as you help people live healthier lives while doing your life's best work. (sm)  In this Government Compliance Analyst role, you will serve as a key member of the Accounting department to support OptumServe’ s external audits and other financial compliance activities driven by cognizant federal auditors (e.g. DCAA, CMS). The position will report to the Associate Director of Government Compliance.  If you are located in Falls Church, VA, you will have the flexibility to telecommute* as you take on some tough challenges.  Primary Responsibilities  Support incurred cost audits, accounting system audits, CAS disclosure statement audits, and assist in the preparation of the annual Incurred Cost Proposal Prepare documentation in support of external and internal audits Periodically support the broader accounting team in performing ad-hoc activities  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  3+ years of experience in Accounting for US Government Contractor 2+ years of experience supporting audits Experience as an Accountant/Analyst with previous background in U.S. Government contractor regulatory financial compliance or similar role Direct experience working with Deltek Costpoint, with strengths in the general ledger module Advanced proficiency in working with large amounts of data in Excel Experience responding to audit requests in an accurate, timely, and complete manner in a deadline driven environment Full COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement of this role. UnitedHealth Group will adhere to all Federal, State, and local regulations as well as all client requirements and will obtain necessary proof of vaccination prior to employment to ensure compliance  Preferred Qualifications  Extremely detail oriented with high level of accuracy and sound judgement Working knowledge of the Federal Acquisition Regulation PAT 31 (FAR) Working knowledge of government cost accounting standards (CAS) and CASB Disclosure Statement Working understanding of indirect rates and the contract close out process Advanced Microsoft Excel skills Live in the Falls Church, VA area  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status.  Careers with Optum. Here's the idea. We built an entire organization around one giant objective; make health care work better for everyone. So when it comes to how we use the world's large accumulation of health-related information, or guide health and lifestyle choices or manage pharmacy benefits for millions, our first goal is to leap beyond the status quo and uncover new ways to serve. Description: Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Job Title: UnitedHealthcare Senior Marketing and Website Analyst - Eden Prairie, MN or Telecommute
Description: UnitedHealthcare is a company that's on the rise. We're expanding in multiple directions, across borders and, most of all, in the way we think. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about transforming the health care industry. Ready to make a difference? Make yourself at home with us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)  At UnitedHealthcare Hearing, we believe in delivering quality, convenient, affordable hearing care and exceeding our member’s expectations. As part of the UnitedHealthcare and UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, we’re working together to help people live healthier lives and to help the health system work better for everyone.  The Senior Marketing and Website Analyst is chiefly responsible for promoting the UnitedHealthcare Hearing brand, culture, and health care capabilities through strategic, best-in-class digital and print experiences for our members. In partnership with enterprise shared resources, this role will manage, optimize, and grow the external website (UHCHearing.com) through seamless user experiences (UX), web and digital design, SEO, and analytics. They will lead the ongoing development and enhancements of digital platforms, including the website and Salesforce Marketing Cloud ability to support campaigns, drive engagement and conversion, from start to finish.  The ideal candidate is a highly self-motivated and accountable individual, who is a critical thinker and can work both independently and collaboratively, with solid attention to detail and an enthusiasm for learning new technologies and tools. This individual must have polished interpersonal and presentation skills and be comfortable interacting with cross-departmental stakeholders.  If you are located in the state of Minnesota, Central or Eastern time zones, you will have the flexibility to telecommute* as you take on some tough challenges.  Primary Responsibilities Website: Oversees landing page development for external marketing campaigns, as well as day-to-day maintenance, content updates, and performance of the external website (UHCHearing.com) Manages website enhancements and defect queues with website development team Builds and updates measurement codes on websites using Google Tag Manager Reviews and edits web content with a critical eye, both from a grammatical, style, and SEO perspective SEO: Oversees and manages the organic search strategy and performance for UHCHearing.com, leveraging Google Search Console, and other tools Leads opportunistic keyword research for UHCHearing.com, helping to inform content areas for the site, recommendations for implementation, and tracking of performance Oversees SEO efforts for local provider markets, helping to develop solid organic performance and visibility for individual locations Member Campaigns: Works with both internal and external partners (Creative, Marketing, Sales, Legal / Regulatory, Data & Analytics, Salesforce, Fulfillment Print Vendors, etc.) to coordinate and scrub campaign distribution lists and execute effective mail and email campaigns Creates, manages, and optimizes Google Ads including figuring custom reports and developing dashboards to evaluate the success of campaigns Develops, and maintains relationships with internal stakeholders and keeps them informed about campaign plans, results, and status of key initiatives Analytics: Regularly analyzes website, Intranet, email campaigns, e-newsletters, and other digital channels’ performance to produce regular reports and recaps, and provide actionable insights to optimize efforts by platform, audience, and/or campaign Manages analytic platforms and tools, including maintenance, governance, and updates (Google Analytics and Adobe Analytics, Salesforce Marketing Cloud, etc.) Coordinates with development team and advertising partners to manage and place advertising tracking codes on external website  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  Bachelor’s degree in marketing, analytics, data sciences or a related field 3+ years of relevant experience or proven track record of applicable experience or accomplishments Familiarity with SEO strategy, keyword research, or website audits Familiarity utilizing various analytic tools and tracking programs such as Google Analytics, Google Search Console or Google Tag Manager Based on the Federal mandate full COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement of this role. UnitedHealth Group will adhere to all federal, state and local regulations as well as all client requirements and will obtain necessary proof of vaccination prior to employment to ensure compliance.  Preferred Qualifications  Experience working in Google Ads and Salesforce Marketing Cloud Excellent attention to detail, oral and written communication skills  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status.  Careers with UnitedHealthcare. Let's talk about opportunity. Start with a Fortune 5 organization that's serving more than 85 million people already and building the industry's singular reputation for bold ideas and impeccable execution. Now, add your energy, your passion for excellence, your near-obsession with driving change for the better. Get the picture? UnitedHealthcare is serving employers and individuals, states and communities, military families and veterans where ever they're found across the globe. We bring them the resources of an industry leader and a commitment to improve their lives that's second to none. This is no small opportunity. It's where you can do your life's best work.(sm)  Colorado, Connecticut or Nevada Residents Only: The salary range for Colorado residents is $64,800 to $116,000. The salary range for Connecticut / Nevada residents is $71,400 to $127,400. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, etc. In addition to your salary, UnitedHealth Group offers benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). No matter where or when you begin a career with UnitedHealth Group, you’ll find a far-reaching choice of benefits and incentives.  All Telecommuters will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy  Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.  UnitedHealth Group is a drug-free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment. Primary Responsibilities  Consolidate the operating cost story for the Community & State/Medicaid line of business within UHC Prepare monthly, quarterly and annual financial packages with an understanding of all variances and key action items by product within the Community & State segment Support the overall UHC capital team with data specific to the Medicaid capital projects and inclusion of these projects and/or benefits into the forecast Collaborate with cross-functional teams in conjunction with budgeting and forecasting processes, including other finance and business teams Develop and automate reporting to drive insight into operating expense results and forecasts Continually develop and refine internal financial reporting and process improvements  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in. Job Title: Senior Financial Analyst - Minnetonka, MN or Telecommute
Description: UnitedHealthcare is a company that's on the rise. We're expanding in multiple directions, across borders and, most of all, in the way we think. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about transforming the health care industry. Ready to make a difference? Make yourself at home with us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)  UnitedHealthcare Community & State is seeking a Senior Financial Analyst to join the segment’s Business Development Finance team. The Senior Financial Analyst will be an integral part of BD Finance supporting an aggressive new product/market growth agenda in the Medicaid space. The position will engage directly with the broader UHC C&S Growth/Business Development team providing financial and competitive analysis for various types of Requests for Proposal (RFPs). A successful Senior Financial Analyst will demonstrate the ability to perform detailed analyses of opportunities and also produce polished, executive-level presentations of the same. The position will work on a daily basis with others on the BD Finance team, collaborate extensively with our business and health plan partners, and must be comfortable working independently and as part of a team.  The role is suited to individuals who are comfortable switching work focus on a regular basis to suit business needs and shifting priorities. This is a unique opportunity to directly support the UHC C&S growth agenda while enjoying competitive benefits, advancement potential and valuable healthcare industry exposure. Ready to take the next step? Apply today.  You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.  Primary Responsibilities  Review RFPs to isolate, summarize and interpret standard key financial elements important to the UnitedHealthcare Community & State business Perform competitor financial analysis following established processes for data acquisition and presentation. Support (and lead certain) UHC C&S market share /membership projections Lead administrative cost builds capturing applicable start-up, value-add service and ongoing staffing costs for opportunities; support staffing benchmarking and executive review activities. Partner with UHC C&S Actuarial Team on pro forma builds Lead preparation of new business opportunity analysis materials Support process of translation of new business opportunity financials to the forecasting process (including supporting development of start-up cost topside estimates for the forecast) Develop innovative approaches to streamline C&S BD Finance modeling/processes. Employ technical knowledge to automate disparate staffing submission uploads, aggregation, and monetization in op ex model Ad Hoc analyses. Support/lead processes adjacent/related to BD Finance (e.g. feed growth opportunity benefits/IOI into Capital investment process) Work, with limited oversight, on analyzing and solving complex issues Serve as a resource to others. Share process knowledge with the team and support developing 'best in class' processes  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  Bachelor's degree in Finance, Economics, Mathematics, Actuarial Science, Health Administration or another technical related field from an accredited college or university 2+ years of experience with data analysis and working with large data sets required; background of collecting data using different sources Advanced Excel skills: data analysis and report generation (formulas, calculations, pivot tables, charts, graphs, etc.) Solid PowerPoint/presentation skills: ability to produce polished, executive level decks distilling Proficiency with MS Word Ability to down large amounts of information to what is most important and effectively “telling the story” Experience and comfort interacting with various levels of management Experience prioritizing work on multiple complex assignments Experience and ability to meet deadlines  Preferred Qualifications  Health insurance experience with knowledge of Medicaid products/benefits Experience working cross functionally Experience working for a large company Possess a background in the healthcare Industry; general knowledge of Medicaid, Medicare and/or Commercial health plans Familiarity with UnitedHealthcare segments/products RFP process experience Working knowledge of Hyperion Essbase/SmartView Comfortable with changing priorities and an environment of organizational change Excellent communication, time/project management, problem solving, organizational, and analytical skills Ability and willingness to be flexible and adaptable Ability to learn quickly and work with minimal supervision Full COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement of this role. Job Title: Senior Compliance Analyst (Mental Health Parity) - Telecommute
Description: UnitedHealthcare is a company that's on the rise. We're expanding in multiple directions, across borders and, most of all, in the way we think. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about transforming the health care industry. Ready to make a difference? Make yourself at home with us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)  Position leads/supports the ongoing upkeep of UMR’s MHPAEA NQTL support process and documentation. This person will coordinate with clinical, network, claim and reporting to ensure all documentation is current and, in a format, to be shared with customers and their brokers. This person will monitor changes in laws and regulations to ensure compliance with Federal and state laws. This person will be responsible for responding to customer and broker requests for our standard documentation and for coordinating responses should a customer receive a DOL request and asks for our support. This person will also support maintaining documentation needed to respond to member requests for NQTL information.  You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.  Primary Responsibilities Assesses and interprets regulatory requirements as well as customer needs Identifies solutions to non-standard requests and problems Solves moderately complex problems and/or conducts moderately complex analyses Works with minimal guidance; seeks guidance on only the most complex tasks Translates concepts into practice Provides explanations and information to others on difficult issues Coaches, provides feedback, and guides others Acts as a resource for others with less experience Lead for: Ongoing upkeep of UMR’s NQTL support process and documentation Regulatory end to end process audits HCR mailbox response (part of team that responds)  Competencies  Identify compliance contacts/stakeholders to promote program implementation within the business Collaborate with applicable stakeholders to promote adherence to compliance programs Develop/implement compliance standards, policies, procedures and codes of conduct Demonstrate understanding of the impact of applicable MHPAEA laws, regulations, mandates and contracts on our business and operations Facilitate understanding of applicable MHPAEA laws, regulations, mandates with specific audiences (e.g. business leaders, product owners, business operations) Develop and/or deliver training on MHPAEA to applicable audiences Conduct internal monitoring/auditing to identify process gaps and help the business address organizational risks Develop and update compliance scorecards/reports, and communicate to applicable stakeholders (e.g., Key Compliance Indicators) Identify and communicate compliance status and issues to applicable audiences (e.g., business leaders, product owners, business operations, board members) Demonstrate knowledge of the healthcare industry and associated processes and procedures  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in. Job Title: Senior Financial Analyst II - Eden Prairie, MN or Telecommute
Description: Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that's improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There's no room for error. Join us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)  Primary Responsibilities  Build and maintain activity-based cost allocation models Analyze membership changes and impact on FTEs and operating cost Partner with senior leaders to build and manage budgets Assist with identifying, analyzing and driving cost savings into the organization Conduct cost-benefit analysis of IT capital and other investments and present to senior leadership with recommendations General ledger research and analysis for month-end close Monthly results reporting and variance analysis  You'll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  Undergraduate degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field 3+ years of financial and/or accounting experience Proven experience driving business performance in a high growth environment Experience anticipating accounting, financial reporting, forecasting and operational issues, assessing their implications and developing and implementing an appropriate action plan Experience working collaboratively and influence across a matrix environment to drive revenue enhancement and expense management initiatives Intermediate level experience with Microsoft Excel (Index match)  Preferred Qualifications  MBA or CPA Proficient Hyperion Essbase Proficient in SQL and Microsoft Access  Careers with Optum. Here's the idea. We built an entire organization around one giant objective; make health care work better for everyone. So when it comes to how we use the world's large accumulation of health-related information, or guide health and lifestyle choices or manage pharmacy benefits for millions, our first goal is to leap beyond the status quo and uncover new ways to serve. Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, brings together some of the greatest minds and most advanced ideas on where health care has to go in order to reach its fullest potential. For you, that means working on high performance teams against sophisticated challenges that matter. Optum, incredible ideas in one incredible company and a singular opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)  Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.
