Job Title: _Senior Data Architecture Analyst - Nashville, TN or Telecommute
Description: No industry is moving faster than health care. And no organization is better positioned to lead health care forward. We need attention to every detail with an eye for the points no one has considered. The rewards for performance are significant. You'll help improve the health of millions. And you'll do your life's best work.(sm)  Optum is seeking a Senior Data Architect Analyst to be an integral part of our data platforms and technologies enhancement initiatives for our client health systems. As a Senior Data Architect Analyst, you will be responsible for advancing the architectural effectiveness of client data models and optimizing data movement using innovative solutions using various data platforms and technology. Working collaboratively with our analytics delivery and operations teams, you will help define and implement a cohesive data architecture strategy tied to our client’s strategic direction, existing technologies, engineering processes, and best practices to support world-class analytics solutions for the entire healthcare delivery system.  You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.  Primary Responsibilities  Lead data architecture, data movement design, and data modelling initiatives to expanded and refine the content within the client data warehouse Contribute to and advance data architecture strategy and adherence Provide clarity and recommendations on tools, patterns, and directions that will accelerate or delivery Document and communicate architectural vision, technical strategies, and trade-offs to gain broad buy-in Reduce inefficiencies through rationalization and standards adherence Responsible for creating and maintaining the conceptual, logical, and physical data models for enterprise data warehouse/data mart initiatives in the healthcare provider domain Responsible for identifying, updating, and curating the data standardization and data quality rules Responsible for leading and providing direction for data management, data profiling and source to target mapping Responsible for optimizing and troubleshooting and data engineering processes Build, optimize, and manage modern large-scale data pipelines ETL/ELT processing to support data integration for analytics Provide guidance and support to the development and QA teams on triaging the remediating complex data scenarios identified during development/testing Responsible for creating data migration strategies for both historical and incremental data on an ongoing basis Research, analyze, recommend, and select technical approaches for solving difficult and challenging migration, development, and integration problems Lead and contribute to data implementation projects and/or project independent workstreams Create high complexity detailed technical design specifications and documentation Work independently, but effectively partner with a broader team, to design and develop enterprise data solutions Mentor junior team members Ability to creatively take on new challenges and work outside comfort zone. Strong written and oral communications along with presentation and interpersonal skills as well as the ability to learn new technologies and analytics techniques while on the job  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  Bachelor’s Degree 3+ years of experience in designing and implementing data models and data normalization to support analytics with solid knowledge of dimensional modeling concepts 3+ years of experience designing and implementing SQL query and ETL performance optimization 3+ years of data modeling experience in healthcare data and related data domains 1+ years of experience with Epic Clarity and/or Caboodle data models  Preferred Qualifications  2+ years of data engineering and data warehousing experience designing and building data warehouses, data marts, data lakes, ETL packages, etc. 2+ years of experience in data profiling & data analysis in a data warehouse environment 2+ years of experience in creating Source to Target Mappings and ETL design for integration of new/modified data streams into the data warehouse/data marts 2+ years of experience working with Health Catalyst product offerings, including data warehousing solutions, knowledgebase, and analytics solutions Epic certifications with a focus on analytical capabilities Working knowledge of key health management related areas, e.g. network management, population health, quality, compliance, provider engagement, etc. Experience participating in cross-functional efforts, with proven success in creating analytics across many provider domains General knowledge of the health care ecosystem, including understanding the relationship between payers and providers, and how analytics enables transformation Solid ability to manage analytics initiatives with appropriate guidance Ability to manage multiple client initiatives or projects concurrently Ability to communicate complex concepts verbally and in writing Experience working with advanced analytical methodologies or algorithms Experience working with a portfolio of analytical capabilities, tools, or products Advanced degrees or certifications in technology, analytics, information systems, data science or related field One or more Epic Certifications Willingness to travel up to 10% Full COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement of this role. UnitedHealth Group will adhere to all federal, state and local regulations as well as all client requirements and will obtain necessary proof of vaccination prior to employment to ensure compliance  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status. Energize your career with one of Healthcare’s fastest growing companies.  You dream of a great career with a great company – where you can make an impact and help people. We dream of giving you the opportunity to do just this. And with the incredible growth of our business, it’s a dream that definitely can come true. Already one of the world’s leading Healthcare companies, UnitedHealth Group is restlessly pursuing new ways to operate our service centers, improve our service levels and help people lead healthier lives. We live for the opportunity to make a difference and right now, we are living it up.  This opportunity is with one of our most exciting business areas: Optum – a growing part of our family of companies that make UnitedHealth Group a Fortune 10 leader.  Optum helps nearly 60 million Americans live their lives to the fullest by educating them about their symptoms, conditions and treatments; helping them to navigate the system, finance their healthcare needs and stay on track with their health goals. No other business touches so many lives in such a positive way. And we do it all with every action focused on our shared values of Integrity, Compassion, Relationships, Innovation & Performance.  Primary Responsibilities  Coordinate internal resources for the flawless execution of projects Ensure that all projects are delivered on-time and within scope Assist in the definition of project scope and objectives, involving all relevant stakeholders and ensuring technical feasibility Develop a detailed project plan to monitor and track progress Develop and document SOW in accordance to project scope Manage changes to the project scope, project schedule and project costs using appropriate verification techniques Manage project budget and funding status in accordance with Finance and Accounting requirements Measure project performance using appropriate tools and techniques Report and escalate to management as needed Manage the relationship with the client and all stakeholders Perform risk management to minimize project risks Create and maintain comprehensive project documentation Meet with client and internal stakeholder to take detailed ordering briefs and clarify specific requirements of each project Track project performance, specifically to analyze the successful completion of short and long-term goals Use and continually develop leadership skills Perform other related duties as assigned Develop spreadsheets, diagrams and process maps to document needs Create, maintain, and distribute project scorecards to include executive summary and key milestone progress. Oversee Performance Guarantee execution – including risk mitigation, tracking progress, and escalation to leadership as needed. Host and manage weekly project Executive Summary review for senior leadership. Strategically manage overall project pipeline to ensure highest priority projects are receiving optimal resource attention, in instances where resource constraints are presented. Job Title: Senior Project Manager - Las Vegas, NV
Description: UnitedHealthcare is a company that's on the rise. We're expanding in multiple directions, across borders and, most of all, in the way we think. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about transforming the health care industry. Ready to make a difference? Make yourself at home with us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)  On the one hand, no industry is moving faster than health care. On the other, no organization is better positioned to lead health care forward than Optum and UnitedHealth Group. That's what makes this opportunity so applause worthy. We have hundreds of business verticals across our matrixed organizations that are bringing thousands of new ideas, services and products to the marketplace every year. Our goal is simple. Use data and technology to help drive change and make the health care system work better for everyone. When you join us as a Project Manager, you'll be engaged in a complex business model that is highly adaptable to build solutions that meet their customer needs in a competitive and effective way.  Primary Responsibilities  Lead or help develop program or project scope statements, in consultation with applicable stakeholders (e.g. program/project charter, Statement of Work, Business Vision Document) Work with resource managers to drive the identification of the skills, duration and effort required for successful project execution Collect, analyze and maintain financial forecast information (e.g. labor, hardware, software), using input from applicable sources Establish/apply quality objectives, criteria, standards and levels using appropriate quality management methods, with stakeholder input (e.g. key performance indicators, scope definition) Develop, communicate and implement program/project risk/issue management plans and strategies (e.g. mitigation, avoidance, transfer, acceptance) This role will challenge your ability to work on complex projects where deadlines and scope shift frequently. You'll need flexibility, agility and the ability to adapt to change while maintaining strong relationships with stakeholders in a highly cross-matrixed environment.  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  Undergraduate degree or equivalent work experience 3+ years of project management experience using data and information to make business decisions 3 years utilizing ability to influence others without authority 2 years experience gaining acceptance for plans then implement across organization & boundaries Proficiency with MS Project, Excel, Visio, PowerPoint and SharePoint Full COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement of this role. UnitedHealth Group will adhere to all federal, state and local regulations as well as all client requirements and will obtain necessary proof of vaccination prior to employment to ensure compliance.  Preferred Qualifications  PMP Certification Healthcare experience  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status. As a member of one of our elite teams, you'll provide the ideas and solutions that help nearly 25 million customers live healthier lives. You'll help write the next chapter in the history of health care. And you'll find a wealth of open doors and career paths that will take you as far as you want to go. Go further. Description: If you want to achieve more in your mission of health care, you have to be really smart about the business of health care. Challenge yourself, your peers and our industry by shaping what health care looks like and doing your life's best work.(sm)  If you are located in Columbus, OH, you will have the flexibility to telecommute* as you take on some tough challenges.  Primary Responsibilities  Positions in this function include those responsible for management and administration of multiple functions, or management of general business operations, including manager of unit providing oversight of the office regulatory reporting Manage daily operations of multiple levels of staff and multiple functions/departments across one or more business units. May include day to day site operations, management leadership internal and external to organization, accountable for financial and non-financial results (budgets and actuals). Project management and implementation, staff management Project management and implementation, staff management Manages and is accountable for professional employees Impact of work is most often at the local level Based on the Federal mandate full COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement of this role. UnitedHealth Group will adhere to all federal, state and local regulations as well as all client requirements and will obtain necessary proof of vaccination prior to employment to ensure compliance.  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  Undergraduate degree or equivalent experience 3+ years of experience managing projects using agile/lean 5+ years overall experience successfully working in a high pace/matrix environment 2+ years of management/supervisory experience (will have HR responsibility for 2 FTEs) Experience working cross functionally Experience with Quality Improvement strategy and ability to dive that strategy to completion Experience training and mentoring  Preferred Qualifications  Lean/Agile certification Advanced Degree Healthcare insurance industry experience Understanding of Healthcare Claims process  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status.  Careers at UnitedHealthcare Community & State. Challenge brings out the best in us. It also attracts the best. That's why you'll find some of the most amazingly talented people in health care here. We serve the health care needs of low income adults and children with debilitating illnesses such as cardiovascular disease, diabetes, HIV/AIDS and high-risk pregnancy. Our holistic, outcomes-based approach considers social, behavioral, economic, physical and environmental factors. Join us. Work with proactive health care, community and government partners to heal health care and create positive change for those who need it most. This is the place to do your life's best work.(sm)  All Telecommuters will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy.  For more information on our Internal Job Posting Policy, click here. Job Title: Sr Project Manager, Wellness and Incentives - Telecommute
Description: Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that's improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There's no room for error. Join us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)  Join us as a Senior Project Manager, where you will be instrumental in delivering our technical product roadmap. You will lead 2-4 Scrum Teams and provide Project and Program level support across our Wellness and Incentives group based on need/skill level. As part of the PMO Group, you will report to the PMO Manager, Wellness and Incentives Portfolio, and will work with the Product and Engineering groups to ensure quality and timely delivery.  You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within United States as you take on some tough challenges.  Primary Responsibilities  Develop and manage detailed project and delivery plans, completion of projects that span multi departments and cross functional areas Work with Tech Leads and Product Owners to complete high level sizing to validate team and mid-level roadmaps Lead the Scrum teams in using Agile methodology and scrum best practices Build effective relationships and communicate regularly with team members and other stakeholders Provide project updates to multiple team members about strategy, monitor progress and make adjustments Use industry best practices, techniques, and standards throughout the entire project execution Work with team to size stories/requirements building a reliable team velocity that enables the team to build the estimation skillset Ensure task tracking system accurately reflects ongoing work and clearly report on results Aggressively identify cross-functional interdependencies and risks to successfully plan and manage  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  BA/BS degree or equivalent Project Manager experience 3+ years of progressively responsible experience in project management supporting a Product team Experience managing Scrum, Kanban and other Agile project types Experience working with Product and Engineering Organizations Experience with project management software tools, methodologies, and best practices Familiar with software development concepts to support the technical direction of the team  Preferred Qualifications  Certified Scrum Master (CSM) or equivalent experience with agile development methodologies Experience with Atlassian’s JIRA and Confluence Ability to improve productivity through management and recommending changes Thrives in cross-functional, multi-disciplinary team structures Strong resource development skills, focusing on encouraging self-management of resources  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status.  Technology Careers with Optum. Information and technology have amazing power to transform the health care industry and improve people's lives. This is where it's happening. This is where you'll help solve the problems that have never been solved. We're freeing information so it can be used safely and securely wherever it's needed. We're creating the very best ideas that can most easily be put into action to help our clients improve the quality of care and lower costs for millions. This is where the best and the brightest work together to make positive change a reality. This is the place to do your life's best work.(sm)  All Telecommuters will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy.  Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.  UnitedHealth Group is a drug - free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment. Primary Responsibilities  Participates in active project work groups and committees, and provides recommendations to achieve goals Contributes to planning and decision making, coordinates project resources and collaborates with project stakeholders to collect and disseminate project information Monitors deliverables and facilitates communication with team members and other appropriate parties to ensure commitments are met Manages multiple projects at one time with successful outcomes Secures support on initiatives among team resources, establish deadlines for projects and makes sure output is on-target, on-strategy and on-time Ensures accuracy of all deliverables including presentations, contracts, and spreadsheets Performs all other related duties as assigned  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in. Job Title: New Client Implementations Project Manager, Med D
Description: Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that is improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation is not about another gadget; it is about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There is no room for error. If you are looking for a better place to use your passion and your desire to drive change, this is the place to be. It's an opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)  Through our family of businesses and a lot of inspired individuals, we're building a high-performance health care system that works better for more people in more ways than ever. Now we're looking to reinforce our team with people who are decisive, brilliant - and built for speed.  Come to UnitedHealth Group, and share your ideas and your passion for doing more. We have roles that will fit your skills and knowledge. We have diverse opportunities that will fit your dreams.  As new pharmacy clients are welcomed to OptumRx, the new client implementation team offers a best-in-class onboarding experience that is powered by solid governance and project management. Our Health Plan Implementation team is a separate and distinct division that handles our most sophisticated new Health Plan clients.  The Senior Implementation Project Manager (Sr. IPM) - Med D will oversee all Medicare aspects of Health Plan client implementations. They will work with a team of experts to successfully onboard new clients. Sr. IPM will support the organization’s strategic direction and growth in the PBM industry by applying a clearly defined project management approach for new Health Plan implementations.  You will actively engage with all operations and account management leaders across the OptumRx organization to deliver on our promise and manage to a budget throughout the implementation process. In this role, you will also have the opportunity to participate in the sales process for new clients, this includes reviewing and preparing RFP responses, attending prep sessions and delivering in finalist sales presentations, consultation relations, and capability demonstrations.  You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.  Primary Responsibilities  Manage and lead new Health Plan (all sizes) implementation, including Commercial, Medicaid, Medicare, and Exchange lines of business Develop detailed work plans, schedule estimates, resource plans, status reports, and implementation priorities Direct and coordinate the teams of operations, business, product and technical contributors to ensure the on-time, within budget, successful delivery of properly scoped high-quality project requirements Ensure factual, timely, and quality implementation tracking, analysis, reporting and communication strategies are utilized using established policies & procedures Proactively manage client expectations & performance guarantee commitments by partnering with all internal & external project stakeholders. Support the Sales process with client RFP responses, pre finalist support, and represent Optum Rx Implementations at finalist meetings Serve as Lead communicator for overall project status, with regard to issues, risk, & mitigation strategies for clients, OptumRx, & Optum IT. Provide OptumRx readiness reporting & Optum Elevate readiness reporting Ensure Service Now automated work flow tool updates are timely and meet QA standards to ensure 100% accuracy per timeline for each implementation. Manage internal team updates to the client SN implementation case to ensure completeness Provide technical, business, analytical, and strategic guidance to entire ORX implementation team. Attend all IT development meetings to ensure contractual obligations are met and meet regularly with IT lead on progress and obstacles to deploy Review deliverables and ensure adherence to quality standards, implementations and team performance measurements Obtain signoffs on all deliverables from key internal & external project stakeholders. Make timely and appropriate decisions to ensure implementations are on track for successful service and go live readiness Recommend and take necessary actions to direct the analysis and solutions of problems; escalate when needed. Ensure developed solutions match Client requirements Partner with Account Management to ensure all implementation items are tracked, documented and closed, in agreement with the client intent Lead cross-functional quality initiatives centered on improving the implementation process, & post go live lessons to learn reviews with clients and executive leaders  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  Bachelor’s Degree (or equivalent experience) 2+ years of experience in the PBM, health care, pharmacy industry 2+ years of Implementation or large healthcare project management experience Experience in influencing internally and externally with soft power, driving cross - functional collaboration, and negotiating win-win solutions Willing to work through year-end holiday season (Christmas week/NYE/New Year’s Day) as necessary to address client go-live issues and support cross-functional teams Ability to travel up to 35% Full COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement of this role. UnithedHealth Group will adhere to all federal, state and local regulations as well as all client requirements and will obtain necessary proof of vaccination prior to employment to ensure compliance.  Preferred Qualifications  Master’s Degree Project Management Professional Certification PBM Account Management experience Independent contributor with the ability to multi-task, work with leaders and ensure client satisfaction Demonstrated ability to message, position, and present information for maximum customer impact and influence Proven ability to ascertain client needs through active listening skills, and consultatively work with clients to achieve business objectives Effective skills for navigating and driving results across operations, network, and clinical domains in a highly complex, matrix environment  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status.  Careers with OptumRx. We're one of the largest and most innovative pharmacy benefits managers in the US, serving more than 12 million people nationwide. Here you’ll fill far more than prescriptions. As a member of one of our pharmacy teams, you’re empowered to be your best and do whatever it takes to help each customer. You'll find unrivaled support and training as well as a wealth of growth and development opportunities driven by your performance and limited only by your imagination. Join us. There's no better place to help people live healthier lives while doing your life's best work.(sm)  Colorado Residents Only: The salary range for Colorado residents is $79,700 to $142,600. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, etc. In addition to your salary, UnitedHealth Group offers benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). No matter where or when you begin a career with UnitedHealth Group, you’ll find a far-reaching choice of benefits and incentives.  All Telecommuters will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy  Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.  UnitedHealth Group is a drug-free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment. Join us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)  The ideal candidate for this Technical Project Manager role will have a strong track record of managing and delivering technical projects as well as providing leadership throughout the lifecycle of Information Technology projects. They will have solid experience with infrastructure, networking and datacenter migration projects and be experienced in managing stakeholders and cross-functional teams. They will be strong communicators who are action-oriented and possess a solid understanding and experience with Agile methodologies. Optum, incredible ideas in one incredible company and a singular opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)  Release Manager  Manage the technical delivery of software releases within the Optum Digital. This role is “GO TO” source of information for all deployment activity with a focus on scope, dependencies, validations, risks, personnel needs, and execution. This role works collaboratively with stakeholders including Development, Quality Assurance, Infrastructure, Business Analysts, Scrum Masters, Product Owners and Product Managers. This role not dedicated to one single product or application team but to multiple applications.  NOTE: This role requires night time deploy efforts in addition to a standard work week  You'll enjoy the flexibility to either work in office in Eden Prairie, MN or telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.  Tasks And Responsibilities  Administer deployments efforts through software tools to ensure code, configuration changes, data updates, etc. are migrated successfully to the production environment Facilitate meetings for deployment preparations, GoNoGo process, and deploys Lay out deployment schedule for multiple application deployments Identify and track scope and manage technical release issues and fallout Create detailed Deployment Plan/Checklist/Tasks noting dependencies and including back-out plans Track release content and Populate Rally w Change Ticket and PROD date information Manage and communicate the status of code, configuration, database changes, data updates, etc. (all technical components) Document/Track Approvers and Stakeholders (GoNoGo PPTs) Create required change ticket/s and appropriate change tasks for releases, performance testing, and infrastructure changes Manage all deployment activities to ensure code, configuration changes, data updates, etc. are migrated successfully to the production environment Communicate release status issues for leadership review (“Gist” or bullet points) Perform ad hoc reporting for applications and deploy history Track release content and Populate CA Agile w Change Ticket and PROD date information Assume responsibilities to meet your team goal deadlines Manage relationships and coordinate work between different teams at different locations Work with release engineers to understand impacts of branches and code merges Maintain a release repository and manages key information such as build and release procedures, dependencies, and notification lists Weekly Release Reporting (email and updates)  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in. Job Title: Solutran Senior Project Manager - Plymouth, MN
Description: Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that's improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There's no room for error. Join us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)  Solutran is a leading FinTech company committed to creating game-changing, customer-friendly solutions. We serve health-seeking populations by partnering with the nation’s largest health plans, employers, retailers, and government programs. We have established a reputation for delivering modern, advanced customer experiences through best-in-class solutions used by millions.  Solutran is dedicated to promoting health, providing solutions for over-the-counter benefits, rewards, healthy food incentives and government programs supporting food insecure individuals. Learn more about our latest innovations at www.solutran.com.  We are seeking an engaging and passionate leader driven to make a difference in a culture grounded in high performance and collaboration. The Senior Project Manager will lead and manage complex, medium to large-scale cross-functional client implementation projects involving exciting and innovative technologies as well as projects to develop and support our current business lines. We are a highly respected service organization known for delivery of quality products, often in very tight timeframes.  The Senior Project Manager must possess a highly collaborative style and engage stakeholders to manage conflict, negotiate, and build relationships both within and outside our organization. We are fast-paced, and we look to the Senior Project Manager to tailor projects, apply the project processes, and identify the appropriate tools and techniques to efficiently and effectively deliver projects on time, in scope and within the cost constraints, as well as mentor fellow Project Managers. A successful project manager at Solutran can lead and manage through ambiguity, being flexible and able to adapt plans as new information becomes available.  Primary Responsibilities  Demonstrate and build superior customer relations and possess exceptional people and leadership skills consistently practicing those behaviors to build and develop the project team Participate in the development of a PMO, building PMO best practices, and the development and maintenance of Organizational Process Assets Collaborate with Solutran’s business lines and other departments to identify and align resources during all phases of the project processes Expertly tailor each project by incorporating the appropriate project management plans, documents, processes, tools, and techniques and employ the appropriate processes within the project management process groups of initiation, planning, execution, monitoring, and control and closing Develop and maintain project management plans, documents, and baselines (scope, cost, and schedule) for project measurement Engage stakeholders to align scope to meet client requirements, reduce risks, and manage costs Implement risk management practices to ensure risks are identified, prioritized, and managed early and throughout the project lifecycle Mentor fellow Project Managers and provide guidance towards their career growth when needed Implement integrated change control to ensure that changes are tracked, managed, approved, and validated Create meaningful project reporting that communicates the right message to the right stakeholders at the right time Facilitate meaningful project meetings (in-person, web-ex, skype) only when necessary to the right audience with a clearly defined purpose and planned outcomes Provide project management subject matter expertise in client/prospect related discussions, presentations, or RFP responses Work with minimal direction on complex, technical initiatives Other duties as assigned  An individual in this position must be able to successfully perform the essential duties and responsibilities listed above. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of this position.  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  Bachelor’s degree (BA or BS) or equivalent work experience 6+ years as a project manager leading or managing medium to large scale projects Experience successfully leading cross-functional teams throughout projects, i.e., Product, Sales, Client Services, Operations, I.T., QA Experience in all phases of software project management, including initiation, requirements, design, development, testing, pre-launch, and launch Experience with Excel and Word Full COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement of this role. UnitedHealth Group will adhere to all federal, state and local regulations as well as all client requirements and will obtain necessary proof of vaccination prior to employment to ensure compliance  Preferred Qualifications  PMP Certification Experience managing client implementations with software development involving new software products or enhancements to products, including initiation, requirements, design, development, testing, pre-launch, and launch Experience managing projects utilizing an agile development approach Experience with MS Project and SharePoint  Soft Skills  Ability to build relationships both internally and externally Ability to work as a team leader motivating, mentoring, and collaborating with others Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities Ability to grasp technical processes quickly Excellent verbal and written communication skills Excellent negotiation skills Solid multitasking skills and ability to prioritize Flexibility and a desire to problem solve and continually learn  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status. So when it comes to how we use the world's large accumulation of health-related information, or guide health and lifestyle choices or manage pharmacy benefits for millions, our first goal is to leap beyond the status quo and uncover new ways to serve. Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, brings together some of the greatest minds and most advanced ideas on where health care has to go in order to reach its fullest potential. For you, that means working on high performance teams against sophisticated challenges that matter. Optum, incredible ideas in one incredible company and a singular opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)  Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. The Associate Director will partner with the ART (Automation Reimagination & Transformation) portfolio director to represent ART and coordinate with Partner Management and other OGA (Optum Global Advantage) segments to deliver client value. You will be accountable to help identify, evaluate and route opportunities to the appropriate solutioning team for value delivery, and will be accountable for general portfolio of work oversight and reporting in support of the business.  You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.  Primary Responsibilities  Drive Financial targets (Revenue & value savings) by identifying new opportunities as well as retaining existing engagements within client organization. Collaborate with LOB Success Partner to expand ART (Automation, Reimagination & Transformation)/SCS (Strategic Capabilities & Services) and Optum Global opportunities Reveal value potential for our business partners by formalizing an opportunity identification methodology that successfully locates and sizes areas of end-to-end transformation potential, with opportunity assessments calibrated jointly with our businesses Partner with ART portfolio director to Expand breadth/depth of ART relationships and value delivery across the enterprise LOB Portfolio Identify appropriate stakeholders and decision-makers within the client organization Research, understand and anticipate the client's current and future business needs, challenges and strategies (e.g., leveraging LOB knowledge and experience) Cultivate the client's perception of ART as a trusted partner and strategic advisor (e.g., build credibility, demonstrate full understanding of their business) Partner with ART portfolio director to jointly own the team portfolio to ensure enterprise alignment and delivery of planned account initiatives Coordinate across portfolios to identify and drive horizontal opportunities across UHC and Optum Facilitate bi-directional review of opportunities with Partner Management to ensure alignment, awareness and connection into related efforts Support consistency to IBP & status updates across business segments Partnership between all ART portfolio leads within a LOB to ensure strategic alignment Drive high levels of client satisfaction by focusing efforts on results that meet or exceed the client's expectations Partner with ART portfolio director to maintain ongoing contact with clients to identify and address emerging issues/concerns Help customer understand the types of solutions | competencies available to solve identified problems., regardless of source Realize ‘New Business Savings’ through the delivery of ART based initiatives. Benefits include (MedEx, SG&A, Cost Avoidance, Revenue / IOI) Partner with ART portfolio director to drive Benefits to the Enterprise through improved customer service via a holistic engagement model featuring a single point of contact for each Line of Business Collaborate with ART teams to expand ART participation in LOB strategic transformation initiatives focused on Growth, Cost Optimization and Constituent Experience Demonstrate knowledge of ART’s products, services and competencies, and how they can be leveraged to meet the client's needs Partner with ART portfolio director to Build the ART brand within the client organization by highlighting the full range of products and service available to meet the client's needs Demonstrate working knowledge of the client's business in order to identify new business opportunities (e.g., business goals, strategies, structures, processes) When appropriate, help connect customer to ART- (and OGA) specific competencies and capabilities Keep ART leadership apprised of customer needs arising out of individual consulting engagements Assist with resource and capital forecasting Acts as a subject matter resource for others or as a first-stop source to finding such SMEs  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in. It's an opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)  The Proposal Project Manager (PPM) manages the overall RFP process for all pharmacy products for the sales and client management organization.  The Proposal Project Manager (PPM) supports OptumRx’s sales and client retention efforts by managing competitive and compelling responses to Requests for Proposals (RFPs). The PPM is responsible for project management and completion of all proposal and proposal related documents, i.e., planning, scheduling, organizing, and coordinating all elements of the proposal deliverable.  You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.  Primary Responsibilities  Thorough review of all RFP documents and sales strategy documents specific to opportunity Create and maintain overall project timeline Coordinate all strategy calls, including internal team calls Direct all calls, compile and distribute notes, clearly identifying actionable items Coordinate/lead project touch base calls with all pertinent resources Communicate overall project health Identify project risks Escalate risks to leadership Manage internal team items (PGs, standard and non-standard items, pricing items, and coordinate all analysis requests Submit for Sales Review Final Strategic Handle final consultant and/or customer submission Complete project work as assigned accurately and within specified deadlines Project close-out - update project tracking log with key deliverables Complete project work as assigned accurately and within specified deadlines Participate in relevant training opportunities that will enhance both individual performance and overall unit performance  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  Bachelor’s degree or equivalent combination of education and experience 2+ years of experience writing RFPs industry with experience managing complex bids Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint  Preferred Qualifications  Experience writing RFP's in pharmacy benefit management (PBM) industry or healthcare industry Experience working with a content database and populating proposals with standard content Experience creating sales support materials such as executive summaries and cover letters Experience creating and maintaining project timelines Proven ability to lead strategic discussions Knowledge of medical, behavioral health and other healthcare related products and services Writing skills Excellent analytical, strategic, and critical thinking skills Excellent written and verbal communication skills Attention to detail Self-starter and ability to work independently Ability to multi-task, managing multiple deliverables and prioritizing work accordingly Flexible, proactive and able to cope with changing conditions Experience working with RFPIO or another content database  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status. You'll find unrivaled support and training as well as a wealth of growth and development opportunities driven by your performance and limited only by your imagination. Join us. There's no better place to help people live healthier lives while doing your life's best work.(sm)  Colorado, Connecticut or Nevada Residents Only: The salary range for Colorado residents is $64,800 to $116,000. UnitedHealthcare is a company that's on the rise. We're expanding in multiple directions, across borders and, most of all, in the way we think. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about transforming the health care industry. Ready to make a difference? Make yourself at home with us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)  The Accelerator Program Manager (APM) is a core member of the UnitedHealthcare Accelerator team with a focus on delivering the best possible experience for all accelerator stakeholders, including company founders, mentors, partners, investors and internal executive leaders. The APM will be responsible for managing the day-to-day operations of the UnitedHealthcare Accelerator through all phases of the year-round program schedule. Key responsibilities range from sourcing and supporting participating startups, managing execution of programming, and developing program strategy in partnership with senior business leadership.  Experience and interest in working with startups, venture capital, and demonstrated project management experience are key success criteria for this role. The APM will have opportunities to collaborate with a variety of innovation, business development and business strategy teams across the UnitedHealthcare organization. This individual must be highly motivated, organized, process-oriented, self-directed and be able to be self-managed and independent. This role manages Optum’s due diligence efforts during the acquisition process for medical practices, as well as integration planning, requiring intense project management of multiple transactions simultaneously. This individual will be responsible for coordinating the interaction and involvement of our national business stakeholders and diligence leads (e.g., operations, finance, accounting, IT, HR), and our market leadership teams. This individual has a successful track record of managing the implementation of major strategic initiatives and a solid understanding of healthcare business needs. This position handles and manages confidential material relating to corporate decisions, structure and significance. integration process, engaging internal and external stakeholders and local and national teams on a regular basis to resolve outstanding items necessary for a smooth transition keeping with acquisition timeline Independently communicate with Sellers and Key Stakeholders, including executive leadership, on behalf of the business needs and transaction team throughout the acquisition process Facilitate clear and action-oriented communication between team members, internal/external stakeholders Set project related deadlines, assigns responsibilities, monitors and tracks status of all key diligence and integration activities and provide reporting to transaction leads and market executives Rely on extensive experience to plan and accomplish goals by working closely with operations and departmental leadership to complete the acquisition process Continuously review acquisition and integration processes, recommending areas for improvement and efficiency gains Serve as a primary contact to the seller and disseminate information to the cross-functional diligence and integration teams Manage the virtual data room utilized in the diligence process Act as liaison, problem solver, and facilitator for all aspects of projects Lead vital ad-hoc projects related to corporate development Develop and improve the performance of yourself and those you work with Supervision and oversight of project coordinators and other diligence and integration support staff as necessary Ability to travel throughout the Los Angeles area for deal kick-off, diligence and integration meetings  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  Bachelor’s Degree in Health Administration, Business Administration or related field or high school diploma with 7+ years relevant work experience Full COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement of this role. Description: Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that's improving the lives of millions. Join us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)  Optum is seeking an IT Engagement Manager to join a highly visible and dynamic technical team responsibility to assess, plan, and deliver IT integration services for inorganic growth strategies.  As a key member of this team, you will manage the IT integration of newly acquired companies, minimizing business disruption and ensuring the company is maximizing the value of acquisition through integration. This is a fast paced and high volume area.  In this role, you will partner with the Engagement Architect and be responsible to understand the business and technical requirements of the IT integration engagement. You will translate the business and technical requirements into integration scope, required services and an IT integration budget. You will be consultative with the acquiring line of business, the acquired business, the acquired IT team, and other IT and non-IT teams, anticipating their needs and applying the benefit of your experience and expertise to the engagement. You will lead one or more specific acquisition integration engagements.  You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.  Primary Responsibilities  Be the overall IT PM lead from Enterprise Enablement and Platform Services (EEPS) for each assigned integration engagement Present to business and IT teams on Optum’s IT security and integration workstreams including the value/benefit of the services to be delivered Lead post-close IT due diligence to prepare for integration Own communication and overall coordination with both companies’ IT teams and other non-IT integration teams Identify and assess necessary technical and business goals, objectives, requirements, scope and expectations plus other needed information required to produce an integrated delivery plan and budget Drive the integrated delivery plan with clear goals, operating mechanisms and regular updates to stakeholders Establish and manage the IT acquisition integration budget Identify risks and solutions for mitigation Provide guidance/direction to the Implementation Lead who is driving the day-to-day work Maintain rapport and awareness of stakeholder needs Participate in work and resource prioritization Maintain knowledge of current and emerging UHG technologies / services related to security and IT integration Work effectively in a diverse and distributed organization  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  BA/BS degree or 8+ years of equivalent work experience 6+ years of leadership and IT Program Management experience in a fast-paced and growth-oriented environment 3+ years of Broad IT Infrastructure background with domain experience or knowledge in IT security, user collaboration tools, desktops, networks, application hosting and call centers 2+ years of Integrations experience with a focus on infrastructure technology as a Project or Program Manager 2+ years of C-Level presentation delivery/experience 2+ years with Data collection and analytics experience 1+ years of experience working with customers during large scale Mergers and Acquisitions  If you are working in a UHG or Optum Office proof of vacination will be required  Preferred Qualifications  SME, Team lead or Team management experience Record of developing relationships at technical, management, and executive levels Excellent written and verbal communication skills  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status.  Technology Careers with Optum. Information and technology have amazing power to transform the health care industry and improve people's lives. This is where it's happening. Job Title: Quality Program Manager/Quality Management Manager - Minnetonka, MN
Description: UnitedHealthcare is a company that's on the rise. We're expanding in multiple directions, across borders and, most of all, in the way we think. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about transforming the health care industry. Ready to make a difference? Make yourself at home with us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)  To promote our mission of helping people live healthier lives, the Quality Manager coordinates critical components of our quality management program in compliance with regulatory requirements and NCQA accreditation standards. The Quality Manager works within highly matrixed relationships to implement and maintain the core infrastructure of quality management program, incorporating all products and populations served by the health plan. This position collaborates with multiple functions that may include Clinical, Physician Engagement, Member Experience, Benefit Design/Product, Compliance, Network, Behavioral Services, and Pharmacy as needed to support the quality management program.  Primary Responsibilities  Oversees the implementation of plan quality management components, including quality management committee oversight and governance structure Proactively manages and responds to rapidly changing state requirements and environments Collaborates across business segments to attain or maintain the plan’s compliance with NCQA accreditation standards and contractual requirements as they apply to the quality management program Develops and maintains positive relationships with the state External Quality Review Organization (EQRO) within the scope of the quality management program Ensures the creation, integration, maintenance, approval, and submission of the Trilogy Documents, including but not limited to the Program Description, Work Plan, Evaluation, and policies and procedures Ensures the creation and submission of reports to meet state contractual requirements including Performance Improvement projects (PIPs) Directs as applicable process improvement plans and corrective action plans for surveys, accreditations, EQRO and regulator audits within the scope of the quality management program Monitors HEDIS reporting requirements and annual reporting processes to confirm alignment with regulatory expectations and successful annual submission  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  Bachelor’s degree in healthcare related field, or comparable experience 5+ years of experience with demonstrated functional knowledge related to regulatory adherence of a quality management program (HEDIS, NCQA accreditation, EQRO auditing, reporting, committee management Solid written and oral communication skills with internal and external partners and employees Experience making formal presentations in front of committees and work group environments and using virtual technology (e.g., Microsoft Teams/WebEx) Advanced level proficiency in software applications that include, but are not limited to, Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook, and PowerPoint Knowledgeable about the managed care/health insurance industry, products, and services  Preferred Qualifications  Master’s degree in healthcare, or similar area Certified Professional in Healthcare Quality Experience in bringing together cross-functional teams to complete projects  Soft Skills  Demonstrated ability to assist with focusing activities on a strategic direction as well as develop tactical plans, drive performance, and achieve targets Problem solving skills; the ability to systematically analyze problems, draw relevant conclusions and devise appropriate courses of action Excellent verbal and written communication skills; ability to speak clearly and concisely, conveying complex or technical information in a manner that others can understand, as well as ability to understand and interpret complex information from others Ability to influence, interact, and negotiate with medical staff, peers, and internal company staff at all levels Commitment to anticipating, understanding, and meeting the needs of internal and external customers  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status.  Careers at UnitedHealthcare Community & State. Challenge brings out the best in us. It also attracts the best. That's why you'll find some of the most amazingly talented people in health care here. We serve the health care needs of low-income adults and children with debilitating illnesses such as cardiovascular disease, diabetes, HIV/AIDS and high-risk pregnancy. Our holistic, outcomes-based approach considers social, behavioral, economic, physical and environmental factors. Join us. Work with proactive health care, community and government partners to heal health care and create positive change for those who need it most. This is the place to do your life's best work.(sm)  Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.  UnitedHealth Group is a drug-free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.  Job Keywords: Quality Improvement, Quality Management, HEDIS, Accreditation, NCQA, Healthcare, Compliance, Regulator, CPHQ, Managed Care, Minneapolis, MN, Minnesota, UHC, UnitedHealthcare

Job Title: Senior Digital Marketing Project Manager - Eden Prairie or Telecommute
Description: Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that's improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There's no room for error. Join us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)  The Sr. Digital Project Manager is an individual contributor on the Digital Marketing Experience team (DMX) within Enterprise Marketing Capabilities (EMC) who works closely with leadership within user experience, information technology, marketing, operations and business teams to deliver digital applications that ensure an exceptional online experience for Optum consumers.  You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S., preferably in Eden Prairie, MN, as you take on some tough challenges.  Primary Responsibilities  Lead the development of new, as well as drive and enhance existing capabilities for digital products and experiences, from inception to launch Act as a mediator between the consumers/patients/members, business leaders and the technical teams - communicating consumer needs and translating those needs into new product features for the team to design Partner with the stakeholders to define/design industry leading consumer-facing digital solutions, and ensure alignment with business and product plans (e.g., capital/funding commitments, revenue commitments, capabilities, functional impacts, cross functional roles) Manage efforts across cross functional teams to include strategy, UX, design, development, operations, analytics, SEO, QA, UAT, editorial, content and more Collaborate with applicable business partners and stakeholders (including Optum’s lines of business as well as Marketing, Sales, Shared Services, and Operations) to obtain appropriate market information/data and define consumer and business needs Work closely with cross-organizational stakeholders, including limited interaction with executive leadership, on strategic priorities. Translate strategic priorities into actionable project plans Partner with Digital Delivery teams on the creation of requirements and user stories. Participate in Agile Scrum process to ensure business vision is being accurately implemented and meet market expectations. Ensure digital solutions are delivered on time and on budget, including identifying and resolving risks and issues. Subscribe to Optum Product Methodology and business processes, providing input to further advance the discipline and evangelize across the team Develop various communication elements to socialize/explain/educate projects and statuses to facilitate decision making with the business pillars and other partners. Utilize influencing skills to build a collaborative culture and foster relationships with both internal and external strategic partners. Provide sales support including participation in customer meetings and product demonstrations as requested  General Job Profile  Company thought leader Functional SME Resource to senior leadership Drives and manages initiation, planning, design, execution, monitoring, controlling and closure of a project  Job Scope And Guidelines  Predicts emerging customer needs and develops innovative solutions to meet them Solves unique and complex problems with broad impact on the business Participates in the development of business strategy Develops and manages business plans to achieve objectives Leads complex projects to achieve key business objectives Translates complex concepts in ways that can be understood by a variety of audiences Influences senior leadership to adopt new ideas, products, and/or approaches May have segment-wide impact Directs cross-functional and/or cross-segment teams  Positions in this function are involved in developing marketing, and creative strategies and tactics to promote and sell the organization's products and services through the Internet. Establishes, maintains and updates the "Web experience" from the viewpoint of the customer. Develops affiliated programs designed to increase exposure to and business from the target audience. Establishes and manages the relationships with search engines and portal sites that are strategically aligned with the e- commerce goals. Manages the implementation of e-commerce marketing programs and analyzes their effectiveness.  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  Bachelor’s degree 5+ years as an individual contributor, including some experience in a corporate or health care environment 5+ years of experience utilizing MS Office applications Experience with Agile software development processes. Formal experience with 1+ recognized Agile methodologies (Scrum, XP, etc.) or toolsets (VersionOne, Rally, etc.) Experience leading online products, user experience, content, design, or production in large corporate or heath care environments Experience coordinating priorities and contributions of a network of non-technical Web content and project stakeholders from across a large, diverse organization Extensive practical experience and sound theoretical understanding of relevant professional disciplines, including Product Management, Web design, Web authoring and publishing, information architecture, Web content strategy, usability and accessibility, user experience design Ability to travel up to 10% based on Business needs  Preferred Qualifications  Solid communication skills, including written, spoken, and presentation communications  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status. So when it comes to how we use the world's large accumulation of health-related information, or guide health and lifestyle choices or manage pharmacy benefits for millions, our first goal is to leap beyond the status quo and uncover new ways to serve. Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, brings together some of the greatest minds and most advanced ideas on where health care has to go in order to reach its fullest potential. For you, that means working on high performance teams against sophisticated challenges that matter. Optum, incredible ideas in one incredible company and a singular opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)  All Telecommuters will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy. communications (written and oral) in a clear and crisp manner for all levels of the organization with the ability to adapt approach and style to any audience Clearly communicate critical information Focused on the delivery of high quality, cost effective, flexible, and high performing environments across the Enterprise. The Senior Director of Project Management will work closely with other Real Estate Services team members, internal partners (IT, Security, Communications), external suppliers and consultants in the development and deployment of services.  You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.  Primary Responsibilities  Provide governance over Project Management partners to ensure quality in delivery; consistently maintaining scope, schedule, and budget on high project volume across multiple geographies and platforms Own the development, maintenance, management and enforcement of project delivery policies, specifications, and guidelines ensuring input and buy-in from key stakeholders Support delivery oversight of portfolio plans, strategies, and capital planning Work with the broader Real Estate Services team, vendor partners and stakeholders to drive continuous improvement in the project delivery process Develop and maintain relationships with Real Estate Partners and other business leaders to understand business requirements and translate these into the delivery guideline framework Manage benchmarking and cost forecasting activities  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in. Make yourself at home with us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)  The Network Program Consultant is responsible for successful development and implementation of various projects for UnitedHealthcare Networks. The Network Program Consultant’s primary responsibilities include but are not limited to performing network analysis of all networks, overseeing the day to day implementation of the network strategies, coordination of development approach with network contracting teams, tracking and monitoring network contract load activities through coordination with the network operations team, network required readiness activities, disruption analyses and associated reporting, and overall readiness of the networks ready to see enrollees and able to be paid for services rendered. The Program Consultant also contributes to the responses to state and CMS audits and regulatory requests. These network projects support UHN and the E&I, M&R and C&S lines of business. Job Title: Senior Proposal Manager Government Proposal Team - Telecommute
Description: Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that is improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation is not about another gadget; it is about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There is no room for error. If you are looking for a better place to use your passion and your desire to drive change, this is the place to be. It's an opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)  The Senior Proposal Manager (PM) is responsible for proposal management and strategic writing for Request for Information (RFI), Request for Proposals (RFP) and customized support for State and Federal governments. Also responsible for ensuring compliance, and delivery of all proposal deliverables to the external client, the PM maintains insight into all phases of the Optum Proposal Team process. In this role the PM is focused on bringing together all stakeholders associated with the pursuit in order to submit a winning proposal package. The PM owns the proposal process, and works closely with Capture Managers, Sales Leaders, Product Subject Matter Experts, Writers, and/or Strategists. The abilities to manage and communicate at all levels, meet tight deadlines, commitment to teamwork, detailed follow-through, and a positive demeanor are essential keys to success in this role.  In this role, the PM will develop strategic messaging regarding the strategic differentiators, customer based value of our products and integrated solutions. This role is also responsible for ensuring our RFP responses are timely, strategic, of high quality and meet the need of our current and future customers. Lastly, this position will also be responsible for working with the OPT content managers, product SMEs, graphics team and quality team to develop standard proactive proposals for sales organization and providing customized proactive proposal support.  You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.  Primary Responsibilities  Manage all aspects of the proposal process including schedule, outsourcing, meetings, draft reviews, quality, graphics, and production Develop strategic messaging content for proposals and executive summaries. Assist in developing and maintaining proposal library Communicate and maintain relationships with internal clients, upper management, and support staff to ensure that the proposal process runs at high efficiency Ability to thrive in a complex and fast-paced corporate environment Demonstrated ability to work with minimal guidance and proactively seek guidance on very complex tasks  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  Undergraduate degree or HS Diploma/GED with 10+ years of proposal management experience 8+ years of proposal management experience, preferably in State and Federal organizations Solid working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite Demonstrated ability to define, schedule, and manage the proposal preparation process, including the ability to understand and analyze the details of an RFP Occasional business travel  Preferred Qualifications  Shipley Associates process certification or APMP accreditation 10+ years of experience managing large, complex health care proposals Formatting experience within desktop publishing Understanding of the Shipley proposal process Problem resolution, analytical, research and negation skills Excellent interpersonal as well as written and verbal communication skills, including a high degree of comfort leading and speaking in large meetings with high-level personnel Exceptional facilitation and organizational skills Solid interpersonal and communication skills Ability to manage simultaneous projects with competing demands Ability to meet deadlines, a commitment to teamwork, and detailed follow-through  Careers with Optum. Here's the idea. We built an entire organization around one giant objective; make health care work better for everyone. So when it comes to how we use the world's large accumulation of health-related information, or guide health and lifestyle choices or manage pharmacy benefits for millions, our first goal is to leap beyond the status quo and uncover new ways to serve. Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, brings together some of the greatest minds and most advanced ideas on where health care has to go in order to reach its fullest potential. For you, that means working on high performance teams against sophisticated challenges that matter. Optum, incredible ideas in one incredible company and a singular opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)  Colorado Residents Only: The salary range for Colorado residents is $79,700 to $142,600.
