Job Title: Patient Experience Program Manager - Telecommute in Southern CA
Description: Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that's improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There's no room for error. Join us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)  The Patient Experience Program Manager is responsible to facilitate planning, developing, and implementation of a California region wide CAHPS/HOS Quality Improvement program, in order to optimize results in health plan CMS Star Ratings. This person will be able to manage multiple priorities, coordinate complex project plans, facilitate cross-CDO (Care Delivery Organization) team discussion, keep meticulous minutes, and coordinate follow ups within established timelines, in order to drive execution of strategies across California CDOs.  The ideal candidate is energized by new challenges, thrives in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, collaborates well in a team-oriented atmosphere and has a passion for applying technology to achieve systematic solutions.  If you are located in Southern California, you will have the flexibility to telecommute* as you take on some tough challenges.  Primary Responsibilities Under direction of the California Quality Regional leadership and in coordination with Optum National Clinical Performance, develop and implement a California regional-wide CAHPS/HOS Patient Experience program. The goals of the program may include: Implementing standardized CAHPS/HOS reporting across CDOs Creating a standardized provider and office educational training program Optimizing / centralizing shared resources across CDOs Evolving CDO Physician Bonus programs to include robust CAHPS / HOS measurement, reporting and incentives Facilitate development of programs and projects, which may include: Standardized Specialty Access Reporting Centralized member outreach for Referral Authorization approval notification and assistance with scheduling specialty and ancillary services Integration of CAHPS / HOS reporting within existing physician communication tools (e.g. Cozeva) Create CAHPS/HOS member and provider engagement communication plans (e.g. text message campaigns, member/provider newsletter articles, provider office posters, etc.) Drive enhancements to top 10 EHR vendors to integrate CAHPS / HOS strategic customizations Implementation and management of CAHPS/HOS member packet and other tools/ resources Coordinate cross-CDO/ team collaboration and communication on CAHPS/HOS initiatives with overlapping processes and accountability Conduct research and pilot new CAHPS/HOS initiatives to assess feasibility and success prior to full scale deployment; manage implemented initiatives to ensure successful programs Consistently supports compliance by maintaining the privacy and confidentiality of information, protecting the assets of the organization, acting with ethics and integrity, reporting noncompliance, and adhering to applicable federal, state and local laws and regulations, accreditation and licenser requirements (if applicable), and current corporate and client policies and procedures Partner with leaders and business lanes across CDOs on other CAHPS/HOS and Quality duties and initiatives as assigned  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  High school diploma or GED Working towards or have achieved certification in project management or have accredited Six Sigma Training 3+ years of project management experience specifically with direct oversight and accountability for teams 2+ years of CAHPS/ HOS, HEDIS Quality and/or MIPS experience Working knowledge of managed healthcare and care delivery business operations Intermediate MS Office skills Excel experience with ability to create, manipulate and formulate spreadsheets using v-lookup, pivot tables, charts and graphing PowerPoint presentation skills Telecommute if based in Southern California Up to 25% travel to provider offices throughout Southern California Full COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement of this role. UnitedHealth Group will adhere to all federal, state and local regulations as well as all client requirements and will obtain necessary proof of vaccination prior to employment to ensure compliance  Preferred Qualifications  Bachelor’s degree from 4-year accredited school Working towards or have achieved certification in project management or have accredited Experience with Technology-based Solutions (EHRs, IVR, Texting Applications, etc.) Excellent communication skills  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status.  Careers at OptumCare. We're on a mission to change the face of health care. As the largest health and wellness business in the US, we help 58 million people navigate the health care system, finance their health care needs and achieve their health and well-being goals. Fortunately, we have a team of the best and brightest minds on the planet to make it happen. Together we're creating the most innovative ideas and comprehensive strategies to help heal the health care system and create a brighter future for us all. Join us and learn why there is no better place to do your life's best work.(sm)  OptumCare is committed to creating an environment where physicians focus on what they do best: care for their patients. To do so, OptumCare provides administrative and business support services to both owned and affiliated medical practices which are part of OptumCare. Each medical practice part and their physician employees have complete authority with regards to all medical decision-making and patient care. OptumCare’s support services do not interfere with or control the practice of medicine by the medical practices or any of their physicians. Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that is improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation is not about another gadget; it is about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There is no room for error. If you are looking for a better place to use your passion and your desire to drive change, this is the place to be. It's an opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)  As an Optum Store Digital Product Manager, you will be building Optum’s flagship direct-to-consumer platform - the Optum Store. Successful candidates must develop and demonstrate excellence in strategic and critical thinking, product design and development, consumer experience design, and issue resolution. The role will afford the opportunity to learn and engage with numerous Optum businesses to enhance the direct-to-consumer offerings available through the Optum Store.  Positions in this job family support the launch of new products and improvement of existing products. They review product performance against expectations and facilitate or influence changes to the product portfolio to improve competitive position and optimal product performance. They may work with internal or external business constituents to determine future direction and involve working within multiple product functions.  You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.  Primary Responsibilities  Develop new programs and services from product concept through implementation leveraging existing organizational processes Work with, coordinate, and manage multiple external vendors to develop new products Support the ongoing management of products and services in the Optum Store portfolio ensuring performance standards, KPIs, and critical business outcomes are met Measure financial and growth goals towards defined organizational objectives Facilitate or influence changes to product portfolio to improve competitive position and optimize product performance Monitor and understand consumer and customer needs and translate them into product requirements Work with cross-functional partners including, but not limited to: Marketing, Operations, Finance, Market Research, Clinical Services, Pharmacy Services, and Customer Services Build clear lines of communication to and with business and product stakeholders to obtain, proof, validate, and approve ideas for innovation Lead interdepartmental teams where appropriate in the development and execution of innovation ideas Proactively collaborate across the enterprise to identify, deliver and support the best solution Exemplify the UnitedHealth Group culture in words and actions Execute work with operational discipline following project management best practices and holding business partners to the same standards  The Digital Product Manager role is important to the Optum Store product team. You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience 3+ years of experience in digital product development, digital product management and related including execution of product roadmap and defined milestones and alignment of product roadmap to business performance metrics Experience working with common product development tools and concepts including Agile development methods, wire framing, prototyping and A/B testing 1+ year of experience with defining requirements and managing through execution 1+ year of experience with data analysis and developing reporting metrics to shape business priorities Proficient in MS Word, Excel and PowerPoint Full COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement of this role. UnitedHealth Group will adhere to all federal, state and local regulations as well as all client requirements and will obtain necessary proof of vaccination prior to employment to ensure compliance.  Preferred Qualifications  Project management experience Experience working in ecommerce Experience working in virtual pharmacy  Success Metrics  Execution of product roadmap and defined milestones Alignment of product roadmap to business performance metrics Reporting aligned to constituent value levers and messaging Responsiveness of product features/offering to constituent demands  Daily Practices  Excellent follow through, attention to detail, and time management skills Good negotiation, problem solving, planning, and decision-making skills Ability to think strategically and execute methodically Ability to manage work across multiple external vendors Solid interpersonal, communication and management skills Ability to think creatively and to be hands-on in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment Demonstrated ability to use hard data and metrics to back up assumptions and develop business cases that can be clearly and easily communicated Willingness to roll up sleeves and do whatever is necessary and take on a general manager / owner mentality High attention to detail including ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously Excellent verbal and written communication skills  UnitedHealth Group is working to create the health care system of tomorrow.  Already Fortune 5, we are totally focused on innovation and change. We work a little harder. We aim a little higher. We expect more from ourselves and each other. And at the end of the day, we're doing a lot of good.  Through our family of businesses and a lot of inspired individuals, we're building a high-performance health care system that works better for more people in more ways than ever. Now we're looking to reinforce our team with people who are decisive, brilliant - and built for speed.  Come to UnitedHealth Group, and share your ideas and your passion for doing more. We have roles that will fit your skills and knowledge. We have diverse opportunities that will fit your dreams.  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status.  Careers with OptumRx. We're one of the largest and most innovative pharmacy benefits managers in the US, serving more than 12 million people nationwide. Here you’ll fill far more than prescriptions. As a member of one of our pharmacy teams, you’re empowered to be your best and do whatever it takes to help each customer. You'll find unrivaled support and training as well as a wealth of growth and development opportunities driven by your performance and limited only by your imagination. Join us. There's no better place to help people live healthier lives while doing your life's best work.(sm)  Colorado Residents Only: The salary range for Colorado residents is $79,700 to $142,600. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, etc. In addition to your salary, UnitedHealth Group offers benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that's improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There's no room for error. Join us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)  On the one hand, no industry is moving faster than health care. On the other, no organization is better positioned to lead health care forward than Optum and UnitedHealth Group. That's what makes this opportunity so inviting. Our goal is simple. Use data, technology and people in ways that help drive change and make the health care system work better for everyone. Join us and put your advanced knowledge and skills to work by driving innovation through the coordination of program implementation tasks that guide project scope, timelines, resource alignment and more as you help leaders of key business areas within our CDO partners move forward with solutions that meet their needs in driving down the overall cost of care. If you're out to do more, this is the place to be.  This role will challenge your ability to work manage relationships with provider led care delivery organizations, setting strategy, managing complex projects where deadlines and scope shift frequently, and measuring outcomes. You'll need flexibility, agility, solid communication skills and the ability to adapt to change while maintaining strong relationships with stakeholders in a highly cross-matrixed environment.  We are seeking a driven and results oriented Consultant style Senior Project Manager to work in our Optum Care Delivery team in our Optimal Care arena.  You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.  Primary Responsibilities  Identify project/deployment durations, effort, sequence, and dependencies required to meet applicable implementation objectives Contribute to the development of project scope statements, in consultation with the applicable stakeholders (e.g. project charter, Statement of Work, CDO deployment strategy and timeline) Develop, document, and implement project communication plans Ensure alignment and understanding of program/project scope and objectives with all applicable stakeholders Develop, communicate and implement project risk/issue management plans and strategies (e.g., mitigation, avoidance, transfer, acceptance) Establish, develop and maintain effective relationships with applicable project stakeholders (e.g., project team members, team leads, internal customers, functional SMEs, business partners, leadership) Lead cross functional teams and drive the team to successfully complete the objectives of the program Ability to engage functional partners on both the Optum and CDO levels to effectively deliver on program goals Provide guidance, expertise, and/or assistance to internal and/or external partners (e.g., claims; call center; benefits; clinical) to ensure programs and strategies are implemented and maintained effectively Engage with local provider organizations to support, augment and accelerate efforts to improve operational coordination of patient care Communicate with and help internal and/or external partners interpret requirements to ensure effective problem solution and strategy implementation Ability to support local teams as needed to fill capacity gaps, identify root cause solutions and maintain alignment with national priorities Research and proactively seek to fill in knowledge gaps in key functional areas Provide/ensure training to applicable audiences, as needed (e.g., process training, tool uses, project management methodology, change management) Ensure that controls are identified and operationalized to allow benefit tracking and reporting Ensure project documentation is accurate and all projects are completed on time and within scope Analyze project outcomes and make appropriate recommendations to improve outcomes/processes moving forward (e.g., repeatable processes, feedback loops, cross-project improvement opportunities) Ensure performance is tracked accurately utilizing internal tools and processes (e.g., dashboards; scorecards; reports) Request and/or receive relevant performance data from internal partners and review for accuracy Manipulate provided data into applicable tools and reports in order to facilitate performance review and analysis Review consolidated operational performance reports in order to determine overall effectiveness, make necessary changes, and identify opportunities for new programs or program consolidation or expansion Incorporate operations program performance information into strategic and business planning Ensure that new/revised business processes/procedures are documented, updated, and approved, as needed Collect/synthesize best practices from across a network of provider organizations and share feedback across the broader Optimal Care team  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  Bachelor’s degree in related business or healthcare field 4+ years or more Heath Care industry experience 3+ years of consulting level program or project management experience using data and information to make informed business decisions 2+ years of health care operations experience Proven track record of implementing new processes or tools in matrixed environment Proficiency with MS Project, Excel, Visio, PowerPoint and SharePoint Ability to work in fast-paced environment with ambition, client focus and innovative ideas that will enhance and improve results in a new program and product culture Travel required around 25-50%  Preferred Qualifications  Previous experience provider networks Clinical education and/or experience Analytics skills Operational enablement and process improvement expertise  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status.  Careers with Optum. Here's the idea. We built an entire organization around one giant objective; make health care work better for everyone. So when it comes to how we use the world's large accumulation of health-related information, or guide health and lifestyle choices or manage pharmacy benefits for millions, our first goal is to leap beyond the status quo and uncover new ways to serve. Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, brings together some of the greatest minds and most advanced ideas on where health care has to go in order to reach its fullest potential. For you, that means working on high performance teams against sophisticated challenges that matter. Optum, incredible ideas in one incredible company and a singular opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)  All Telecommuters will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy. UnitedHealth Group is a company on the rise. We’re expanding in multiple directions, across borders and most of all, in the way we think. Make yourself at home with us and start doing your life’s best work.(sm)  Role  This role will support the Client Engagement Leader (CEL) working in collaboration with HC Centers of Excellence (COE)s and acquired entity with overall responsibility as follows  The Sr Project Manager is a Client Engagement Manager (CEM) and will be responsible for the operational management of M&A Human Capital projects.  Day-to-day operational management of a transaction from diligence through Human Capital integration Strategically partners with client engagement lead and key stakeholders to guide diligence and integration SMEs through the deal lifecycle Understands the key steps, activities, and work required to move through each phase of the transaction Ensure deal value creation and employee experience are at the forefront of diligence & integration planning Breadth of experience across different lines of business and different types of transaction Brings consistency and rigor to the processes and tools that are leveraged in the deal lifecycle Supports highly complex deals; requiring proactive problem solving & needs anticipation Requires strong partnership across key stakeholders; ability to influence in a matrixed environment Supports multiple transactions, in various stages of the deal lifecycle, at any given point in time  You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.  Primary Responsibility Partner with CEL to deliver against deal strategy, from diligence through HC integration Support HC CEL with HC functional risk analysis summary and cost model Support identification of critical path plan, key milestones, risks, and considerations for HC integration Kick-off HC integration activities, guiding and advising SMEs to deliver in accordance with deal strategy & value creation Develop and manage workplan, driven off glide path and journey map from CEL Manage day-to-day execution, tracking, and risk mitigation of activities from diligence through HC integration Stand up operating mechanisms/rhythms for each deal (e.g., governance, meeting cadence, data access) Document and memorialize key decisions and deals Proactively communicate and take action on key decisions Drive post-HC integration lessons learned and identification of continuous improvement opportunities Works with minimal guidance; seeks guidance on only the most complex tasks  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  Undergraduate degree or equivalent work experience 3+ years of Human Capital experience 3+ years of project management experience using data and information to make business decisions Excellent communication, time management, organizational, and prioritization skills and ability to balance multiple priorities Self-Starter and takes initiative. Seeks understanding and clarification to validate understanding Demonstrated track record successfully maintaining and influencing internal and external stakeholder relationships Experience working in complex matrix environment Maintains high degree of confidentiality Proficiency with Excel, Word, PowerPoint, SharePoints and MicroSoft Teams  Preferred Qualifications  M&A experience with a focus on Human Capital integrations preferred but not required  Leadership Practices  Engaging with Leaders Being Customer-Centric Facilitating Execution Plans Critical Thinking Using Resources Communicating Effectively  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status. No industry is moving faster than health care. And no organization is better positioned to lead health care forward. We need attention to every detail with an eye for the points no one has considered. You'll help improve the health of millions. And you'll do your life's best work.(sm)  The Optum communications associate director is a member of the broader Optum Care communications team and actively leverages Optum assets and success stories in support of the company's priorities. Specifically, the communications associate director creates and executes external communications strategies and tactics that elevate Optum’s reputation and connections with media, local communities and other external stakeholders. This work is done in partnership with Optum Care market leadership, marketing, human capital and other key business partners to ensure close and consistent alignment with the company’s overarching business goals and core values.  The individual must have a strong interest in and understanding of the health care system and desire to be part of an organization that is committed to helping make health care work better for everyone. Working closely with the Optum Care business, s/he will serve a broad range of clients, including executives, providing consistently high levels of proactive support, strategic thinking and execution.  Essential qualities for success in this position include a collaborative disposition, uncompromising eye for quality, comfort with change and ambiguity, resourcefulness, creative problem-solving, multi-tasking skills, calming disposition under pressure and flexibility.  You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.  Primary Responsibilities  Working closely with the senior director of Optum Care communications, consult and partner with stakeholders to develop and execute external communication plans that effectively engage key stakeholders and influencers, amplifying the unique value Optum Care delivers to the patients it serves Strategically support, guide and enable individual care practices and medical groups in advancing their communications and reputation priorities in the communities they serve Effectively manage issues and crisis communications as needed at the local and national levels, collaborating with business and functional partners to respond appropriately and effectively Establish and enforce quality standards and protocols that ensure consistently exceptional, high-quality work product, including all written materials and messaging generated by the team Proactively seek out and promote new avenues for external communications efforts or improve current efforts Collaborate consistently and effectively with communications leaders, business leaders and colleagues across UnitedHealth Group, UnitedHealthcare and Optum, actively supporting cross-enterprise external communications priorities and initiatives Use quantitative and qualitative measurement/evaluation processes to assess the effectiveness of communications (e.g., media placements, audience reach, etc.) Manage external communications projects, including gaining required approvals and monitoring proper implementation (e.g., leadership, legal or compliance requirements, role assignments, timelines/milestones, budget management, issue tracking, deliverables) Evaluate external communications programs and processes; identify lessons learned and recommend changes for future campaigns based on results (e.g., apply metrics to determine success of the process)  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience (5+ years relevant experience beyond the required years of experience can be substituted in lieu of a bachelor’s degree) 7+ years corporate communications experience Experience writing, editing and proofreading with excellent attention to detail Excellent writing and oral communication skills, ability to persuade and build consensus with stakeholders Experience consulting with clients to determine requirements, stakeholders and project scope Experience developing and executing plans; project management experience Experience communicating in multiple media (e.g., print, email, web, video/audio) through multiple channels (e.g., manager-to-employee, employee or leader meetings, web portals, intranet, webinars, social networking platforms) Ability to proactively and quickly recognize and assess external reputational opportunities and issues, effectively communicating both the implications of the issue at hand and a clear path forward to executive stakeholders and team members Experience processing and understanding complex situations and technical subjects, in order to translate them clearly into layperson’s terms Experience working in a fast-paced environment with experience in a matrixed organization, preferrable in health care Experience with multiple tools, including Microsoft Office (PowerPoint, Word, Excel) and others Experience working with senior executive level clients and stakeholders Full COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement of this role. UnitedHealth Group will adhere to all federal, state and local regulations as well as all client requirements and will obtain necessary proof of vaccination prior to employment to ensure compliance  Preferred Qualifications  Experience serving as a spokesperson with news media for a health care organization Demonstrated experience developing and leading successful multi-channel engagement campaigns integrating traditional, digital, and social media strategies Demonstrated experience successfully managing emerging and urgent issues and crises with significant reputational and business implications, and the ability to develop and implement strategic, effective response plans considering various audiences Ability to prioritize and operate effectively in a highly matrixed, complex business and communications environment, including simultaneously supporting multiple stakeholders and effectively advancing multiple communication priorities Ability and willingness to collaborate with communications leaders across multiple businesses in the interest of telling a more integrated, holistic story and protecting and elevating the reputation of the broader enterprise  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status.  Careers with Optum. Here's the idea. We built an entire organization around one giant objective; make health care work better for everyone. So when it comes to how we use the world's large accumulation of health-related information, or guide health and lifestyle choices or manage pharmacy benefits for millions, our first goal is to leap beyond the status quo and uncover new ways to serve. Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, brings together some of the greatest minds and most advanced ideas on where health care has to go in order to reach its fullest potential. For you, that means working on high performance teams against sophisticated challenges that matter. Optum, incredible ideas in one incredible company and a singular opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)  All Telecommuters will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy.  Colorado Residents Only: The salary/hourly range for Colorado residents is $94,500 to $171,700. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, etc. As of the date of this posting, In addition to your salary, UHG offers the following benefits for this position, subject to applicable eligibility requirements: Health, dental, and vision plans; wellness program; flexible spending accounts; paid parking or public transportation costs; 401(k) retirement plan; employee stock purchase plan; life insurance, short-term disability insurance, and long-term disability insurance; business travel accident insurance; Employee Assistance Program; PTO; and employee-paid critical illness and accident insurance.  Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.  UnitedHealth Group is a drug-free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment. Primary Responsibilities  Evaluate and negotiate contracts in compliance with company contract templates, reimbursement structure standards, and other key process controls Identify potential contract issues and impacts on the business Builds relationships that nurture Hospital, Physician, Pharmacy, or Ancillary Provider partnerships and seeks broader value-based business opportunities to support the local market strategy Evaluate and negotiate contracts Ensure the network composition includes an appropriate distribution of provider specialties Adapt departmental plans and priorities to address business and operational challenges Set team direction, resolve problems and provide guidance to members of own team Influence or provide input to forecasting and planning activities May oversee work activities of other supervisors Product, service or process decisions are most likely to impact multiple groups of employees and/or customers (internal or external)  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications Undergraduate degree or equivalent experience 5+ years of experience in a Network Management-related role handling complex Network Providers with accountability for business results 2+ years of experience in the following areas: Contributing to the development of product pricing and utilizing financial modeling in making rate decisions Managing a medical cost and administrative budget Provider contracting Supervising or Managing a team Intermediate proficiency in MS Word, Excel, and Outlook Proven contract negotiating skills Expert level of knowledge of Medicare reimbursement methodologies such as Resource Based Relative Value System (RBRVS), DRGs, Ambulatory Surgery Center Groupers, etc.  Preferred Qualifications  Solid customer service skills Excellent verbal and written communication skills; ability to speak clearly and concisely, conveying complex or technical information in a manner that others can understand, as well as ability to understand and interpret complex information form others, including but not limited to reimbursement policy standards Solid interpersonal skills, establishing rapport and working well with others  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status.  Careers at OptumCare. We're on a mission to change the face of health care. As the largest health and wellness business in the US, we help 58 million people navigate the health care system, finance their health care needs and achieve their health and well-being goals. Fortunately, we have a team of the best and brightest minds on the planet to make it happen. Together we're creating the most innovative ideas and comprehensive strategies to help heal the health care system and create a brighter future for us all. Join us and learn why there is no better place to do your life's best work.(sm)  OptumCare is committed to creating an environment where physicians focus on what they do best: care for their patients. To do so, OptumCare provides administrative and business support services to both owned and affiliated medical practices which are part of OptumCare. Each medical practice part and their physician employees have complete authority with regards to all medical decision-making and patient care. OptumCare’s support services do not interfere with or control the practice of medicine by the medical practices or any of their physicians. Job Title: Solutran Technical Implementation Manager - Telecommute in Minneapolis or St. Paul, MN
Description: Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that's improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There's no room for error. Join us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)  Solutran is a leading FinTech company committed to creating game-changing, customer-friendly solutions. We serve health-seeking populations by partnering with the nation’s largest health plans, employers, retailers, and government programs. We’ve established a reputation for delivering modern, advanced customer experiences through best-in-class solutions used by millions.  Solutran is dedicated to promoting health, providing solutions for over-the-counter benefits, rewards, healthy food incentives and government programs supporting food insecure individuals. Learn more about our latest innovations at www.solutran.com.  The Technical Implementation Manager is responsible for overall technical product implementation and configuration of programs, product implementation project management, and relationship management for Solutran clients during the initial implementation process. The role requires a keen insight into Solutran product offerings, best practices, and calls for deep collaboration and partnership with business leadership across Client Services, Sales, Product, PMO, IT and other internal stakeholders. Our desire is for this position to play a critical role in Client Success. The position will help support and manage the technical end-to-end client onboarding process with complex enterprise organizations. Implementation projects will range in scope and complexity.  Seeking a candidate in the Twin Cities with hybrid in office and work from home capabilities.  If you live in Saint Paul or Minneapolis, Minnesoat you’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* as you take on some tough challenges.  Primary Responsibilities  Participate in client implementations as a player/doer/coach, supporting all technical stages of client onboarding with a cross-departmental team, from solution design, set-up, UAT and successful client launch Provide technical leadership for all client implementation activities for a complex healthcare client base, driving cross-functional delivery of services to customers Partner with internal teams to estimate, document and manage product scope; identify and escalate changes in client requested scope for roadmap consideration and pricing Foster and increase product knowledge sharing and learnings to enable consistent interaction with clients Provide product leadership along with strategic and tactical guidance during the various phases of the technical implementation process to ensure all necessary tools, processes, procedures, and staff are in place to support a successful implementation and rollout Be a thought leader within the organization for how best to implement new products/services within Solutran’s systems Build a strong and cohesive cross-departmental team by providing product leadership to indirect reports through coaching, setting strategic direction and applying working knowledge of Solutran S3 products, systems, and procedures Ensures that the Implementation team represents client needs to internal stakeholder organizations including Client Services, Sales, Product, IT, PMO, Risk and Legal through accurate business requirements and ongoing advocacy Establish and foster relationships with Client and internal stakeholders at all levels of staff and senior management Overall planning, directing and oversight responsibility of multiple product implementation projects requiring the utilization or management of resources across multiple departments or functional areas Lead by example Other duties as assigned  An individual in this position must be able to successfully perform the essential duties and responsibilities listed above. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of this position.  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  Bachelor’s degree (BA or BS) or equivalent experience 4+ years of experience managing complex client implementation projects Project management experience managing large-scale client projects with multiple stakeholders, ideally in the healthcare or payments industry Ability to participate in and manage technical configurations of multiple client implementation projects and competing priorities in a fast-paced client-centric environment Demonstrated strategic ability to solve complex issues exercising critical thinking and sound judgment and to lead cross functional teams through complex product business issues that do not have precedent Demonstrated ability to build and maintain business relationships with internal and external stakeholders at senior and executive management level Proven record of accomplishment in leading and driving teams to achieve and exceed established goals and objectives Full COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement of this role. UnitedHealth Group will adhere to all federal, state and local regulations as well as all client requirements and will obtain necessary proof of vaccination prior to employment to ensure compliance  Preferred Qualifications  Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or equivalent work experience in a project management or role in software or financial services Experience in data processing, API implementations, batch file processing, technical integrations, SQL, UX design Solid written and verbal communication skills  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status.  Careers at Solutran, part of the Optum and UnitedHealth Group family of businesses. We create direct spending solutions driven by our extensive financial tech experience to help those we serve be healthier, happier and more productive. Our platform helps members manage their health plans, supplemental benefits and rewards all in one place. You’ll have the opportunity to make it easier for consumers to manage their own health by making healthier products more affordable and their purchases streamlined. If you are a driven individual that thrives in fast-paced environments, values diversity and wants meaningful work that impacts the lives of many, then this is the team for you. Being part of an organization that makes healthier living easier for others leads to your life’s best work.(sm)  All Telecommuters will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy. Job Title: Release Manager - Eden Prairie, MN or Telecommute
Description: Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that's improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There's no room for error. Join us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)  As a Release Manager, you will be involved in defining, driving, and managing the release management functions for the Optum Care suite of applications. Optum Care’s local care market needs a flexible and affordable tiered IT support model for its Practice Management application. This support model will offer a speedy (15 minutes) and high first call resolution for incidents at revenue generating providers. The solution option would also need to support a complex environment due to the multi-player/multi network which could include multiple integration points.  This role will evolve as the delivery of the application progresses and will require an innovative approach to support of the team. This resource should be able to work independently, be adaptable to change, be comfortable with multi-tasking and have excellent organizational skills. Collaboration and solid communication skills will be critical.  You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within United States as you take on some tough challenges. Description: Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that is improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation is not about another gadget; it is about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There is no room for error. If you are looking for a better place to use your passion and your desire to drive change, this is the place to be. It's an opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)  The Business Manager’s primary objective will be to support the development and execution of a national infusion and oncology strategy with a goal of increasing performance and market share for existing operations, as well as expanding the service line to areas where we currently do not have a presence. They will assess and support all OptumCare markets with a national lens by optimizing operational performance of existing assets, identifying development and growth opportunities, creating a clear and concise value story and advancing all aspects of the quadruple aim.  This role, and supporting partners / team, functions as a strategic resource to OptumCare helping to formulate opportunities, accelerate execution and serve as a centralized source of knowledge and best practices on the management and operational performance of the service line. The service line team actively identifies and leads key opportunities that lead to growth, revenue generation and product integration.  You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.  Primary Responsibilities Strategy and Growth: Collaborate and partner closely with local market leadership and delivery teams as well as across functional areas (e.g. finance, technology, analytics) Develop business - level goals focused on maximizing service line performance that can be turned into specific operating and business plans Ensure that the service line strategy addresses applicable market expectations (e.g., patients, payers, providers, external business partners) Monitor external and internal environment for trends, innovation and impactful considerations taking place in the field Operational Effectiveness: Conduct and review analysis designed to identify market gaps and opportunities Develop and implement strategic and tactical operating plans Drive high quality execution and operational excellence Execute on service line roadmap in a timely and effective manner Relationship Building: Collaborate with national and local market partners to build long-lasting transparent and trusting relationships Collaborate with applicable stakeholders to obtain input and buy-in to strategies (e.g., market-level leaders, marketing, sales, health plan partners, sales channels, shared services, operations) General Work directly with and across OptumCare business units to help determine needs and solve complex and strategic business challenges Ensure consistency and coordination in how service lines are implemented; driving best practices across the business Work efforts are focused around the patients served and optimizing the patient and provider experience  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  Bachelor’s Degree or 4+ years of additional experience in lieu of Degree 2+ years of experience working with a health care organization or health insurer, or as a consultant 1+ years of project management experience Ability to travel nationally up to 25% based on business needs  Preferred Qualifications  Experience developing, managing, operating oncology or infusion service lines Record of positive relationships with providers, techs, managers and staff that strengthen engagement, quality and service; ability to select and develop effective managers Ability to guide and utilize analytics to drive and optimize clinical operations Ability to work independently as well as in a cross functional team Proven ability to execute on large projects, effect change and meet business goals, monitor progress, and take corrective actions when necessary  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status.  Careers with Optum. Here's the idea. We built an entire organization around one giant objective; make health care work better for everyone. So when it comes to how we use the world's large accumulation of health-related information, or guide health and lifestyle choices or manage pharmacy benefits for millions, our first goal is to leap beyond the status quo and uncover new ways to serve. Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, brings together some of the greatest minds and most advanced ideas on where health care has to go in order to reach its fullest potential. For you, that means working on high performance teams against sophisticated challenges that matter. Optum, incredible ideas in one incredible company and a singular opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)  OptumCare is committed to creating an environment where physicians focus on what they do best: care for their patients. To do so, OptumCare provides administrative and business support services to both owned and affiliated medical practices which are part of OptumCare. Each medical practice part and their physician employees have complete authority with regards to all medical decision-making and patient care. OptumCare’s support services do not interfere with or control the practice of medicine by the medical practices or any of their physicians. On the one hand, no industry is moving faster than health care. On the other, no organization is better positioned to lead health care forward than Optum and UnitedHealth Group. That's what makes this opportunity so inviting. Our goal is simple. Use data, technology and people in ways that help drive change and make the health care system work better for everyone. We are seeking a driven and results oriented Associate Director of Product to work on our Optum Care Delivery team in our OptimalCare arena. Join us and put your advanced knowledge and skills to work by driving innovation through leading the product development and client delivery efforts for each application under the OptimalCare technology portfolio. A large portion of this role involves embracing a user centered design approach through collaboration and direct input from our Care Delivery Organization (CDO) partners in order to ensure we advance the continuum of care with application solutions that meet their needs. If you're out to do more, this is the place to be.  Optum is a company that's on the rise. We're expanding in multiple directions, across borders and, most of all, in the way we think. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about transforming the health care industry. Ready to make a difference? Make yourself at home with us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)  This role will challenge your ability to work on complex projects where deadlines and scope shift frequently. You'll need flexibility, agility and the ability to adapt to change while maintaining strong relationships with stakeholders in a highly cross-matrixed environment.  You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.  Primary Responsibilities  Identify project/deployment durations, effort, sequence, and dependencies required to meet applicable application implementation objectives Owns the development of project scope statements, in consultation with the applicable stakeholders (e.g. project charter, Statement of Work, deployment strategy and timeline) Provide guidance, expertise, and/or assistance to internal and/or external partners to ensure programs and strategies are implemented and maintained effectively Leads the development and execution of product training strategies across all applications Establish the product implementation and support strategies across all product lines and align documentation and communication needs to ensure efficient processes are carried out Serve as the Solutions Strategist to determine market (CDO) opportunities, competitive landscape, and technology trends to guide the evolution of the product portfolio. Own all vendor relationships, coordinate capacity and manage ongoing implementation and development priorities to an annual roadmap Lead the coordination with all vendor and product partners and establish processes and procedures to ensure clear and timely communication is delivered on outstanding issues and enhancements Lead product design and requirements gathering sessions in coordination with business and CDO partners Oversee the incorporation of program elements/strategy into the Product Roadmap and ensure follow through Develop and maintain documentation of product requirements and translation of specifications from the clinical and operations team Align data strategies to associated tools and ensure automation is achieved were available Establish, develop and maintain effective relationships with applicable project stakeholders (e.g., project team members, team leads, internal customers, functional SMEs, business partners, leadership) Lead cross functional teams and drive the team to successfully complete the objectives of the program and cross-product strategy Ability to engage functional partners on both the Optum and CDO levels to effectively deliver on each application pilot project Engage with local provider organizations to support, augment and accelerate efforts to improve operational coordination of patient care through application development and optimization Research and proactively seek to fill in knowledge gaps in key functional areas. Analyze application deployment outcomes and make appropriate recommendations to improve outcomes/processes moving forward (e.g., repeatable processes, feedback loops, cross-project improvement opportunities) Manage the creation and evolution of new/revised business processes/procedures and ensure changes are documented, updated, and approved, as needed  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may  Required Qualifications  6+ years of consulting level technology project development and portfolio management experience 6+ years of Heath Care industry experience Experience building and leading cross-functional teams & leading work through influence Ability to work in fast-paced environment with ambition, client focus and innovative ideas that will enhance and improve results in a new program and product culture Travel around 25 - 30%  Preferred Qualifications  Bachelor’s degree in related business or healthcare technology field Informatics advanced degree or on the job experience Experience on the provider network side Experience working in a cross-matrixed organization  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status.  Careers at OptumCare. We're on a mission to change the face of health care. As the largest health and wellness business in the US, we help 58 million people navigate the health care system, finance their health care needs and achieve their health and well-being goals. Fortunately, we have a team of the best and brightest minds on the planet to make it happen. Together we're creating the most innovative ideas and comprehensive strategies to help heal the health care system and create a brighter future for us all. Join us and learn why there is no better place to do your life's best work.(sm)  OptumCare is committed to creating an environment where physicians focus on what they do best: care for their patients. To do so, OptumCare provides administrative and business support services to both owned and affiliated medical practices which are part of OptumCare. Each medical practice part and their physician employees have complete authority with regards to all medical decision-making and patient care. OptumCare’s support services do not interfere with or control the practice of medicine by the medical practices or any of their physicians. Job Title: Optum Store, Senior Product Manager - Telecommute
Description: Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that's improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There's no room for error. Join us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)  As an Optum Store Sr. Product Manager, you are responsible for defining and driving a product portfolio of connected pharmacy and care experiences on the Optum Store – Optum’s flagship direct-to-consumer platform. Successful candidates must develop and demonstrate excellence in strategic and critical thinking, product design and development, consumer experience design, and issue resolution. The role will afford the opportunity to learn and engage with numerous Optum businesses to enhance the direct-to-consumer offerings available through the Optum Store.  Positions in this job family support the launch of new products and improvement of existing products. They review product performance against expectations and facilitate or influence changes to the product portfolio to improve competitive position and optimal product performance. They may work with internal or external business constituents to determine future direction and involve working within multiple product functions.  You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.  Primary Responsibilities  Rigorous management of the product backlog by evaluating and prioritizing new features that deliver customer and business value Responsible for defining, prioritizing, and driving the product roadmap for our connected pharmacy and care experiences with a focus on delivering the greatest value to our business and customers Own the vision and product strategy with a keen-eye on gaining buy-in from across the organization Set and drive key performance indicators (KPIs) through continuous feedback loops prioritizing enhancements that drive measurable improvement to these KPIs Define and advocate for ways your products and features can deliver greater value to the broader Optum Store business Collaborate with other Optum Store product managers and across the enterprise to ensure the right roadmap alignment to drive the greatest business and customer value Revenue is a team sport, and you play a critical role in identifying, prioritizing, planning, and executing new revenue generating opportunities Communicate product performance with various business partners and senior leadership Work with cross-functional partners including, but not limited to: Marketing, Operations, Finance, Market Research, Clinical Services, Pharmacy Services, and Customer Services in a fast-paced environment Working knowledge of development and technology to understand risks, communicate trade-offs, and estimate development effort Work with, coordinate, and manage multiple external vendors to develop new products Measure financial and growth goals towards defined organizational objectives Exemplify the UnitedHealth Group culture in words and actions Execute work with operational discipline following project management best practices and holding business partners to the same standards  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  Bachelor's degree 4+ years of experience in digital product development, product management or related 2+ years of experience with defining requirements and managing through execution 1+ year of experience with data analysis and developing reporting metrics to shape business priorities Proficient in MS Word, Excel and PowerPoint Experience with common product development tools and concepts (i.e., wire framing, prototyping, A/B testing and agile development methods) Experience working in virtual pharmacy, retail pharmacy, or virtual care Project management experience Full COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement of this role. UnitedHealth Group will adhere to all federal, state and local regulations as well as all client requirements and will obtain necessary proof of vaccination prior to employment to ensure compliance.  Preferred Qualifications  Experience working in ecommerce Experience working in asynchronous care  Success Metrics  Execution of product roadmap and defined milestones Alignment of product roadmap to business performance metrics Reporting aligned to constituent value levers and messaging Responsiveness of product features/offering to constituent demands  Daily Practices  Excellent follow through, attention to detail, and time management skills Good negotiation, problem solving, planning, and decision-making skills Ability to think strategically and execute methodically Ability to manage work across multiple external vendors Solid interpersonal, communication and management skills Ability to think creatively and to be hands-on in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment Demonstrated ability to use hard data and metrics to back up assumptions and develop business cases that can be clearly and easily communicated Willingness to roll up sleeves and do whatever is necessary and take on a general manager / owner mentality High attention to detail including ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously Excellent verbal and written communication skills  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status.  Careers with OptumRx. We're one of the largest and most innovative pharmacy benefits managers in the US, serving more than 12 million people nationwide. Here you'll fill far more than prescriptions. As a member of one of our pharmacy teams, you're empowered to be your best and do whatever it takes to help each customer. You'll find unrivaled support and training as well as a wealth of growth and development opportunities driven by your performance and limited only by your imagination. Join us. There's no better place to help people live healthier lives while doing your life's best work.(sm)  All Telecommuters will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy. You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.  Energize your career with one of Healthcare’s fastest growing companies.  You dream of a great career with a great company – where you can make an impact and help people. We dream of giving you the opportunity to do just this. And with the incredible growth of our business, it’s a dream that definitely can come true. Already one of the world’s leading Healthcare companies, UnitedHealth Group is restlessly pursuing new ways to operate our service centers, improve our service levels and help people lead healthier lives. We live for the opportunity to make a difference and right now, we are living it up.  This opportunity is with one of our most exciting business areas: Optum – a growing part of our family of companies that make UnitedHealth Group a Fortune 10 leader.  Optum helps nearly 60 million Americans live their lives to the fullest by educating them about their symptoms, conditions and treatments; helping them to navigate the system, finance their healthcare needs and stay on track with their health goals. No other business touches so many lives in such a positive way. And we do it all with every action focused on our shared values of Integrity, Compassion, Relationships, Innovation & Performance.  The Account Manager is an advocate for OptumRx and also represents the needs of our clients. This position performs tasks necessary for the support of client business and technical needs. This requires developing and maintaining an excellent working relationship with the clients, the Account Management Team and internal departments; in addition to developing an excellent understanding of the industry. The Account Manager provides a leadership role in working with our Client Service Managers & External Clients to resolve issues in order to maintain and improve their level of customer satisfaction. The Account Manager is adept at the art of client diplomacy.  This position is full-time (40 hours/week) Monday - Friday. Employees are required to work our normal business hours of 8:00am – 5:00pm. It may be necessary, given the business need, to work occasional overtime or weekends.  All Telecommuters will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy.  Primary Responsibilities  Use strong industry knowledge to add value to the clients' operation Maintain an ongoing knowledge of clients' business; as well as their contract with OptumRx Drive solutions by engaging multiple organizational areas and providing guidance to CSM’s Provide positive alternatives to complex situations encountered by client and manage expectations Perform systems analysis to determine source of technical issues, and act as liaison between external clients and internal departments to resolve these issues Act in project coordinator/manager capacity to ensure accurate and timely completion of client projects, to the client's satisfaction Produce and analyze key reports, offering viable solutions to key issues Identify deliverables and manage to due dates Complete service requests to translate customer needs and requirements for OptumRx product support and development teams Communicate with clients via face-to-face meetings, conference calls and written correspondence Interfaces with internal Optum departments Other duties as assigned by SAE or Director (including special projects) Intermediate or advanced understanding of Medicare Part D and other regulatory guidelines Ensure client service level agreements and PG’s are met Understand organizations capabilities, products and services Following all policies and procedures related to job responsibilities and participating in the development and maintenance of departmental policies and procedures, and tools for Account Management, as appropriate Understand, communicate, and execute the client contract according to the terms and conditions, including but not limited to the monitoring and reporting of performance guarantees Working with Strategic Account Executive, and other team members on client renewals and renegotiating contracts with clients to obtain extended agreements while losing as little profitability as possible Provides training, support and direction to other team members, as necessary Establishing multiple corporate relationships and participates in client sponsored events Cultivating in-group growth through these relationships Identify and support potential upsell opportunities Staying abreast of industry trends and developments and demonstrates strong communication skills in presenting these to clients Understanding the impact of industry and regulatory trends and changes for your client Ability to travel up-to 25% of the time  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  Associate’s Degree (or higher/equivalent experience) 3+ years of experience with Health Plans or with the PBM industry 1+ years of experience in project management 2+ years of experience in a client facing role  Preferred Qualifications  Ability to write reports, business correspondence and technical specifications Reside within the Central/Eastern time zone  Telecommuting Requirements  Required to have a dedicated work area established that is separated from other living areas and provides information privacy Ability to keep all company sensitive documents secure (if applicable) Must live in a location that can receive a UnitedHealth Group approved high-speed internet connection or leverage an existing high-speed internet service  Soft Skills  Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from clients, management and technical associates Ability to solve practical issues and deal with many variables in situations where only limited standardization exists Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form Excellent organizational skills Excellent verbal and written communication skills Excellent presentation skills Ability to communicate to an executive audience Effective time management  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status.  Military & Veterans find your next mission: We know your background and experience is different and we like that. UnitedHealth Group values the skills, experience and dedication that serving in the military demands. In fact, many of the values defined in the service mirror what the UnitedHealth Group culture holds true: Integrity, Compassion, Relationships, Innovation and Performance. Whether you are looking to transition from active duty to a civilian career, or are an experienced veteran or spouse, we want to help guide your career journey. Learn more at https://uhg.hr/transitioning-military  Learn how Teresa, a Senior Quality Analyst, works with military veterans and ensures they receive the best benefits and experience possible. https://uhg.hr/vet  Careers with Optum. Here's the idea. We built an entire organization around one giant objective; make the health system work better for everyone. So when it comes to how we use the world's large accumulation of health - related information, or guide health and lifestyle choices or manage pharmacy benefits for millions, our first goal is to leap beyond the status quo and uncover new ways to serve. Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, brings together some of the greatest minds and most advanced ideas on where health care has to go in order to reach its fullest potential. For you, that means working on high performance teams against sophisticated challenges that matter. Optum, incredible ideas in one incredible company and a singular opportunity to do your life's best work.SM  Colorado, Connecticut or Nevada Residents Only: The salary range for Colorado residents is $64,800 - $116,000. The salary range for Connecticut / Nevada residents is $71,400 - $127,400. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, etc. In addition to your salary, UnitedHealth Group offers benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). Job Title: Senior Manager, Software Engineering - Basking Ridge, NJ
Description: Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that's improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There's no room for error. Join us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)  Primary Responsibilities  Partner with Business, Technical and Strategic Product to manage project commitments in an agile framework; rapidly delivering value to our customers via technology solutions Own the applications’ technology stack and drive modern solutions to complex problems Drive design and development of resilient, reliable, scalable and self-healing solutions to meet and exceed customer requirements Ensure that all parts of the application eco system are thoroughly and effectively covered with telemetry Relieve the team of “churn” and “waste” by driving automation of menial tasks Collaborate with leaders across partner-teams to drive cohesive and optimal solutions Communicate clearly and effectively in oral and written forms, and be able to present and demonstrate work to technical and non-technical stakeholders Mentor the engineering team to develop and perform as highly as possible  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  Bachelor's or Master's degree in computer science 10+ years of experience in areas of software development and delivery 10+years of experience in design/development, deployment and operations of n-Tiered applications 10+ years of experience in Java, SQL 5+ years of experience in front-end technologies, JavaScript frameworks (Angular, ReactJS) 5+ years of experience in Springboot framework 3+ years of experience with Redis/Memcache or other caching frameworks 1+ years of experience in container technologies like Docker, Docker Swarm, Kubernetes 1+ years of experience with streaming technologies like Kafka Experience in setting up and maintaining full infrastructure Experience in system design and data structure programming skills Experience in data modeling and performance focused data structure design Experience with serverless architecture Experience in software design and experience with tradeoffs to balance between delivery priorities and delivery quality Experience in leading small teams on fast paced projects Full COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement of this role. UnitedHealth Group will adhere to all federal, state and local regulations as well as all client requirements and will obtain necessary proof of vaccination prior to employment to ensure compliance  Preferred Qualifications  Tenacity to work with business stake holders to bring clarity in requirements Solid analytical skills and grasp on computer science concepts & fundamentals Experience in graph DB's, Big Data or NoSQL  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status.  Technology Careers with Optum. Information and technology have amazing power to transform the health care industry and improve people's lives. This is where it's happening. This is where you'll help solve the problems that have never been solved. We're freeing information so it can be used safely and securely wherever it's needed. We're creating the very best ideas that can most easily be put into action to help our clients improve the quality of care and lower costs for millions. This is where the best and the brightest work together to make positive change a reality. This is the place to do your life's best work.(sm)  Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.
