Job Title: Clinical Content Analyst - Telecommute in Plano, TX
Description: Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that is improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation is not about another gadget; it is about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There is no room for error. If you are looking for a better place to use your passion and your desire to drive change, this is the place to be. It's an opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)  Vivify Health specializes in patient engagement and mobility to provide a scalable Remote Care Platform that enable healthcare to be virtualized... anytime and anywhere. More often than not, that “anywhere is the home, which is where Vivify’s customers have been virtualizing care with mobile devices since early 2010. Today, Vivify Health’s customers represent organizations with responsibilities for hundreds of acute care and home care sites nationwide.  The solution is a pure software platform and is agnostic to the network, consumer electronics and personal health devices. Off-the-shelf consumer electronics, such as tablets and smart phones, provide the most effective user experience combined with the lowest possible cost.  Vivify’s cloud-based platform - applicable for Providers, ACOs, Payers, Employers and Pharmaceutical organizations - delivers the next generation of direct-to-consumer care. Features include customized care plans for any clinical condition, aggregation of in-home health status and vital signs data for automatic transmission to caregivers, coaching, education video content, teach-back confirmations, and interactive HD video conferencing to optimally engage patients with caregivers, providers, and family members.  This job operates in an environment that handles Personal Health Information, Electronic Protected Health Information along with other Personal Identifiable Information and requires strict security and privacy awareness with regards to handling such information.  The Clinical Content Analyst’s primary responsibility is in supporting the clinical team and customer as the clinical subject expert related to the product content for the programs in the Vivify Health Pathways portal. The Clinical Analyst works closely with internal and external customers in the development, analysis, implementation and maintenance of the high-quality digital content associated with rules and pathway logic in the Vivify Health software platform. In this role, the Clinical Analyst will work collaboratively with the content, product, development, quality, clinical, and user experience teams to support the goals and objectives of the content for the different clinical programs in the Vivify software. This role reports to the Director of Clinical Content.  If you are located in Plano, TX, you will have the flexibility to telecommute* as you take on some tough challenges. Central Time Zone may be considered.  Primary Responsibilities  Act as a key resource on system functionality related to content logic and rules and content administrative tools Maintain and update the Vivify Pathways digital health programs with the latest evidence-based practices and clinical guidelines Curate robust digital health programs using low-code display logic and apply intelligent content automation using Vivify’s rules engine Develop clinical content appropriate for clinical governance and legal review, obtain necessary journal permissions, and fact check content and sources Development, implementation and/or on-going management of digital health program(s) Provides strategic oversight and support, measurement standards and revisions as needed for delivery of digital health programs focused on quality, affordability and outcomes Work closely with the Director of Content Management, Product, Development and UX Design teams to build digital content, including advanced and automatic content workflows, tagging and processes Manage assigned projects to completion and meet goals, timeline, and budget Take on other responsibilities as our team/clients’ needs evolve  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  Maintains license as a Registered nurse in good standing with the Board of Nursing Excellent computer and technology knowledge and skills Intermediate skills in Microsoft Word, Excel, Power Point and Outlook  Preferred Qualifications  Master’s Degree in Nursing Informatics 2+ years of healthcare background Experience with healthcare software Identifies solutions to non-standard requests and problems Solves moderately complex problems and/or conducts moderately complex analyses Works with minimal guidance; seeks guidance on only the most complex tasks Solid ability to communicate complex content, processes, and best practices to internal and external stakeholders Self-motivated, self-directed, and able to manage multiple projects simultaneously Exceptional project management skills, very detail oriented, and perform well under deadlines Full COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement of this role. UnitedHealth Group will adhere to all federal, state and local regulations as well as all client requirements and will obtain necessary proof of vaccination prior to employment to ensure compliance  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status. This is where you'll help solve the problems that have never been solved. We're freeing information so it can be used safely and securely wherever it's needed. We're creating the very best ideas that can most easily be put into action to help our clients improve the quality of care and lower costs for millions. This is where the best and the brightest work together to make positive change a reality. This is the place to do your life's best work.(sm)  All Telecommuters will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy. UnitedHealth Group is a company on the rise. We’re expanding in multiple directions, across borders and most of all, in the way we think. Here, innovation isn’t about another gadget, it’s about transforming the healthcare industry. Ready to make a difference? Make yourself at home with us and start doing your life’s best work.(sm)  As a Talent Acquisition Manager for our High Volume functional team, your work will have a direct impact on the service and support that our millions of members and providers receive on a daily basis as we work to transform healthcare. The High Volume function is responsible for the staffing of all the customer service, claims, billing, enrollment, and pharmacy tech positions across all business groups. To support the high-volume recruiting for this function, the High Volume also uses the services of a Recruitment Process Outsourcing (RPO) firm. In conjunction with our RPO, the management of an efficient and cost effective hiring process, resulting in quality employees hired within the prescribed SLA, will be the challenge and outcome expected for this role. We serve the talent acquisition needs of over 100 locations (our customer service and claims centers) in the United States and hire nearly 20,000 people each year. Be prepared to move quickly, to engage proactively, and to think strategically.  You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.  Position Objectives  For the assigned geographies, the Talent Acquisition Manager is responsible for the matrix management of the RPO to ensure the success of the staffing requirements of the business including: Functions as the liaison between the business and the RPO regarding the communication, management and evaluation of hiring forecasts, planning, resources, timelines, and risk assessments Monitors recruitment activity and status to ensure that service delivery agreements are met based on the pre-determined metrics Consults and collaborates with the RPO staff on class-based requisitions, ensuring proactive approaches are taken to meet projected hiring dates Communicates and reinforces with the RPO staff the business unit strategies and priorities, leadership and hiring manager structures, etc. to provide a thorough and positive experience Functions as a project manager for High Volume projects - projects which directly impact Recruitment Services or the broader UHG businesses. These projects may be directly related to large-scale cross-functional staffing initiatives or in support of recruitment education, process improvement or process design Performs as a member of the High Volume team as follows: Participates in the development of best practices, trending and ROI related to: sourcing, marketing, passive and active (and Alumni) relationship management strategies, assessment tools and protocol candidate close/conversion, candidate and hiring manager satisfaction and hiring outcomes Assists in developing standardized tools, templates and processes for use throughout Recruitment Services to deliver a consistent experience for stakeholders Participates in the development of functional strategic objectives including setting functional priorities based on business outcomes and anticipated business plan needs Serves as an ambassador of the Employee Value Proposition, understanding the various elements and brand guidelines and reinforces with the RPO staff and business management Develops, as required, standardized fulfillment and ad-hoc reports for weekly, monthly or quarterly timeframes Proactively reports issues and proposed solutions to Talent Acquisition Leaders across enterprise Demonstrates effective and consistent use of recruitment technology including Taleo, CRM, PeopleSoft, SharePoint, etc. Embraces the concept of continuous learning and development, participates in the opportunities provided by UnitedHealth Group, and incorporates into personal development plan  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  BA/BS in Business, Human Resources or related field; or equivalent experience 7+ years of recruitment experience 2+ years of RPO management experience, or experience working for an RPO or staffing agency  Preferred Qualifications  2+ years of prior supervisory/managerial experience High volume experience, as well as knowledge of best-in-class recruiting techniques, models and processes Intermediate Excel, reporting and data analyzing skills Demonstrated ability to influence, persuade, and consult on Talent Acquisition solutions Demonstrated ability to perform in a matrix organization Strong skills in the areas of process improvement and management Possesses corporate recruitment process knowledge Excellent written and verbal communication skills including conflict resolution and negotiation skills Knowledge of various recruitment technologies (Taleo preferred) as well as Microsoft Office and related software Strong understanding of employment law practices, OFCCP and AAP compliance and related recruitment laws and regulations PHR, SPHR, CPC certifications a plus  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status.  Careers at UnitedHealth Group. We have modest goals: Improve the lives of others. Change the landscape of health care forever. Leave the world a better place than we found it. Such aspirations tend to attract a certain type of person. Crazy talented. Compassionate. Driven. To these select few, we offer the global reach, resources and can-do culture of a Fortune 7 company. We provide an environment where you're empowered to be your best. We encourage you to take risks. And we offer a world of rewards and benefits for performance. We believe the most important is the opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)  Colorado, Connecticut or Nevada Residents Only: The salary range for Colorado residents is $79,700 to $142,600. The salary range for Connecticut / Nevada residents is $87,900 to $156,900. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, etc. In addition to your salary, UnitedHealth Group offers benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). No matter where or when you begin a career with UnitedHealth Group, you’ll find a far-reaching choice of benefits and incentives  All Telecommuters will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy. These projects may be directly related to large-scale cross-functional staffing initiatives or in support of recruitment education, process improvement or process design Performs as a member of the High Volume team as follows:Participates in the development of best practices, trending and ROI related to: sourcing, marketing, passive and active (and Alumni) relationship management strategies, assessment tools and protocol candidate close/conversion, candidate and hiring manager satisfaction and hiring outcomesAssists in developing standardized tools, templates and processes for use throughout Recruitment Services to deliver a consistent experience for stakeholdersParticipates in the development of functional strategic objectives including setting functional priorities based on business outcomes and anticipated business plan needsServes as an ambassador of the Employee Value Proposition, understanding the various elements and brand guidelines and reinforces with the RPO staff and business managementDevelops, as required, standardized fulfillment and ad-hoc reports for weekly, monthly or quarterly timeframesProactively reports issues and proposed solutions to Talent Acquisition Leaders across enterpriseDemonstrates effective and consistent use of recruitment technology including Taleo, CRM, PeopleSoft, SharePoint, etc. Embraces the concept of continuous learning and development, participates in the opportunities provided by UnitedHealth Group, and incorporates into personal development planYou’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.Required QualificationsBA/BS in Business, Human Resources or related field; or equivalent experience7+ years of recruitment experience2+ years of RPO management experience, or experience working for an RPO or staffing agencyPreferred Qualifications2+ years of prior supervisory/managerial experienceHigh volume experience, as well as knowledge of best-in-class recruiting techniques, models and processesIntermediate Excel, reporting and data analyzing skillsDemonstrated ability to influence, persuade, and consult on Talent Acquisition solutions Demonstrated ability to perform in a matrix organizationStrong skills in the areas of process improvement and managementPossesses corporate recruitment process knowledgeExcellent written and verbal communication skills including conflict resolution and negotiation skillsKnowledge of various recruitment technologies (Taleo preferred) as well as Microsoft Office and related softwareStrong understanding of employment law practices, OFCCP and AAP compliance and related recruitment laws and regulations PHR, SPHR, CPC certifications a plusUnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status.Careers at UnitedHealth Group. Job Title: Senior Field Account Manager - Orlando, FL
Description: Expanding access to affordable, high quality health care starts here. This is where some of the most innovative ideas in health care are created every day. This is where bold people with big ideas are writing the next chapter in health care. This is the place to do your life's best work.(sm)  UnitedHealthcare, a UnitedHealth Group company, provides network-based health and well-being benefits and services for employers and consumers nationwide. We use our strength, diversity and innovation to improve the lives of the more than 18 million people who receive our unique products and services. And our endless pursuit for excellence in everything we do extends to your career as well. Join us today for an inspired and purposeful mix of professional growth opportunities and personal rewards.  The Key Account (KA), Senior Field Account Manager is the 'field-based Service Owner' responsible for the customer's (Benefit Manager) total service experience with UnitedHealthcare. This includes serving as the key liaison between the customer and the Central Service team, trending/monitoring of service issue resolution, and education for the customer and their employees.  Primary Responsibilities  Address any escalated issues sent to them, the SAE, or other field employee Work with the central team and their manager to coordinate resolution Meet with customers quarterly (or more often if requested) to review service related statistics including ideas for improving or enhancing the customer's total service Conduct training/education with customers on UHC eServices, eCR Reporting, and other eTools as appropriate Responsible for conducting open enrollment meetings or coordinating coverage with other offices or a vendor if they are not available Training customers on Unitedhealthcare's core wellness tools and resources, as well as communicating various administrative/service related changes to the customer (ie; network or pharmacy preferred drug changes Reports to the local field market VP/Director of Account Generally handle the largest and most complex customers (ie: ASO, 1,000+ groups)  You'll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  Hold insurance license as required by law or obtain upon hire 4+ years of work experience in large customer account management customer service role Experience which demonstrates the ability to work with employers, consumers, consultants, brokers Ability to demonstrate superior presentation skills in both small and large group settings Advanced knowledge of self-funded and complex benefit packages Experience working with large consultant firms Proficiency in Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, Excel and UHC eTools  Preferred Qualifications  Bachelor's degree 5+ years of health care industry experience Advanced Analytical and problem solving skills Bilingual, Spanish/English  Competencies and Best Practice for High  Performance Driven: Delivers exceptional performance; strives to achieve stretch objectives; focuses on results, not efforts. Top-Performing Employees Are Our Greatest Asset: Fosters a competitive environment and serves as a role model to other employees. Self motivated; maintains a high level of work quality, focuses on detail and is dependable in meeting commitments and fulfilling obligations. Build Value to Customers: Builds and strengthens customer relationships; finds better ways to meet customer needs; acts ethically, maintaining the highest personal and professional integrity. Supports the overall objectives of the primary Dir, Strategic Accounts. Accountability Through Matrix Management: Works effectively within the matrix, promoting trust and communications across the business segments; collaboratively builds strong relationships. Strong interpersonal skills; networks outside and inside the organization and builds positive relationships with key individuals and groups. Organizational and Personal Influencing Skills: Creates, builds, and maintains relationships that enhance the performance of the business, including those outside direct control. Obtains commitments from individuals or groups to ensure organization success. Ability to influence individuals at all levels of the organization.  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status.  Careers at UnitedHealthcare Employer & Individual. We all want to make a difference with the work we do. Sometimes we're presented with an opportunity to make a difference on a scale we couldn't imagine. Here, you get that opportunity every day. As a member of one of our elite teams, you'll provide the ideas and solutions that help nearly 25 million customers live healthier lives. You'll help write the next chapter in the history of health care. And you'll find a wealth of open doors and career paths that will take you as far as you want to go. Go further. This is your life's best work.(sm)  Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. Job Title: Sales Implementation Manager - Telecommute in Western PA
Description: Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that is improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation is not about another gadget; it is about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There is no room for error. If you are looking for a better place to use your passion and your desire to drive change, this is the place to be. It's an opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)  The Sales Implementation Manager is responsible for the successful opening of new skilled nursing facilities. The Sales Implementation Manager will support the Sales Lead in a market to execute new facility implementation plans. This will include use of development tools and timelines to ensure membership goals are met.  If you are located in Western PA, you will have the flexibility to telecommute* as you take on some tough challenges.  Primary Responsibilities  Implementation of new/re-launch of targeted Same Store Skilled Nursing Facility Accounts as determined by the market sales leader Meets established implementation project plan and lead goals in new buildings prior to opening and 90 days post effective date Leads re-launch efforts of targeted Same Store homes Works collaboratively with Sales Account Manager's to meet Same Store penetration goals Manages all aspects of new SNF Implementation Plan (internal and external) Effective introduction, implementation and insurance of SNF commitment to participate in ongoing compliant lead generation processes Ensures a critical mass of potential enrollees exists (through established lead targets) in a building to ensure successful clinical and sales operations Manages all aspects of new SNF opening including initial department head meetings, individual meetings, internal planning meetings, 30, 60, 90 day meetings with SNFs and / or other meetings as appropriate Must adhere to all compliance requirements Meets licensing and certification requirements (i.e. complete annual refortification as established by leadership) Provides data to support site reporting needs related to new business and growth initiatives Demonstrates effective team and cross functional support through: Coordination with Clinical team Coordination with sales team to ensure smooth transition / hand-off after 90 days of SNF opening Provision of appropriate and timely information to Clinical, Sales, Operations and Network Feedback to other team members / teams to improve on process, business needs, customer relationships  You'll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  Ability to obtain and maintain license to sell health insurance within 90 days of hire 3+ years of Account Management or Project Management Experience in a sales/marketing or customer facing role Customer service experience Proficiency with Microsoft Word, PowerPoint and Excel Proven sales/negotiation skills Willingness to host and schedule sales appointments if necessary Able to work some evenings and weekends 50-75% travel daily  Preferred Qualifications  2+ years in the health care industry with experience in Medicare, Medicaid Managed Care, Health Insurance or Nursing home industry Experience working with Nursing Homes Salesforce database experience Proficient oral and written communication skills Solid self-management and time management skills Able to work effectively independently and within a team environment Proper business phone etiquette Full COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement of this role. UnitedHealth Group will adhere to all federal, state and local regulations as well as all client requirements and will obtain necessary proof of vaccination prior to employment to ensure compliance  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status.  Careers with Optum. Here's the idea. We built an entire organization around one giant objective; make health care work better for everyone. So when it comes to how we use the world's large accumulation of health-related information, or guide health and lifestyle choices or manage pharmacy benefits for millions, our first goal is to leap beyond the status quo and uncover new ways to serve. Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, brings together some of the greatest minds and most advanced ideas on where health care has to go in order to reach its fullest potential. For you, that means working on high performance teams against sophisticated challenges that matter. Optum, incredible ideas in one incredible company and a singular opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)  All Telecommuters will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy. Job Title: Senior Product Manager, Get Care Tooling - Telecommute
Description: Careers at Rally Health, part of the Optum and UnitedHealth Group family of businesses. Our mission at Rally® is to empower individuals to take control of their health through personalized, data-driven health care information and recommendations that lead to better outcomes. We leverage our digital platform and leading-edge technology to make health care data accessible wherever and whenever people need it, all while ensuring safety and reliability. Here, you’ll help people find the right doctors, give them a clear breakdown of costs, incentivize them to stay focused on their overall health with daily goals, and help them earn rewards such as discounts on a wide range of goods as well as bonuses for reaching fitness objectives. As part of our Rally® team, you’ll have the opportunity to drive change with an innovative healthcare technology company that is dedicated to creating a culture of healthy living. Help us bring real change to healthcare and you’ll experience what it’s like to do your life's best work.(sm)  As the Senior Product Manager for Get Care Tooling, you will lead the definition and execution of the roadmap to scale the care search, cost estimate, and virtual care delivery experiences to millions of users. Your charter is to promote the evolution of the tools that our teams use to deploy digital experiences that guide users to find the most appropriate care for their needs without engineering interventions. You'll work with internal partners and external partners to collect their input and perspective throughout your roadmap creation and evolution, but also bring them along to your product vision using data, insights, and aligning to our goals. As part of the Get Care team you will report to The Director of Product.  You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.  Primary Responsibilities  Guide a roadmap through the product life cycle of strategy, OKR alignment, definition/requirements, delivery, and go-to-market Work across teams (e.g. engineering, product, sales, marketing, security, and legal) to solve myriad complex problems in a creative and thoughtful way Oversee the development of your set of product features and determine which order is most impactful to the business and why Determine detailed requirements and user stories Work with engineering and other teams (including others in Product, Client Delivery, XD, Program Management, Legal, teams within Optum and United Healthcare) for delivery of roadmap items Contribute to a product culture of consumer and industry research, development, and rapid test and learn Use data to support hypotheses and conclusions for developing business cases and roadmap priorities that inform the success of your products  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  3+ years of experience as a Product Manager, building software products: working with engineers and designers to create great user experiences using scrum/agile development processes An impetus to start with users needs (jobs-to-be-done) and work backwards to solutions Ability to discuss technical concepts, articulate tradeoffs and propose new concepts to your squad and partners Familiarity pulling and analyzing large sets of data to craft strategy and guide product roadmap creation Ability to understand and articulate trade-offs and willingness to make pivots based on new information and insights  Preferred Qualifications  Bachelor’s degree Experience in healthcare  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status.  Technology Careers with Optum. Information and technology have amazing power to transform the health care industry and improve people's lives. This is where it's happening. This is where you'll help solve the problems that have never been solved. We're freeing information so it can be used safely and securely wherever it's needed. We're creating the very best ideas that can most easily be put into action to help our clients improve the quality of care and lower costs for millions. This is where the best and the brightest work together to make positive change a reality. This is the place to do your life's best work.(sm)  Colorado Residents Only: The salary range for Colorado residents is $79,700 to $142,600. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, etc. In addition to your salary, UnitedHealth Group offers benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). No matter where or when you begin a career with UnitedHealth Group, you’ll find a far-reaching choice of benefits and incentives. Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that's improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There's no room for error. Join us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)  The Senior Product Manager is responsible for managing virtual desktop capabilities and products, such as Citrix and VDI. These capabilities reside within the Connect, End User Technology portfolio. The Senior Product Manager will be accountable for managing these capabilities and products across the lifecycle. They will identify, define, analyze, prioritize, and refine requirements, user stories across multiple teams, and will communicate them to the Technology Delivery Teams. They will need to prioritize trade-offs, clarify requirements, user needs and accept user stories throughout the delivery process. They will work directly with various internal and external stakeholders, including senior staff and department managers, as well as with the delivery teams to ensure successful translation of requirements and user needs into high-quality solutions to be deployed across the enterprise.  You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.  Primary Responsibilities  Drives the capability / product vision, strategy, priority, and roadmap. Partners with the Capability / Product Director to inform broader strategies and roadmaps across Connect Engages appropriate enterprise-wide stakeholders to enable awareness and alignment Understands and leverages a Persona framework to identify needs, characteristics, patterns, behaviors to udnerstand end user / internal customer needs Builds, grooms and prioritizes the capability / product backlog(s). Creates and groom short, medium and long-term roadmaps and get internal agreement with key customers and stakeholders Collaborates with the Technology Delivery Teams to run successful Release Planning and Sprint Planning sessions, as well as Sprint Reviews and Retrospectives Produces features that provide business value, and are sized and defined for Sprint planning, and collaborate with engineers, development and operations teams to drive delivery, operations and support Establishes business value/outcome measures and metrics to measure outcomes after release; monitors and reports on progress Work with engineering teams to continuously improve product management and delivery processes Market, document and demonstrate features and functionality to End Users to address their use cases and needs Advocate and drive organizational change management activities to promote adoption of capabilities  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  B.S. or B.A. in a related field 3+ years of experience in technology / technical related product management 3+ years of working with delivery, product teams leveraging the Agile methodology 3+ years of driving customer engagement to inform a product strategy, roadmap and priorities Direct hands on experience with writing features, grooming capability / product backlogs and coordinating/prioritizing requirements in a fast paced, ever changing environment Knowledge of Agile development practices (especially Scrum or Kanban) methodologies and tools Ability to thoroughly understand complex business and technical issues and influence decision making at all levels of the organization without formal reporting structure authority  Preferred Qualifications  2+ years of product management experience with managing virtual desktop, workspace capabilities and technologies Experience with specific virtual technologies (ex, Citrix, VDI) Experience with managing product budgets and financials (business cases, financing modeling, etc.) Outstanding technical and non-technical communication skills Executive presence and adaptive formal and informal communication  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status. We are looking for passionate people to join our team; to help extend identity, authentication and consumer experience for our current 50 million users and beyond.  At your foundation you have a demonstrated ability to use hard data and metrics to back up assumptions and develop business cases while also solving complex problems. Your ability to keep business and strategic goals top of mind while prioritizing daily work needs is essential as you work to think strategically and execute methodically.  Roles within HSID support the launch of every new consumer product and experience across all business units and external partners. They review product performance against expectations and influence changes to the portfolio to improve our competitive position. They will work with internal and external stakeholders to ensure we offer the most seamless experience possible.  You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges. Create and accept user stories based on product requirements Define the cross platform UX and flows to unify and align the product suite. Improve user experience by using feedback from support and key partners and clients. Lead implementation of operational enhancements and assist in triaging incoming production defects.  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in. Job Title: Senior Product Manager, Incentives and Rewards - Telecommute
Description: Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that's improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There's no room for error. Join us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)  We're looking for a Senior Product Manager - Incentives and Rewards to bring new products and features across our lines of business. We value collaboration heavily; you'll work with other group leaders to execute on large-scale projects, and to help set the standards and processes that guide all of Platform Product. You'll report to the Sr. Manager, Product Management and work with Product Management, Engineering and business leaders/teams to support enterprise plans. We are looking for a software product management leader with experience building great software experiences for consumers and users. You will manage the activity of matrixed engineering teams to provide software products. This is an excellent opportunity for a Product Manager who has launched software products in an Agile environment across different modalities, including web, mobile, voice.  Primary Responsibilities  Guide a roadmap through the product life cycle of strategy, definition/requirements, delivery, and go-to-market Work across teams (e.g. engineering, product, design, sales, marketing, security, and legal) and build partnerships to solve myriad complex problems in creative, thoughtful, and scalable ways Oversee the development of your set of product features and determine which investments are most impactful to the business and why Use data to support hypotheses and conclusions, for developing business cases and roadmap priorities, and to inform the success of your products Contribute to a product culture of consumer and industry research, development, and rapid test and learn Stay on top of all relevant health care and consumer technology trends, competitors, and market offerings and ensure your products are outstanding  You'll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  3+ years of hands-on product management experience Experience working with engineers and designers to create great user experiences Experience with scrum and agile software development processes Technology experience: you don't need to code or draw an architecture diagram from scratch but you do need to know, and be able to explain, how your product works from a technology lens Natural curiosity and desire to find an answer Ability to explain decisions based on new information, insights, and the point of view of several audiences Ability to discuss technical concepts, articulate tradeoffs and propose new concepts to your squad and partners Impetus to start with consumer’s needs (jobs-to-be-done) and work backwards to solutions  Careers with Optum. Here's the idea. We built an entire organization around one giant objective; make health care work better for everyone. So when it comes to how we use the world's large accumulation of health-related information, or guide health and lifestyle choices or manage pharmacy benefits for millions, our first goal is to leap beyond the status quo and uncover new ways to serve. Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, brings together some of the greatest minds and most advanced ideas on where health care has to go in order to reach its fullest potential. For you, that means working on high performance teams against sophisticated challenges that matter. Optum, incredible ideas in one incredible company and a singular opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)  Colorado Residents Only: The salary range for Colorado residents is $94,500 to $171,700. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, etc. In addition to your salary, UnitedHealth Group offers benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). No matter where or when you begin a career with UnitedHealth Group, you’ll find a far-reaching choice of benefits and incentives.  Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.  UnitedHealth Group is a drug-free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment  Job Keywords: Senior Product Manager, Minneapolis, MN, Minnesota

Job Title: Senior Account Manager Client Service - Telecommute in Kentucky
Description: Great sales are the result of strong purpose, conviction, and pride - pride in your ability and your product. UnitedHealth Group offers a portfolio of products that are greatly improving the life of others. Bring along your passion and do your life's best work.(sm)  If you are located in Kentucky, you will have the flexibility to telecommute* as you take on some tough challenges.  Primary Responsibilities  Manages ongoing contract relationships and service delivery to Taft-Hartley clients for one or more accounts Acts as outward-facing, dedicated resource for assigned accounts, typically with direct client contact Builds relationships with employer/group clients and serves as the primary point of contact for overall and day-to-day service delivery Represents client internally and coordinates with other functions to implement client systems, complete projects, and address ongoing service needs Act as a liaison between the business, clients, and agents to drive identification and prioritization of business needs Development of client presentations and reports using Microsoft Publisher, PowerPoint, and Excel Obtain renewals and quotes with various carriers including stoploss, medical, pharmacy, Medicare supplements and fiduciary insurance. Ability to negotiate rates with carriers as necessary  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  Bachelor’s degree or equivalent or 4+ years of experience in related field including, accounting, sales, marketing, consulting, insurance, or account manager role 2+ year experience working with customers Experience with employee benefits or health insurance industry Licensed Insurance Agent in Health and Life in the state of Kentucky or ability to obtain within the first 60 days of employment Working knowledge of accounting concepts and the ability to read and present a financial statement in a client meeting Professional presentation experience both in-person and virtually Ability to travel 10% of the time - mostly day trips within the Kentucky/Ohio region Full COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement of this role. UnitedHealth Group will adhere to all federal, state and local regulations as well as all client requirements and will obtain necessary proof of vaccination prior to employment to ensure compliance  Preferred Qualifications  2+ years of experience in a Client Management, Account Management or Consultant role 2+ years of experience working Excel (sorting and organizing a spreadsheet, VLOOKUP, creating pivot tables, and manipulating files with large data) 1+ years of experience working with Microsoft Word and PowerPoint 1+ years of experience working with Adobe Acrobat Pro (extracting pages, highlighting, search, and working with applications within adobe) Experience with Taft-Hartley Union Accounts including trust fund administration, employee benefits and pensions Experience with fully insured and self-funded employers Previous experience which demonstrates the ability to work with a variety of professionals including attorneys, actuaries, employers, and consultants Ability to Translate highly complex concepts in ways that can be understood by a variety of audiences  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status.  Careers at UnitedHealthcare Employer & Individual. We all want to make a difference with the work we do. Sometimes we're presented with an opportunity to make a difference on a scale we couldn't imagine. Here, you get that opportunity every day. As a member of one of our elite teams, you'll provide the ideas and solutions that help nearly 25 million customers live healthier lives. You'll help write the next chapter in the history of health care. And you'll find a wealth of open doors and career paths that will take you as far as you want to go. Go further. This is your life's best work.(sm)  All Telecommuters will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy. Job Title: Senior Account Manager Client Services - Telecommute
Description: Optum is a company that's on the rise. We're expanding in multiple directions, across borders and, most of all, in the way we think. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about transforming the health care industry. Ready to make a difference? Make yourself at home with us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)  The Senior Account Manager Client Services manages ongoing contract relationships and service delivery to clients for one or more accounts. Acts as outward-facing, dedicated resource for assigned accounts, typically with direct client contact (not call center) and large or complex accounts. Builds relationships with employer/group clients (not individual members) and serves as the primary point of contact for overall and day-to-day service delivery. Represents client internally and coordinates with other functions to implement client systems, complete projects, and address ongoing service needs. This function includes employees who are in dedicated on-site service roles. Jobs in this function may work closely with sales on renewals and upselling, but incumbents do not have specific sales goal accountability or primary responsibility to close sales. Account management jobs focused primarily on relationship and service management belong in this family; jobs with significant sales responsibilities or sales-related incentives (including 'OTH' plans) belong in a sales band.  You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.  Primary Responsibilities  Reviews the work of others Develops innovative approaches Sought out as expert Serves as a leader/ mentor  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  Bachelor’s degree in business administration or a related field from a four-year college or university and/or 4+ years of related experience 5+ years of experience with Pharmacy benefits Implementation guidelines 5+ years of PBM and client management (business to business services) experience for low to mid-tier companies (5000 employees) Experience using RxClaim to validate claims and service delivery of Pharmacy Benefits Ability to use MS Excel to create basic spreadsheets; sort, filter, import/export data, create charts and graphs, and use basic formulas, and internal Analytics programs Ability to use MS PowerPoint to create and modify presentations Experience with renewal strategies and upsells Ability to work core business hours and have the flexibility to adjust their schedule to accommodate occasional overtime Ability to travel up to 25% as needed  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status.  Careers with OptumRx. We're one of the largest and most innovative pharmacy benefits managers in the US, serving more than 12 million people nationwide. Here you'll fill far more than prescriptions. As a member of one of our pharmacy teams, you're empowered to be your best and do whatever it takes to help each customer. You'll find unrivaled support and training as well as a wealth of growth and development opportunities driven by your performance and limited only by your imagination. Join us. There's no better place to help people live healthier lives while doing your life's best work.(sm)  Colorado, Connecticut or Nevada Residents Only: The salary range for Colorado residents is $79,700 to $142,600. The salary range for Connecticut/Nevada residents is $87,900 to $156,900. It's an opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)The Senior Business Systems Analyst is responsible for creating and refining business and systems requirements to address business opportunities and formulating documentation to support the development and implementation of the technical solution. Job Title: Senior Product Analyst, Specialty Product Manager Telecommute
Description: UnitedHealth Group is working to create the health care system of tomorrow. We are totally focused on innovation and change. We work a little harder. We aim a little higher. We expect more from ourselves and each other. And at the end of the day, we're doing a lot of good.  Through our family of businesses and a lot of inspired individuals, we're building a high-performance health care system that works better for more people in more ways than ever. Now we're looking to reinforce our team with people who are decisive, brilliant - and built for speed.  Come to UnitedHealth Group and share your ideas and your passion for doing more. We have roles that will fit your skills and knowledge. We have diverse opportunities that will fit your dreams.  The Specialty Product Analyst leads our agile scrum team developing key capabilities on the Call Center CRM platform for Specialty Infusion Products and Programs at OptumRx. The Specialty Product Analyst owns, maintains, and prioritizes the backlog for the development scrum team. They share the product vision and works closely with the Product Manager to ensure the team delivers value to the business.  The Specialty Product Analyst will closely work with operation and business to identify any issues, monitor, and come up with a solution to mitigate it.  You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.  Primary Responsibilities  Develop implementation strategy, product development roadmap and backlog for emerging technology products in collaboration with stakeholders and senior leadership Manage product planning and development through day-to-day collaboration and decision making within cross-functional agile teams including architects, developers, designers and business or subject matter representatives Generate or contribute to all product, project, and platform artifacts for product development and management (business cases, product showcases, user stories, requirements, flow document) Collect voice of customer feedback and perform data-driven prioritization of features that meet business needs; set minimal viable product releases Promote Agile product management processes, and develop detailed presentations, requirements, project plans and use cases accounting for all scenarios of a product release Responsible for defining the acceptance criteria of a product feature Monitor technical performance throughout product development and partner with Engineering to ensure acceptance criteria is met Work with engineering and QA to align on feature sizing and delivery planning Perform validation of feature against customer and business goals and acceptance criteria Identify, develop, and document a timeline around dependencies and constraints Stay abreast of new emerging technology capabilities and leverage knowledge in contributing to product solutions Perform any additional duties as assigned. Travel not required  Competencies  Comfortable creating features and prioritize based on the business need Shares and decomposes Features into user stories (non-technical) Be able to process map the business/operation and find opportunities for improvements Be the liaison between the business and technology Experience in working with Agile/Scrum work environment as a Specialty Product Analyst: writing user stories, and following the development process through user story acceptance Working knowledge of Medical/Pharmacy benefits and process Experience with Call Center / Contact Center management tools and capabilities Candidate must have excellent verbal and written communication, organizational, time management, and interpersonal skills. Ability to multi-task, manage multiple priorities, and prioritize appropriately to meet strict deadlines is essential. Excellent interpersonal, management, organizational, analytical, planning, presentation, communication, and written skills. Demonstrated ability to message, position, and present information for maximum patient/provider impact and influence Ability to understand, research, and resolve key issues and problems. Ability to achieve positive and successful results in a fast-paced changing environment Receives general objectives and operates with limited independence.  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  Bachelor’s Degree or 3+ or more years of Specialty Pharmacy and/or Infusion Management experience Minimum 3 years of experience in business analysis and/or product owner in an agile environment Experience systematically analyzing problems, drawing relevant conclusions, and devising appropriate courses of action Working knowledge of MS office suite (build a PowerPoint deck, navigate Excel & create basic formulas)  Preferred Qualifications  Experience working in an Agile environment Experience utilizing Visio for process mapping Ability to create and manage cost/benefit analysis Intermediate proficiency with product management software AHA!  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status.  Careers with OptumRx. We're one of the largest and most innovative pharmacy benefits managers in the US, serving more than 12 million people nationwide. Here you'll fill far more than prescriptions. As a member of one of our pharmacy teams, you're empowered to be your best and do whatever it takes to help each customer. You'll find unrivaled support and training as well as a wealth of growth and development opportunities driven by your performance and limited only by your imagination. Join us. There's no better place to help people live healthier lives while doing your life's best work.(sm)  Colorado Residents Only: The salary/hourly range for Colorado residents is $64,800 to $116,000. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, etc. As of the date of this posting, In addition to your salary, UHG offers the following benefits for this position, subject to applicable eligibility requirements: Health, dental, and vision plans; wellness program; flexible spending accounts; paid parking or public transportation costs; 401(k) retirement plan; employee stock purchase plan; life insurance, short-term disability insurance, and long-term disability insurance; business travel accident insurance; Employee Assistance Program; PTO; and employee-paid critical illness and accident insurance.  All Telecommuters will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy.  Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.  UnitedHealth Group is a drug - free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.  Job Keywords: Senior Product Analyst, Telecommute

Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that's improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There's no room for error. Join us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)  As a ETL Architect for the State of New York All Payer Database (APD) Project, you will be responsible for managing delivery of all Informatica components of a multi-Terabyte Oracle Exadata environment that will contain public and private health care claims and encounter data from insurance carriers, health plans, third-party administrators, pharmacy benefit managers, Medicaid and Medicare. Data will be synthesized to support the management, evaluation, and analysis of the NYS health care system. This project is comprehensive to the Informatica product suite in that it includes not only PowerCenter, but also Test Data Manager, Master data Management and Data Quality components of the solution. This is a hands-on technical role accountable for optimizing and successfully delivering all components of the Informatica solution.  Primary Responsibilities  Install, upgrade and patch Informatica components of the NY APD solution so that the environment remains current Implement procedures to maintain, monitor, backup and recovery operations of the ETL environment so that the environment is reliable and highly available through time Define Informatica workflow and mapping standards so that development is done in a consistent manner across all development resources (I,e, no hard coding, leverage of maplett / reuse concepts) Conduct ETL optimization, troubleshooting and debugging Designs and develops test plans for ETL unit testing and integration testing Tune and optimize ETL jobs for performance and throughput. Interact with data modelers and DBAs on data architecture optimization for ETL performance Provide development support, including walk through approvals, to other ETL application resources to insure that standards are followed and optimized workflow is implemented Advocate and enforce secure coding principles, as defined by State of New York coding policies, to insure we are in compliance with all NYS standards Document and maintain operational procedures in the form of an operations manual for all ETL workflow Lead troubleshooting efforts for ETL job issues related to pre-production and production Leverage Informatica Data Quality as a mandatory process step for profiling data prior to downstream transformation Designs and develops data validation processes using Informatica Data Quality. Designs and develop exception and error handling through data governance so that data stewardship is leveraged to assist with anomalies Create PL/SQL stored procedures, functions and packages for moving the data between staging areas Monitor and recommend changes if required to all PL/ SQL packages and provide stored procedures and design and develop various relational database Develop Complex database objects like Stored Procedures, Functions, Packages and Triggers using SQL and PL/SQL Create Packages and Procedures to automatically drop table indexes and create indexes for the tables  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  3+ years of experience with Informatica Powercenter 3+ years of experience with SQL and PL/SQL 2+ years of experience with LINUX/UNIX Scripting 1+ years of experience with Informatica Data Quality Strong knowledge of regulatory security requirements regarding HIPAA and other regulatory security requirements Full COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement of this role. UnitedHealth Group will adhere to all federal, state and local regulations as well as all client requirements and will obtain necessary proof of vaccination prior to employment to ensure compliance  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status. Job Title: Senior Case Manager RN - Oldsmar or Tampa, FL
Description: UnitedHealthcare is a company that's on the rise. We're expanding in multiple directions, across borders and, most of all, in the way we think. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about transforming the health care industry. Ready to make a difference? Make yourself at home with us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)  Senior Case Managers are RNs who serve as a key member of the UnitedHealthcare Global Emergency Response Center Team and utilize evidenced based practice to assess global traveler’s medical care needs, treatment plans of healthcare providers and the ability of the local healthcare systems to provide appropriate quality and cost effective care when acute, chronic or catastrophic events occur in countries around the world. The RNs evaluate, recommend and monitor patient status and associated treatment plans to ensure complex medical cases are managed to the highest level of quality and patient safety. RNs coordinate with appropriate providers and assist in establishing and implementing plans including but not limited to a patient’s medical monitoring, return home, and safe evacuation to a location where appropriate care is available when it’s determined the care needs cannot be met in the current location.  RNs establish a good relationship with the hospital, doctors, social workers gaining their trust and respect to facilitate the collection of information and improve the image of the company and patient care. RNs document all conversations with providers and physicians, medical records review and any patient care related phone call to ensure information is available to all team members for continuity and care management. The nurse identifies and escalates potentially fraudulant activities identified during the pre-authorization evaluation process. Complex and high cost cases are uniquely reported, monitored and supported through the collaboration with all members of the Emergency Response Team to include: Medical Directors, GCCs, Healthcare Navigators and Healthcare Intelligence team members to facilitate seamless provision of healthcare services to those we serve.  Primary Responsibilities  Managing global assistance cases Collaborating with interdisciplinary team members (eg: logistical and healthcare intelligence) as appropriate on case work Collaborating with Medical Directors and Physician Advisors when appropriate Triage global medical cases, complete clinical assessment and communication of case direction to the logistics specialists to facilitate the necessary evacuation or continued monitoring of care being provided locally Works collaboratively with international and domestic healthcare providers and internal colleagues to assure appropriate high quality cost-effective care management, proactive discharge and medically safe travel planning, optimize patient health Participates in the management of complex medical cases and collation of clinical information to assess and expedite assessment of care needs. This includes obtaining and reviewing verbal and written medical reports / records as well as communicating directly with the treating facilities and providers Engages in provider and facility quality assurance review as determined by business need  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  Holds active licensure in the United States as a Registered Nurse Bachelor’s degree (BSN) or equivalent experience 3+ years of critical acute care clinical experience including but not limited to ER, ICU, critical care, trauma, triage and/or international travel nursing experience Proficient in medical terminology Proficient with Microsoft Word and Excel including online computer systems for data entry, research and information gathering Ability to work 8 - 10 hour shifts including every other weekend and holidays as dictated by needs of business in a 24/7 environment Full COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement of this role. UnitedHealth Group will adhere to all federal, state and local regulations as well as all client requirements and will obtain necessary proof of vaccination prior to employment to ensure compliance.  Preferred Qualifications  Experience and/or broad medical knowledge in medical assistance business, experience in aeromedical, flight attendant, military flight nursing, cruise line, air medical transport, and/or international travel nursing International travel experience with awareness and understanding of the variation in cultures and the challenges of healthcare delivery in the global arena and the potential impact on the health and safety of travelers Familiarity with evidence-based practice guidelines Second language proficiency (Spanish, French, Portuguese or other)  Soft Skills  Problem Solving - Ability to identify and resolve problems quickly, gathers and analyzes information skillfully; develops alternative solutions; works well in group problem solving situations; uses reason when dealing with emotional topics Interpersonal skills - Focuses on solving conflict, maintains confidentiality; listens to others without interrupting; keeps emotions under control, remains open to others’ ideas and tries new things. Demonstrates strong customer service; includes managing difficult situations Works well in multidisciplinary team environments and is comfortable working independently Synthesizes complex or diverse information from multiple information sources. Uses intuition and clinical experience to complement data to create greater understanding of a likely scenario Excellent Communication Skills, ability to communicate complex information in spoken and written English in a simple clear format to both clinical and non-clinical audiences. Writes clearly and informatively  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status.  Careers with UnitedHealthcare. Let's talk about opportunity. Start with a Fortune 5 organization that's serving more than 85 million people already and building the industry's singular reputation for bold ideas and impeccable execution. Now, add your energy, your passion for excellence, your near-obsession with driving change for the better. Get the picture? UnitedHealthcare is serving employers and individuals, states and communities, military families and veterans where ever they're found across the globe. We bring them the resources of an industry leader and a commitment to improve their lives that’s second to none. This is no small opportunity. It's where you can do your life's best work.(sm)  Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. You will obtain expertise in the claim-based workflows and will serve as a consulting resource for our clients and internal partners. Job Title: Senior Clinical Services Manager - Pacific Northwest
Description: Join us for the Optum Pacific Northwest Nurse Practitioner & Physician Assistant Virtual Career Event – October 27th, 11-1pm PT – Click Here to Register Now!  Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that's improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There's no room for error. Join us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)  Optum is the nation’s largest health and wellness business and a vibrant, growing member of the UnitedHealth Group family. We’re also the career home for Nurse Practitioners who bring compassion and passion, energy and focus to their work every day.  Optum wants to help make health care work better for everyone. That mission depends upon hiring the best and most compassionate team with a heart to serve and a drive to improve health outcomes. Millions of people place their trust in our clinicians and caregivers to get the right care at the right time.  UnitedHealth Group and Optum have a shared sense of purpose to improve the lives of those we serve while building our competencies and knowledge.  The Senior Clinical Services Manager in Orgon oversees Complex Care Management IESNP program which provides primary care in Assisted Living Facilities.  Primary Responsibilities  Leading and directing all clinical functions to ensure optimal performance Implement strategic business savvy clinical enhancements Drive growth and innovation through product discipline Improve cost, quality, productivity, and value of services we deliver Engage, cultivate, and deepen customer relationships Foster efforts to increase employee engagement Implement national best practice models regionally Manage and develop a team of clinicians Timely recruitment of clinical talent Workforce management: Manage the demands of a rapidly changing staffing environment with resilience; analyzes and makes fact-based decisions utilizing forecasting model Perform yearly common reviews and continually manage performance Regular meetings and collaboration with supporting departments to ensure operational efficiency Develop strategies to increase job satisfaction and reduce turnover rates Identify key talent and provide opportunities for professional growth and career advancement Assure staff receives the appropriate orientation, training, and ongoing professional development Mentor and support for Clinical Team Managers and Complex Care Management Practitioners Work with Training and Development to develop education and training for the clinical teams Assuring performance adheres with established quality standards, evidenced based practice guidelines and departmental benchmarks and workflows Oversee IESNP to ensure clinically appropriate outcomes as defined by corporate goals, industry standards, and HEDIS measures. Ensure enterprise, department, HIPAA, and regulatory compliance: Maintaining security of Protected Health Information (PHI) and Intellectual Property (IP) Represents the Complex Care Management team in a positive, solution focused manner that embodies our corporate values: Integrity, Compassion, Relationships, Innovation and Performance Minimum 25% travel  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  Successful completion of a master’s degree in Nursing, Nurse Practitioner certification preferred 5+ years of clinical experience 3+ years management and leadership experience Full COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement of this role. UnitedHealth Group will adhere to all federal, state and local regulations as well as all client requirements and will obtain necessary proof of vaccination prior to employment to ensure compliance  Preferred Qualifications  Nurse Practitioner certification Proficiency in Microsoft Office products and applications Excellent organizational and administrative skills Experience in a long-term care setting Experience in working within a managed care environment Excellent customer service skills and ability to negotiate and collaborate with others Sound written and verbal communication: Clearly expresses ideas, but is tactfully sensitive to opposing viewpoints  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status. Job Title: Senior Financial Consultant / FP&A Manager - Eden Prairie, MN or Telecommute
Description: Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that's improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There's no room for error. Join us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)  This role is a crucial central point of our Optum Corporate FP&A process. The role partners extensively with all Optum Corporate FP&A team members, as well as finance leads from all of the Optum segments. This is the opportunity to gain extensive knowledge and exposure across our Optum businesses. The role manages the financial consolidation of Optum Corporate financials: including forecasts, month-end reporting, ad-hoc leadership analyses, etc. In addition, the role focuses heavily on ideation and implementation of Optum Corporate process innovation efforts related to reporting, forecast processes, system usage, etc.  You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.  Primary Responsibilities  Interface with business leaders and build relationships in support of financial planning and performance measurement including reporting and analysis Partner with business leaders to evaluate investment opportunities and cost savings initiatives to maximize resources and create efficiencies Present forecast results to leadership Collaborate with cross-functional teams in conjunction with budgeting and forecasting process Manage business relationship on behalf of the broader Finance organization and Leadership Leverage new technology and carry out process improvement activities  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications  Undergraduate degree in Finance, Accounting, or related field 4+ years of relevant financial analysis, financial consolidation, or FP&A experience Relevant experience partnering with senior leadership and solid communication skills Advanced skills in MS Excel and MS Office product suite Experience working in a matrix environment while positively influencing other functional areas  Preferred Qualifications  Experience presenting financial forecast findings and results to senior leadership Financial consolidation experience in a highly matrixed environment Process improvement experience Healthcare experience Experience with financial systems: Hyperion Essbase, MPWR, PowerBI, or other related tools Ability to innovate and identify process improvement opportunities Full COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement of this role. UnitedHealth Group will adhere to all federal, state and local regulations as well as all client requirements and will obtain necessary proof of vaccination prior to employment to ensure compliance  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status.
